story:
Why should I support The Pale Horse?

Ryan Fleck and Immanuel Baldwin have created the immersive world of The Pale Horse, which centers on two intertwining story lines.

Through lucid and detailed storytelling, Fleck and Baldwin guide viewers into some of the darker corners of humanity while focusing on the questions of mortality that human beings have been asking since time immemorial. Using their unique perspective, they have managed to put a unique twist into the story which will have viewers questioning the separation of fiction and reality.

Nelson Oliveras and his independent media company, T.O. Media, will be producing the film, and they aim to breath life into it and give this story the stage it deserves. The Pale Horse will bring together Milwaukee and Chicago area film-making creatives on a mission to not only gain awareness for these local scenes, but also to bring to life a film that will keep the audience hanging on and wanting more long after the credits roll. Our mission is to execute this film in such a way that it is indistinguishable from top tier union work. 
How do we accomplish this?
By hiring a crew of professionals and paying them scale rate for the work that they do, taking what we have learned in film school and applying it on a grand scale, and staying true to the underlying creative direction of our story. We have a specific vision for the film which can only be fully realized if we have the budget to properly execute it.

Meet a few members of our Cast 

David Rothrock: Ezra Redfield IMDB

David Rothrock is a Milwaukee-based actor and graduate of UW-Milwaukee’s BFA Acting program. He has been acting and directing in Milwaukee for the past eight years and has worked with several theater companies in the area, including Youngblood and World’s Stage Theatres. Notable roles include Matt in Adam Rapp’s Red Light Winter and Puck from A Midsummer Night’s Dream . From Sturgeon Bay, WI, David has been acting since he was 15 and spent a summer as the youngest actor Door Shakespeare Theatre has ever worked with. Film roles include Deliver This!, The Devil’s Moira: Gambit, and Motorheads , all in the MIlwaukee area.

Samantha Paige: Allison Redfield IMDB  
Samantha Paige has been in the Performing Arts for over fifteen years, trained as a classical dancer, vocalist, and actor. She’s been seen in numerous plays and musicals throughout Southeastern Wisconsin, as well as choreographed a number of them, and had the opportunity to direct a few. Some favorite roles include Sally Bowles in Cabaret, Stella in A Streetcar Named Desire, and Hedy in How To Succeed in Business Without Really Trying. Favorite choreography projects include The Producers, Dirty, Rotten Scoundrels, and Reefer Madness. Behind the scenes, she works as a youth Musical Theater instructor, dance teacher, and is a Cosmetology student at The Aveda Institute of Beauty and Wellness.
Max Wannow: Alastair IMDB 
Max Wannow started acting at his hometown theater in Hartford, Wisconsin. Coming into college, he started screen acting in his university's TV shows and then moved onto acting in short films funded by UW Oshkosh, UW Milwaukee, and the Milwaukee Art Institute. His most recent accomplishment was acting in an independent short film, "A Dubious Night", that was accepted into the Short Film Corner for Festival de Cannes, the Los Angeles Independent Film Festival, and has been awarded the "Award of Merit" in the black and white film category at the San Francisco Film Awards.
Rex  Steven Sikes: Isom Leland IMDB
Rex Sikes works as a producer, UPM/Line producer, production manager, director, 1stAD and is a  professional actor. A partial list of credits is on IMDB. He speaks to the film community on what to do and what not to do to get your film, TV or web project made on time and under budget. He addresses how producers, directors, cast & crew need to work and interact in order to have the smoothest shoot possible. Res is an acting and presentation coach - directing and assisting people to give their most talented performances and presentations.
Meet the Team
Nelson Oliveras: Producer IMDB

Graduated from ITT Technical Institute with an Associate Degree in Visual  Communications. He developed skills in 3D modeling, graphic design, and animation. Having always been interested in film, he originally attended ITT to become a game designer, but after having discovered the Art Institute of Wisconsin Digital Film department, he finally began to follow his original dream of becoming a filmmaker.

Immanuel Baldwin: Creator/Director IMDB

Having been in love with film since a very young age,  Immanuel has always wanted to work in the film industry. He took it upon himself to acquire the knowledge he needed to make that dream a reality. He was always able to share his thoughts in vivid detail, so directing seemed like it was the right choice, but not before acquiring skills in multiple departments on numerous films, both independent and union. He has experience in assistant directing and producing. This will be the second film Immanuel has directed.

James Raber: 1st Assistant Director IMDB

James Raber graduated from Miami Dade College with a degree in Film Production. He has written a short film, Glass, that was featured in the Nashville International Film Festival, worked in the camera and lighting department on the independent short Victim,  and more recently completed production on his own project, The Nightmare Box. James also worked in the extras casting department on the Starz television series Magic City as well as casting on a Samsung commercial starring LeBron James.

Logan Stone: Director of Photography IMDB

Logan  Stone has worked in film full time since graduating from DePaul University‘s School of Digital Cinema in downtown Chicago. Whether directing or operating as Director of Photography, Logan has a sharp eye for breathtaking cinematic moments and engaging visual storytelling. Having founded Cinestone, a film production company based in downtown Chicago, Logan has gone on to direct, produce, and film numerous movies and TV pilots in the Chicago area and has made a name for himself in the film industry as a young talent on the rise. Logan’s photography and film work have been featured in the RAW Artist Chicago showcases and his film was selected “Best Of” the 2014 Chicago 48 Hour Film Contest and also took home the “Best Actor” award.

Johnny Imbres: Production Designer IMDB

Johnny Imbres is a Film Production Designer. A trained art director and wardrobe stylist from Miami, he began his career working for various fashion companies and designers in print and commercial advertising. Following his love of aesthetics and the silver screen, Johnny merged into Chicago‘s growing film scene. He is here to direct the art department and define visual aspects of the film.

Jules Fleming: Key Makeup IMDB

Jules Fleming has over two decades of experience in the makeup industry. Using both traditional and airbrush makeup applications, her work exhibits an astonishing level of creativity and innovation and has been included in national commercial campaigns, movies, television, special effects, web series, runway shows, charity and private events, weddings, headshots, and many other occasions where exceptional makeup was a must. Jules finds inspiration locally and globally, from the hottest trends in Miami and Chicago to the colors and textures of the Far East. Jules works to connect the most individual aspects of every person and culture to her art in a way that is cohesive and unique.


What We Need

Production Essentials :

  • SAG - AFTRA scale pay
  • Crew Payment 
  •  Camera Package
  •  Camera Support
  •  Grip Packages
  •  Electrical Kit
  •  Anamorphic Lense Kit
  • Art Department Purchases
  •   Props
  •   Clothing
  •   Beauty Makeup
  •   SFX Makeup
  •   Visual Aesthetic
  •   Set Design
  • Room and Board for Crew and Talent
  • Food and Craft Services for 11 shooting days
  • Warehouse/Studio Rental 

As a gestural incentive to those who contribute, the following is offered:

Your partnership with us allows T.O. Media Group and The Pale Horse to represent you in the following ways:

·  T.O. Media has a good track record when it comes to professionalism and creativity. Our projects speak for themselves.

·  Our most recent work has been gaining substantial awareness in the festival circuit.

·  We want our projects to operate on a larger scale and reach bigger target audiences. The Pale Horse is a good way to extend reach from a business/product relations standpoint.
story_txt:
Why should I support The Pale Horse? 
Ryan Fleck and
Immanuel Baldwin have created the immersive world of The Pale Horse, which
centers on two intertwining story lines. 
Through lucid and
detailed storytelling, Fleck and Baldwin guide viewers into some of the darker
corners of humanity while focusing on the questions of mortality that human
beings have been asking since time immemorial. Using their unique perspective, they
have managed to put a unique twist into the story which will have viewers
questioning the separation of fiction and reality.
Nelson Oliveras and his independent media
company, T.O. Media, will be producing the film, and they aim to breath life into it and give this story the stage it deserves. The
Pale Horse will bring together Milwaukee and Chicago area film-making creatives
on a mission to not only gain awareness for these local scenes, but also to
bring to life a film that will keep the audience hanging on and wanting more long after the
credits roll. Our mission is to execute this film in such a way
that it is indistinguishable from top tier union work. How do we accomplish
this?By hiring a crew of professionals and paying them scale rate for the work
that they do, taking what we have learned in film school and applying it on a
grand scale, and staying true to the underlying creative direction of our
story. We have a specific vision for the film which
can only be fully realized if we have the budget to properly execute it. 
Meet a few members of our Cast 

David Rothrock: Ezra Redfield IMDB
David Rothrock is a Milwaukee-based actor and graduate of UW-Milwaukee’s BFA Acting program. He has been acting and directing in Milwaukee for the past eight years and has worked with several theater companies in the area, including Youngblood and World’s Stage Theatres. Notable roles include Matt in Adam Rapp’s Red Light Winter and Puck from A Midsummer Night’s Dream . From Sturgeon Bay, WI, David has been acting since he was 15 and spent a summer as the youngest actor Door Shakespeare Theatre has ever worked with. Film roles include Deliver This!, The Devil’s Moira: Gambit, and Motorheads , all in the MIlwaukee area.
Samantha Paige: Allison Redfield IMDB  

Samantha Paige has been in the Performing Arts for over fifteen years, trained as a classical dancer, vocalist, and actor.  She’s been seen in numerous plays and musicals throughout Southeastern Wisconsin, as well as choreographed a number of them, and had the opportunity to direct a few.  Some favorite roles include Sally Bowles in Cabaret, Stella in A Streetcar Named Desire, and Hedy in How To Succeed in Business Without Really Trying.  Favorite choreography projects include The Producers, Dirty, Rotten Scoundrels, and Reefer Madness.  Behind the scenes, she works as a youth Musical Theater instructor, dance teacher, and is a Cosmetology student at The Aveda Institute of Beauty and Wellness.

Max Wannow: Alastair IMDB 

Max Wannow started acting at his hometown theater in Hartford, Wisconsin. Coming into college, he started screen acting in his university's TV shows and then moved onto acting in short films funded by UW Oshkosh, UW Milwaukee, and the Milwaukee Art Institute. story:
Olá! My name is Taylor Moore, I am a professional landscape and architectural photographer.
I have spent the last two years traveling throughout the mountainside of the UNESCO World Heritage village of Sintra, Portugal. Within my adventure I had started photographing the mysterious and magical site of Quinta da Regaleira. 

At Regaleira I have teetered over the edge of palace walls, gotten soaked to the bare bone, been lost in the deepest of caves, and have even been marooned on isolated crags way off the beaten path; all in my pursuit of the perfect photograph. Now it is time for me to share this unique book with you.

About the Photographer:

I have been a photographer since I was 7 years old.
In July 2014, I opened a photography gallery SintraMagic right across from the Quinta da Regaleira. In January 2015 the Sintra Municipal Civic Council published an article about my work. I had an article on BoredPanda.com showcasing some of my photographs. In June of 2015 I will have a dream fulfilled, by having an article with my photographs of Quinta da Regaleira in Architectural Digest Italia.

After two years and over 70,000 photographs I am ready to release a book that I can be truly proud of. "Quinta da Regaleira: A Book of Light and Shadows" will contain more than 80 stunning photographs of the UNESCO Heritage site of Quinta da Regaleira. 

The book design is completed - all the images have been selected and the layout has been finished. The photographs were chosen to provide a unique range of scenes that blend elegantly with each other. The book flows beautifully, and I am  very excited about it, and can't wait to see it come to life in print.


Now this is where you come in. I'm seeking funds to pay the printing costs. 300 copies of the book will be printed in hardcover with 120 high-definition pages. There is a section at the back which details the technical information about each image. There is one large photograph per page, and several double page spreads featuring panoramic images.

The Rewards: 
Any contribution puts your name in the acknowledgment section of the book.
Signed Copies of the book
Large prints on Artist Canvas
Hand written and mailed postcards/artcards


This is an incredibly unique book. There has never been any book published that showcases the majesty and classical beauty of Quinta da Regaleira in photographic form. 

Risks and challenges

By backing this project, you'll help me to achieve a life-long dream, but you'll also be helping yourself! Over on the right side of the page are a list of the items and experiences I'm offering for your support. I've designed the pledge levels to give you excellent value. In each case the combined retail value greatly exceeds the amount you pledge to receive it.

If you can't pledge, please share this project with your friends and family, and with your social networks on Facebook and Twitter. 

Thanks for your support, in any amount! Obrigado!

story:
Breve reseña

Este es un proyecto audiovisual que surge de un trabajo de fin de carrera de la RESAD ( La universidad de arte dramático de Madrid) La idea es crear una película musical interpretada por tres actrices que se gradúan  de la escuela.  Es dirigida y escrita por Leonardo Pérez, un cineasta cubano quien ha obtenido varios premios por su trabajo como realizador.
La historia cuenta como un padre tiene que recuperar la comunicación perdida con sus hijas a través de un nuevo lenguaje. A través de la música. 
Es la primera obra audiovisual que se acepta en la RESAD como trabajo de graduación. Es importante realizarla con los mejores recursos técnicos para alcanzar el impacto deseado. Será un trabajo que marcará un antes y un después. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

No es mucho lo que nos falta para alcanzar el sueño porque se han conseguido grandes cosas solamente con la voluntad de algunos profesionales del cine. Ya tenemos la música, los actores, las localizaciones, el fotógrafo, los sonidistas, el montador y el equipo de arte y vestuario.

Lo que pedimos es para cubrir los gastos que se generan en un rodaje: catering, alquiler de equipo de cámara, steadycam, iluminación y transportación. Toda ayuda va contribuir con estos gastos, incluso si no se logra el total.

Que te ofrecemos a cambio.

 Que seas colaborador especial o  productor asociado gozando de algunas recompensas que ofrecemos aquí.

El impacto

Será el primer cortometraje en España, en el que se retoma el género musical con toda la construcción profesional que lleva un trabajo de esta magnitud. Se ha grabado la música en el conservatorio de Atocha bajo la creación de músicos y cantantes de esas universidades. Una historia que apuesta por este singular estilo en un cuento corto. Así que sabemos que va a llegar a difundirse ampliamente debido a la originalidad y novedad del proyecto, pero sobretodo, lo más importante es la historia que se nos contará. Una historia salida desde el alma de sus artistas que espera llegar y tocar la parte humana de los espectadores.

Riesgos y desafíos

Siempre detrás de una obra, de una creación existe el riesgo de lanzarse a lo desconocido, sobretodo si es una obra poco común. Nuestro único desafío es hacerla tal y como la imaginamos en nuestros corazones para que la historia llegue a muchos rincones del mundo. Si eso es logrado, ya nos damos por satisfechos y realizados. ¡Gracias a todos por ayudarnos!

story:
The Story

So my name is Andre Bright and I have 2 careers, Sustainable architecture, and dance (I know what you’re thinking - “Often heard in the same sentence” haha!). It means my mind is just as academic and logical as it is creative.

As a dancer, I know first-hand it can be hard to find classes, but even harder to fill them as a teacher (You have no idea!!)

But an experience on a family holiday gave me an idea.

There I was looking for hip hop dance classes in its birthplace. New York! My first visit and did I know where to go!? Not a clue. So I did what anyone would do in my situation looking for authentic hip hop dance classes in New York. I tried google! And what I found was nothing. Furious. Only when I came back to London did I hear of all the workshops I could have attended. Why? Because only those who were friends with the teachers on Facebook, knew them personally, or heard through word of mouth knew about these events. None of the teachers had a website, maximised SEO, or put money into advertising!

Skip forward 2 years and I accompany a friend to a tech jam where programmers gather to chat about ideas. I get talking and an idea formed - an app that works like Tinder but for classes! You can see what classes are in your radius! Even better, one that also works like Twitter! You can follow your teachers and get notifications when they create a new one, and invite your friends to one so you don't risk going alone!

I know. I would love to use something like this too!  The idea has developed since then! But it gets even better!

Not just dance. 

Not just London!

What if you could go on holiday to Tunisia and find a cooking class near your hotel? Or a scuba diving class in Mauritius! All with a few clicks of an app!?

So in short, I want to make that happen.

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised will cover the development of the app, but also the first push of marketing to get international businesses onto it so when launched, it's full of all kinds of classes, wherever you may be!

I’m asking for £10’000. £6’468 will go towards the actual building of the app itself as per an invoice from my developer (http://www.simonkwilliams.com/).

Most of the target audience of those who will want to download an app to book classes would already be online in some fashion, so I will be using pay-per-click strategies to target local communities and niche markets.

I will also use it to increase my virtual assistant's commitment from part time to full time so she can really reach far into the market using tasks I have already designed. These cover advertising campaigns through schools, universities and companies online through social media and personal websites.

Finally, I will use it to cover a soft launch at the beginning of August where I will get a testing group together (those who commit to the ‘Trial Group’ perk) to use the app, test it and send feedback to the developers for them to fix. Then I will hold a main launch at the beginning of September where I would like to hold an event in London where people use the app to check into classes on the week of release.

If I don’t reach the goal of £10K, I would at least like enough to cover the development so it is available for people to use and share but in this case, there may not be a main launch event as planned.

In return for your generous donations, rewards range from an email as soon as it's available for download on the app store and google play, to having Find Me A Class available to you at the end of a phone catering to your needs for a year! AND be part of the trial group so you can be the first to try it! If you are a teacher or company that holds classes, we suggest the ’12 month premium account’ perk for £15. Incredible value!

The Impact

Since I am one of few professional dancers in the industry of sustainable architecture, I am constantly asked where people can learn to dance and off the top of my head, I can usually suggest a number of classes close to them that they would otherwise not know existed. Often I would tell a friend I am interested in learning something and they would be able to tell me about a Spanish tutor on my street or a driving instructor in my neighbourhood. Even a popup cooking class near my workplace.

The concept is that all those people that are being missed from the marketing of these classes will fall to us, and that will be our focus. If we can connect the people to the classes, we can increase attendance which is better for business, but also better for those attending who can learn something and do it socially.

We are already doing this on a smaller scale via social media.

We receive thanks for teachers who say they had an extra 3 people in class who found them through the Facebook group or someone asked where they can find a class in Cambridge and we happened to have a teacher in the group who responded. We already have users from Germany, USA and China. China!

We want to continue having this impact but on a much larger scale.

Risks & Challenges

This is my first venture of its kind for me and I'm doing it solo so bound to have stumbling blocks along this already steep learning curve but I have come this far and will remain as transparent as possible.

One inevitable problem is bugs in the software. Whether being able to handle the influx of traffic (a good problem to have) or functions coming up with errors. I have already thought about this and have arranged for a soft launch which will only be available to those in the trial group. I will host an event where those individuals will be the first to try the app, create a few classes, RSVP, share classes and generally give feedback on their experience. We will then send these back to our developer to fix any bugs so in the main launch event, new users are likely to have a better experience using the app.

Another problem is updates. Because I want to get the product out there, I have left out some amazing features which I have already spoken to the developer about. Idea is to allow the app to generate income and then use that money to fund it! 2 in particular, you will love!!

The final problem is motivation. Fortunately for me, however, I have all the motivation I need. I have a business mentor, a virtual assistant, an app development team and a supportive community around me that are just as excited as me and already holding me accountable to my words! Plus, having experienced the pain of trying to fill classes, I have the determination to be the one that helps bring a solution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t support us financially, follow us on social media! You can find us at:

www.findmeaclass.today

www.facebook.com/groups/findmeaclass

www.twitter.com/findmeaclass

You can even join our mailing list to receive updates using eepurl.com/5idk1, and help us spread the word! We would be eternally grateful!

Thankyou

There I was looking
for hip hop dance classes in its birthplace. New York! My first visit and did I
know where to go!? Not a clue. So I did what anyone would do in my situation
looking for authentic hip hop dance classes in New York. I tried google! And
what I found was nothing. Furious. Only when I came back to London did I hear
of all the workshops I could have attended. Why? Because only those who were
friends with the teachers on Facebook, knew them personally, or heard through word
of mouth knew about these events. None of the teachers had a website, maximised
SEO, or put money into advertising!
Skip forward 2 years
and I accompany a friend to a tech jam where programmers gather to chat about
ideas. I get talking and an idea formed - an app that works like Tinder but for
classes! You can see what classes are in your radius! Even better, one that
also works like Twitter! You can follow your teachers and get notifications
when they create a new one, and invite your friends to one so you don't risk
going alone!
I know. I would love
to use something like this too!  The idea has developed since then! But it
gets even better!
Not just dance. 
Not just London!
What if you could go
on holiday to Tunisia and find a cooking class near your hotel? Or a scuba
diving class in Mauritius! All with a few clicks of an app!?
So in short, I want to make that happen.
What We Need & What You Get
The money raised will
cover the development of the app, but also the first push of marketing to get
international businesses onto it so when launched, it's full of all kinds of
classes, wherever you may be!
I’m asking for £10’000.
£6’468 will go towards the actual building of the app itself as per an invoice
from my developer (http://www.simonkwilliams.com/).
Most of the target
audience of those who will want to download an app to book classes would
already be online in some fashion, so I will be using pay-per-click strategies
to target local communities and niche markets.
I will also use it to
increase my virtual assistant's commitment from part time to full time so she
can really reach far into the market using tasks I have already designed. These
cover advertising campaigns through schools, universities and companies online
through social media and personal websites.
Finally, I will use it
to cover a soft launch at the beginning of August where I will get a testing group together (those who
commit to the ‘Trial Group’ perk) to use the app, test it and send feedback to
the developers for them to fix. Then I will hold a main launch at the beginning of September where I would like to hold an
event in London where people use the app to check into classes on the week of
release.
If I don’t reach the
goal of £10K, I would at least like enough to cover the development so it is
available for people to use and share but in this case, there may not be a main
launch event as planned.
In return for your generous donations, rewards
range from an email as soon as it's available for download on the app store and
google play, to having Find Me A Class available to you at the end of a phone
catering to your needs for a year! AND be part of the trial group so you can be
the first to try it! If you are a teacher or company that holds classes, we
suggest the ’12 month premium account’ perk for £15. Incredible value!
The Impact
Since I am one of few
professional dancers in the industry of sustainable architecture, I am
constantly asked where people can learn to dance and off the top of my head, I
can usually suggest a number of classes close to them that they would otherwise
not know existed. Often I would tell a friend I am interested in learning
something and they would be able to tell me about a Spanish tutor on my street
or a driving instructor in my neighbourhood. Even a popup cooking class near my
workplace.
The concept is that
all those people that are being missed from the marketing of these classes will
fall to us, and that will be our focus. If we can connect the people to the
classes, we can increase attendance which is better for business, but also
better for those attending who can learn something and do it socially.
We are already doing
this on a smaller scale via social media.
We receive thanks for
teachers who say they had an extra 3 people in class who found them through the
Facebook group or someone asked where they can find a class in Cambridge and we
happened to have a teacher in the group who responded. We already have users
from Germany, USA and China. China!
We want to continue
having this impact but on a much larger scale.
Risks & Challenges
This is my first
venture of its kind for me and I'm doing it solo so bound to have stumbling
blocks along this already steep learning curve but I have come this far and
will remain as transparent as possible.
One inevitable problem
is bugs in the software. Whether being able to handle the influx of traffic (a
good problem to have) or functions coming up with errors. I have already
thought about this and have arranged for a soft launch which will only be
available to those in the trial group. I will host an event where those
individuals will be the first to try the app, create a few classes, RSVP, share
classes and generally give feedback on their experience. We will then send
these back to our developer to fix any bugs so in the main launch event, new
users are likely to have a better experience using the app.
Another problem is
updates. Because I want to get the product out there, I have left out some
amazing features which I have already spoken to the developer about. Idea is to
allow the app to generate income and then use that money to fund it! 2 in
particular, you will love!!
The final problem is motivation. Fortunately
for me, however, I have all the motivation I need. I have a business mentor, a
virtual assistant, an app development team and a supportive community around me
that are just as excited as me and already holding me accountable to my words!
Plus, having experienced the pain of trying to fill classes, I have the
determination to be the one that helps bring a solution.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t support
us financially, follow us on social media! You can find us at:
www.findmeaclass.today
www.facebook.com/groups/findmeaclass
www.twitter.com/findmeaclass
You can even join our
mailing list to receive updates using eepurl.com/5idk1, and help us spread the
word! We would be eternally grateful!
Thankyou

story:
Your Host: 30-Year-Old Virgin, JimDre Westbrook aka "Worth The Wait Guy" 

My name is JimDre Westbrook, better known as "Worth The Wait Guy," and I'm a real-life 30-year-old virgin who believes God is worth the wait. 

I love giving practical advice and inspiration to help motivate people to live at their own pace. I believe it's part of my life purpose, which was almost taken away from me last year. 

On January 4, 2014, I celebrated my 30th birthday. I revealed to the world via Facebook that I was still at virgin at the age of 30. I made a pact with God at the age of 14 to wait for sex until marriage. Two months later after my 30th birthday, I almost died a virgin. On March 6, I was involved in a hit-and-run car accident with a drunk driver. The irony of the accident is that I've never had an alcoholic beverage or taken any drugs before in life.


Let's Talk It OUT!

Everyone has a story of struggle and triumph and each story should be told. I would like to use Worth The Wait Guy Presents: Living At Your Own Pace Podcast to highlight the joy and pain of entrepreneurship and making dreams come true. I'm an entrepreneur (Co-owner of Live At Your Own Pace Clothing, a lifestyle clothing brand based in Las Vegas, Nevada) so I understand the process of the daily grind (broke, but not broken).

I want to share success stories of fellow entrepreneurs I know around the country. We all belong to a business fraternity of toughness, courage and faith. 

The Worth The Wait Guy podcast will air bi-monthly (13 episodes starting July 2015/twice a month) and with your help, I will be able to achieve my goal in spreading happiness and encouragement to the world. 


Your Donation = Your Reward

Our campaign goal is $5,000. In order to achieve our goal, we need your HELP! Donations will be used to purchase the necessary equipment to produce the podcast (recording equipment, lighting, camera, etc). There are 5 different levels of donations (each level has reward prizes). If we don't reach our $5,000 goal, we will use the money given to produce as many episodes as possible..

  • LEVEL 1: $10-$20

Prize: Twitter follow back and shoutout post from Worth The Wait Guy (@worththewaitguy).

  • LEVEL 2: $25-$50

Prize: Instagram follow back and video shoutout post from Worth The Wait Guy (@worththewaitguy).

  • LEVEL 3: $60-$100

Prize: LAYOP shirt of your choice and sticker from LAYOP.COM.

  • LEVEL 4: $150-$500

Prize: Flavor Of The Week Spotlight Feature.

  • LEVEL 5: $550-$2000

Prize: Podcast Special Guest Interview (30 minute Interview).


#LAYOPMatters

The message of Living At Your Own Pace (LAYOP) is priceless. No matter the situation, life is much better when you're happy and living it at your own pace! Every donation will contribute to more people becoming aware of the LAYOP lifestyle. Worth The Wait Guy Presents: Living At Your Own Pace Podcast is a great extension of the LAYOP overall brand and philosophy. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a financial contribution, please share this campaign with at least 10-15 PEOPLE! Feel free to post it on all social media outlets - that would be greatly appreciated! 

* Note about payment process. 

After you claim your perk, you will be directed to the Paypal account of "Jimmie Westbrook" which is JimDre Westbrook's full name.

story:
To make this film free we need to fund this!


NOTE!  Video was used for a competition but is still relevant.


Lyme Disease is the fastest growing Vector born disease in the world. This disease effects 300,000 people in the US annually. Chronic Lyme can't be cured but it can be treated a bit like AIDS you can have ongoing treatment and return to a normal state of living. BUT Australia does not recognize the disease so treatment is very hard to get. This forces lots of family to move to America to receive treatment short term. If you catch Lyme in its early stages you can cure it but this is next to impossible in Australia with doctors not recognizing it.

Our aim is to bring treatment to Australia through a 30 -60 minute documentary. This documentary will outline and discuss:
  • Why this treatment isn't in Australia
  • Doctors Points of View on this topic
  • What Lyme Disease is
  • How it is treated

We will be interviewing

  • Doctors
  • Specialist
  • Patients (From the US and Australia)

How we will use the money


Making a documentary is very costly. From lighting to renting cameras and lens. We want to make this good enough to make a change in Australia and this means to make it to the best of our ability. We also need to fly to Sydney to conduct interviews and flight is never cheap!(this is dependent on what we reach) . This is purely going into the cost of production.

What we do with the left over money?

The left over money will go straight back into "Lyme Disease Australia" http://www.lymedisease.org.au/


What stage are we at?


We are currently still in the planning stage. This is scheduling interviews, gaining contacts and planning the overall documentary. We are not far off starting to shoot this documentary!

Why a documentary?


Documentaries are renowned for provoking thought. A documentary called "Under our skin" aided the recognition of Lyme in USA. This documentary was very influential and did provoke change. We hope to create something new and different to make a change in Australia. It's also that I have a lot of expreince behind the camera and this is the way i feel could make a difference.


An article that shows all the documentaries that have made a difference
http://au.eonline.com/photos/4847/documentaries...

story:
Who Are We?

JX3 Media Productions is a production company based out of Chatham, Ontario.   Kristina and Rob are passionate about film making and working with both local and international talent. 

The Slaughter at Sumac Ditch

This film is a throw back to the 80's style slasher movies.  If you love Friday the 13th and Sleepaway camp we are sure you will love our new killer Bruno. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $35, 000 to help bring this picture to life.  We have some great perks for our contributors.  Our perks allow you to be part of the team on The Slaughter at Sumac Ditch with items such as naming characters, reading the script and giving feedback to the director/writer(Rob), purchasing props that will been seen and used in the movie, and much more. Almost every perk will have your name in the credits.

Where your money will go: Actors, Crew, Equipment, Costumes, Props, Food, Makeup, Location costs and Insurance.  With our goal we know we will be able to create a film you will enjoy. 

This movie is going to be an amazing experience that we would love for you to be apart of!  We hope that you consider joining us with a contribution because your are not just donating, you are becoming part of our team!

 The Impact
Well we know this film will never be a contender for an Oscar, we also know people will enjoy watching it. From the nostalgia factor to the new twists we believe people will want to watch this over and over.   


  Risks & Challenges

 We feel that our biggest challenge will be the special effects.   With any good horror movie one bad effect can destroy the film.  To combat this we searched for a person not with the book smarts but the hands on smarts to get the job done.  Her work is incredible, but the challenge will be the budget.   If our goal is exceeded the special effects we can create will be even more amazing.  Our makeup artist is amazing and we want to give her the budget she deserves to enhance the gruesome effects seen on screen.

  Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to make a monetary contribution at this time.  By Sharing the project you are contributing to the successfulness of the campaign.  We greatly appreciate people joining us in any way they are abe to at this time.

story:
SYNOPSIS: 

War tears through the city as a struggle between two drug empires leave the streets in total anarchy. When the head boss from the opposing family is taken out, enforcer Braden Vasco is apprehended at the scene of the crime and taken into custody. Detectives use leverage, and force him to roll over on his organization. He faces his allies only to find that nothing is as it seems. Fueled by vengeance, he does what he needs to in order to survive as he pieces together the truth. 


Short Summary

It all starts with a great script. 5 Minute Rush was written by up and coming Vancouver based actor/writer/director Steve Baran. Steve is a very passionate storyteller, his vision and drive are an inspiration. Weather he is working in front or behind the camera, Steve always puts the work in, giving it 110%. As this piece was inspired from a dark time in Steve's life, he is emotionally invested in the project, and is literally working around the clock to bring this story to life and give it everything it deserves.

Working by his side is the very innovative and amazing director of photography Cliff Hokanson. Cliff has worked with many action Icons like Jean Claude Vandamme, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Wesley Snipes, and many more. Cliff's experience and resume is beyond impressive. Cliff will take this film to a whole new level by aesthetically presenting the dark and gritty world we are trying to create. 

In addition to our team we have Tanay Genco Ulgen on board. Tanay is a very experienced stunt choreographer that will be coming on board to help plan the action design. His back ground in martial arts and knowledge of the technical aspects of fighting on and off screen makes him a valuable asset to the dynamic of our team. 

Together with our producers Kelsey Baran and Chris Rogers we have been working hard in pre production over the last few months, planning and dedicating our time in a valiant effort to bring you the best film we can possibly make. 

The purpose of launching this campaign is to help bear the costs of this production. It's very important to us because we want to ensure that we can obtain everything we need to tell the story truthfully and effectively. Taking this independent film and giving it the highest level of production value that we can achieve, and create the world where this story takes place. 

Together with your help and contributions, we can achieve our goal. That goal is to create a cinematic masterpiece, delivering absolute truth to the story and it's characters. This will enable us to not only make a powerful film that really stands out on it's own, but it will also allow us to take this high impact short action film and use it as a pitch piece for a full length feature film. 

Your support means the world to us, let's give the audience something they will really want to see! Together we can make something great!

Be sure to check out our demo reels.

Steve Baran/Cliff Hokanson/Tanay Genco Ulgen


What We Need & What You Get

We need you! The audience. We need your help to raise $30 000.00 to assist bearing the minimum costs for this production.  This amount will cover the costs in almost every aspect of the film. Such as cast, crew, equipment and rentals, locations, insurance, VFX/make up, props, set dec, wardrobe, shooting permits, craft services, a small contingency budget and post. 

Be sure to check out all of our perks! We have many to choose from, some of which are quite unique, quirky and fun!

If our entire goal is not reached, no need to worry... the funds will still go towards the making of this film. We will not stop. We will find a way, because that is what passionate and innovative filmmakers do. We move forward. Sometimes you have to think outside the box and find ways to creatively solve problems. The experience alone coming from our key creatives will take the reigns and steer us in the right direction. This is your chance to be a part of that by helping us move forward.


The Impact

Each and every contribution counts. No matter how big or small. Every single one of them will make a difference in helping us achieve our goal. Your contribution will impact the making of a great film. One you will be proud of. You will help create a great action piece with a lot of character and depth. A film that people will want to see and the audience will love.


Steve Baran and Cliff Hokanson first met on set while working on an amazing short film called MECH: HUMAN TRIALS (2014) . In which Steve played the lead character, and Cliff was the director of photography. The film was written directed by the very talented and up and coming director Patrick Kalyn. The short film was shot on location in Vancouver with a minimal budget. The film was used at a pitch piece,  and was picked up by The Coalition Group and IAM Entertainment. The project is currently being developed into a full length feature film.  

We are looking to do the very same thing with this project. All it takes is a vision and the right creative team. The impact of your contributions will make our vision for  5 Minute Rush become a reality. Just imagine what we could do with $30,000.00

Check out the links below:
http://www.firstshowing.net/2014/watch-this-mech-human-trials-sci-fi-short/
http://moviepilot.com/posts/2015/01/29/hollywood-goes-mech-2636586?lt_source=external,manual,manual
http://www.thewrap.com/mech-viral-campaign-leads-to-feature-film-from-patrick-kalyn-mike-le-exclusive/

Risks & Challenges

With any goal in life, there are always risks and challenges.  This campaign like any other, obviously runs the risk of not hitting it's goal. In which case, we will still go on and make this film with the funds we were able to raise. 

We would then face the challenges of re-creating the world in which our story takes place on a much smaller scale than what we had originally envisioned, but with the experience and passion towards this project from our key creatives, we will still be able to to give truth to the story and the characters who will carry it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many other ways you can help us reach our goal.  We understand that not everyone can contribute. Please like and share our campaign. The further the reach, the more people will see it. Get involved. Help us get it out there. Let's make some noise about this campaign!

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Youtube for updates and all the latest news.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Impact
Each and every contribution counts. No matter how big or small. Every single one of them will make a difference in helping us achieve our goal. Your contribution will impact the making of a great film. One you will be proud of. You will help create a great action piece with a lot of character and depth. A film that people will want to see and the audience will love.


Steve Baran and Cliff Hokanson first met on set while working on an amazing short film called MECH: HUMAN TRIALS (2014) . In which Steve played the lead character, and Cliff was the director of photography. The film was written directed by the very talented and up and coming director Patrick Kalyn. The short film was shot on location in Vancouver with a minimal budget. The film was used at a pitch piece,  and was picked up by The Coalition Group and IAM Entertainment. The project is currently being developed into a full length feature film.  

We are looking to do the very same thing with this project. All it takes is a vision and the right creative team. The impact of your contributions will make our vision for  5 Minute Rush become a reality. Just imagine what we could do with $30,000.00

Check out the links below:

http://www.firstshowing.net/2014/watch-this-mech-human-trials-sci-fi-short/


http://moviepilot.com/posts/2015/01/29/hollywood-goes-mech-2636586?lt_source=external,manual,manual


http://www.thewrap.com/mech-viral-campaign-leads-to-feature-film-from-patrick-kalyn-mike-le-exclusive/


    Risks & Challenges
With any goal in life, there are always risks and challenges.  This campaign like any other, obviously runs the risk of not hitting it's goal. In which case, we will still go on and make this film with the funds we were able to raise. 

We would then face the challenges of re-creating the world in which our story takes place on a much smaller scale than what we had originally envisioned, but with the experience and passion towards this project from our key creatives, we will still be able to to give truth to the story and the characters who will carry it. 

    Other Ways You Can Help
There are many other ways you can help us reach our goal.  We understand that not everyone can contribute. Please like and share our campaign. The further the reach, the more people will see it. Get involved. Help us get it out there. Let's make some noise about this campaign!

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Youtube for updates and all the latest news.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Free Raven 23

Free Raven 23 is a movement that seeks to uncover and expose how the current administration and the Department of Justice have sacrificed four honorable and decorated veterans in an effort to appease the Iraqi government's quest for blood.

By hiding evidence, misrepresenting evidence, presenting perjured testimony and giving inappropriate instructions to a civilian jury in Washington, DC, the Department of Justice was able to secure convictions and 30 yr to life sentences against four Department of State contractors who took only necessary and authorized actions to defend themselves in war-torn Baghdad Iraq in 2007.

Learn More at www.freeraven23.com or by looking at some of these articles:

Blackwater’s Raven 23 Case Rigged by Scandal Plagued DOJ

OP-ED: Massacre of Justice: Blackwater's Raven 23 Convictions

What We Need

We are seeking the community at large to support us in fighting for the freedom of Dustin Heard, Evan Liberty, Nick Slatten and Paul Slough, and to support their families in what has proved to be a years long legal battle.

The Impact

Your contribution, big or small, will make a huge impact on the lives on these four unjustly incarcerated men and their families. Here is a list of just some of the activities your money will go to support:

  • Assistance funding a documentary.
  • Travel expenses for advocates to pursue media opportunities.
  • Travel expenses to meet with legislators to bring leadership attention.
  • Website administration and related social media/promotional expenses.
  • Travel expenses for the families to visit their incarcerated loved ones in prison; none of which have been placed in facilities in their home state.
  • Living expense assistance for four families which have had breadwinners stripped from them; three wives, three children and countless bills left behind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 

  • Find us on Facebook and share our story! www.facebook.com/raven23support
  • Visit our website under the "What Can I Do?" header and use our sample letter to write your legislators.
  • Contact us through our website our Facebook if you have media or political contacts who might want to hear more about our story.
  • Pray for justice.

#KeepTheFaith - This is our tagline and our battle cry. Just moments after learning of his conviction in federal court, Paul Slough asked his attorney to pass his wife a message, which stated simply, was "Keep the faith."

story:
52 years ago cinema was forever changed with the birth of the SPLATTER FILM. Herschell Gordon Lewis delivered his tale of a psychotic caterer to the big screen with never before scenes of on-screen gore, ground breaking for its time. It is with his blessing and support we return to the original film for a brutal and bloody remake.

Watch our teaser trailer below to relive some iconic moments from the first course as we look toward taking a new slice out of horror history.
This campaign is created from fans and addressed to fans of BLOOD FEAST. We, the filmmakers are longtime admirers of the original classic movie by HG Lewis and we would like to give you the chance to share your passion for the horror genre with us! Even our film is financed by this time we are here on Indiegogo with an aim to give you a chance to be a part of the BLOOD FEAST history! With your support of the campaign you will get a once in a life time opportunity  to grab an exclusive selection of BLOOD FEAST perks. Every fan of the original and the splatter genre can take part of a new chapter in the recipe book of gore.
Listen to the GODFATHER OF GORE himself!
Fuad Ramses and his family have moved from the United States to France, where they run an American diner. Since business is not going too well, Fuad also works night shifts in a museum of ancient Egyptian culture. During these long, lonely nights he is repeatedly drawn to a statue representing the seductive ancient goddess ISHTAR. He becomes more and more allured by the goddess as she speaks to him in visions. Eventually he succumbs to her deadly charms. After this pivotal night, Fuad begins a new life, in which murder and cannibalism become his daily bread. He starts to prepare a ritual FEAST to honor his new mistress, a lavish affair dripping with BLOOD, organs, and intestines of human victims. As butchered bodies are heaped upon the Altar of Ishtar, Fuad slowly slips further into madness, until he is no more than the goddess’s puppet; and she thirsts for the blood of Fuad’s wife and daughter too...
A BLOOD FEAST for the next generation of splatter fans calls for a new cast of characters. We are pleased to bring the following horror icons & fresh scream queens to the table.
Robert Rusler is Fuad Ramses
Actor, athlete, writer, Robert Rusler was born in Indiana and soon moved to Hawaii, where he started surfing and skateboarding. As his family moved to Los Angles, he began his martial arts career. Right out of high school he began taking acting classes and soon thereafter, he landed his first starring role in John Hughes "Weird Science". He then starred in "A Nightmare on Elm Street : Part 2". Soon after, Robert landed his first television series, Fox's "The Outsiders" and he starred in Stephen King's Emmy award-winning movie "Sometimes they come back". Robert is also known for his performance in the TV series "24", "Star Trek: Enterprise", "Bones" and many more.
Caroline Williams is Louise Ramses
Caroline Williams began her career in Texas, co-starring for revered cinema master Louis Malle in his Corpus Christi-based film “Alamo Bay”. Following “Alamo Bay”, she moved to Dallas and furthered her career with co-stars in “Legend Of Billie Jean” (dir. Matthew Robbins) and “Getting Even” (dir. Dwight Little). When Tobe Hooper and L.M. "Kit" Carson began casting for the sequel to Hooper's iconic “Texas Chainsaw Massacre”, they discovered the actress, who ran screaming down the hallway of the casting office. She burst into the room, pulled the chairs from beneath the duo and played the brief dialogue while huddled in a corner. In that often told moment, she won the role from 440 actresses from both coasts.

After the successful release of the film, she moved to Hollywood to continue her career in horror (“Stepfather 2” - dir. Jeff Burr, “Leprechaun 3” - dir. Brian Trenchard Smith), mainstream films like “Days Of Thunder” - dir. Tony Scott, ”How The Grinch Stole Christmas” - dir. Ron Howard) and guest star roles in TV series such as “Grey's Anatomy” (dir. Debbie Allen) and “The Mentalist” (dir. Charles Beeson).

Thank you Caroline for working with us again!
Sophie Monk is Penny Ramses
Sophie Monk was born in England and grew up in Australia. Sophie is one of Australia's most known actress, she started her career in the Australian reality television series "Popstars". In 2004 Sophie made her acting debut in "The Mystery of Natalie Wood", portraying the role of Marylin Monroe. She relocated to Los Angeles in 2005 and starred in the movie "Click" opposite of Adam Sandler and "Date Movie". Monk made her American television debut in the HBO series "Entourage". In 2008, Dark Castle Entertainment announced Sophie Monk as the female lead in the slasher horror film "The Hills Run Red", presently Sophie is working on several TV shows in the USA and in Australia.

Our team welcomes Sophie to join the Feast!
Sadie Katz is The Goddess Ishtar
Sadie Katz is living in Los Angeles and mostly known for her role in the 20th Century Fox Horror franchise "Wrong Turn 6", playing the twisted Sally Hillicker. She also played the sweet sensitive, leading lady in "Chavez: Cage of Glory" alongside Danny Trejo. Sadie also penned the screenplay "Scorned", starring Anna Lynn McCord and Billy Zane, released by Anchor Bay.

Fuad Ramses welcomes Sadie, be my Goddess!
We are rewarding contributions to BLOOD FEAST with an variety of exciting perks and opportunities. These range from the traditional special edition copies to the movie to one of kind items with a twisted edge.

You can find these listed to the right-hand column of this page: ----->

Be sure to follow us on Twitter / Instagram and 'LIKE' us on Facebook in order to keep up to date on both this campaign and the development of the final film. Sharing our news & inviting your friends to be part of the BLOOD FEAST would mean the world to us.  We're looking forward to hosting some referral contests in the coming weeks so remember to sign in to Indiegogo & use to sharing buttons at the top left of this page.

We've been amazed at the fan art that has been made for the original film over the decades. We'd love to see your take on the film in the form of poster art, illustration or trailer remixing.
“This project makes one of my longest dreams come true.  The Original one changed my whole life. To realize the remake of the cult movie BLOOD FEAST feels like winning the lottery to me."
Meet Marcel Walz, the German master of gore on film.  His career started at the tender age of 17 with his shoestring budget productions leading him to film school at MFA Film Academy, Spain. It was shortly thereafter he made a connection with his first producer who gave him the opportunity to bring several projects to life.  Making the most of meager budgets these movies attracted attention.  In 2009 his independent film "La Petite Mort" was an international breakthrough with the spotlight focused on this Torture Porn title.  In the last few years he has continued to direct horror movies with increasing budgets reaching 50K€. While establishing his own production company, Matador Film, he has had the opportunity to work with talent from across the globe.

This brings us to present day, Gundo Entertainment have brought him to the dinner table of the BLOOD FEAST as head of the table, sitting in the director's chair.  With their help and yours BLOOD FEAST will be the next step in establishing a new chapter in splatter cinema.
"There will be no CGI blood! All the effects will be bloody and handmade! BLOOD FEAST is gonna be a dirty remake and the story will be more closely examined.The fans can look forward to a hardand bloody piece of film!"
With this bold statement Walz returns to a blood churning pact forged with Ryan Nicholson. The two previously earned cinematic battle scars working together on "La Petite Mort II". Watch a snippet before learning more about out practical effects wielding maniac.
Ryan loves horror movies, plain and simple. We are dripping with excitement to have his award-winning make-up effect talents on board to bring the practical FX gore to BLOOD FEAST.
“I make ‘more is more’ horror. I’m not of the school of thought that showing something off-screen is more effective than showing it on-screen. I like to show everything. I leave nothing to the imagination.”
Ryan Nicholson is one of the best known special effects make-up artists in the business.  Hailing from British Columbia, in the Great Fright North, he started as a self-taught artist who worked in the departments of numerous television shows from "The X-Files" to "The Outer Limits" via "Stargate" though "Andromeda".  His work on the later earned him a triple "Best Achievement In Make-Up" Gemini award nomination (The Canadian Emmy) and a triumphant win.  On the big screen you would have seen his work in various different modes: Funny ("Scary Movie"), Brutally Inventive ("Final Destination"), Thunder Juggling ("Blade:Trinity") & Furiously Fantastic ("The Chronicles of Riddick").  Check out his IMDb page to witness a kill list as long as a line of severed outstretched arms.

Thank you Ryan for joining BLOOD FEAST, and here's to making the feast VERY bloody.

Finally we hope our version makes your mouth fall open (upon this happening we can't guarantee we won't snatch your tongue)
