story:
Summary

Hello! My name is Triana Andrea Melendez, and I'm a film director who runs a Youtube channel called Trianasaurus Rex. For the last two years, I've been building an audience by creating music videos, dark animations, an original sci-fi series, vlogs, skits, and more! In the long term, I would love to be a big-budget, fantasy/sci-fi director who transports audiences into new worlds in a much deeper way than ever before.

In fact, I believe I have done that with my original sci-fi series called "I GOT STUCK INSIDE MY BRAIN!" You can visit all three episodes (so far) here: https://youtu.be/FxE8ofIySJk

I'm also amazingly proud of my animations. Here is a dark retelling of Rapunzel, with over 100 original images I have produced myself, and told in German (with English subtitles): https://youtu.be/wp1DyDXo5yY

I absolutely love what I do. I never plan on doing anything else or stopping. Unfortunately, my equipment says otherwise. That is to say, everything I'm using to do the very thing I know I'm meant to do with my life is breaking down. I'll need everyone's help to replace the essentials to get back on my feet.


Personal Background

My name is Triana Melendez, and my dream in life is to direct fantasy/science-fiction films one day. I grew up loving the Harry Potter series, the Lord of the Rings trilogy, the Matrix trilogy, and so many more films that brought me so much passion and excitement. They've also brought me happiness during my early school years when I felt that my peers never really understood me. It was my love for these films and many like them that made me write my first book, which never got published. But then I made a connection: somewhere between watching my dad teach and direct, and finding myself in leadership positions, I discovered that I wanted something much more.

From then on, my path in life was to direct films, and I realized that I'd never want to do anything else. I realized that my dream was to make films with not only dragons, but witches, mermaids, and trolls. And then I also realized that if I wanted any of these dreams to come true, I'll need to get to it.

So I went to film school, directed nine short films, and learned a great deal. I also loved watching films - old and new - at home. After everything, I felt really accomplished. I was proud of myself, but knew I was still only at the beginning. Everything I was doing also felt too underground to me: again, I wanted more. I wanted more pressure. I wanted an audience. But I had one major problem: I didn't have any equipment of my own.

Through the time it took me to acquire what I needed to begin, I watched a good amount of Youtube videos and found out that it was something I really wanted to do. But I was afraid of recording myself. Despite my accomplishments, I was still very insecure about my appearance (in high school, I was quite overweight, which didn't make me happy, but I had managed to lose most of it by this time). And then I knew that because I was afraid of it, I had to do it. And so, I uploaded my first Trianasaurus Rex video. This was two years ago.

Since then, I've produced about 100 videos, and gained an audience of over a thousand people. I'm so proud of what I've done. I've made a variety of different things, ranging from an original sci-fi series, to music videos and vlogs. However, something is happening that is threatening my ability to do the very thing I love.


Why I Need Your Help

For the last two years, I've been able to put out videos every Friday, and these videos are ones I'm very ecstatic about. However, I've been working on very old equipment, which is breaking down. For example, on the almost ten-year old computer I work on, it takes over twelve hours to produce a vlog - a type of video that takes me the least time to do.

In reality, this sort of work should only take four hours, maximum. The work requires this much time these days because my computer takes that much longer to process my work. For longer, more complicated works, it takes my computer much, much longer. And it is getting progressively worse. I am also working with no lighting. I had lights before, but they are no longer safe to use (they burn more than help nowadays).

Because I have many other daily duties including my day job (which all goes towards meeting my life's demands), I require help to get the equipment I need to make my videos again, before mine completely break down for good (or in this case, for bad. Very, very bad.)


These are the things I need:

  • a computer with all the specs and programs I need for film making (Final Cut Pro, Motion, Photoshop, Garageband, etc.)
  •  an array of microphones to help me have professional audio without having to re-dub each line, which is a difficult task.
  • lights: portable clip lights, soft box lights, a light ring, etc. These lights will especially help in shooting outside and in my green screen work.
  • a green screen: right now, I am using a homemade fabric of the wrong color and tone, which has worked until now, but it is not efficient at all (time-wise).
  • camera accessories: these things include a camera remote control (so I can stay at the same distance to stop a take, which will save time, power, and energy), a monitor (so that I can see what my camera is shooting without having to walk back to it every time, which makes production difficult for a number of reasons), reflectors, and more.


The Impact

By being able to have the essentials I need, I'll be able to

  • continue with my life's dream. With everything else I have going on in my life, it's difficult finding ways to replace the things I need. Getting this equipment will mean everything.
  • not only be able to make higher quality content, but more content that leads to more videos a week! I would save so much time with all of these items, which would, in turn, make me more efficient. Not having these things means that I'll have to stop the very thing I know I am meant to do.
  • Magic will happen! Wingardium Leviosa!


The Challenge

Without the essentials, I will not be able to continue to live out my life's passion. I believe the work I'll accomplish in my life will completely change the world. But I need your help.

  • I urge everyone to donate. Even 1 dollar will make a HUGE difference.
  • If everyone donated what they would spend at lunch (with friends, during their lunch break at work, etc.), I would be funded instantly.
  • Sharing this campaign with everyone you know will mean the absolute world to me! Thank you so much!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't donate, do not worry! The # 1 truth is: I need everyone to know about this campaign. Tell the President!  Tell Weird All Yankovic! Tell your mom! Tell anybody and everyone. Seriously, everyone needs to know.

    Thank you so much! I am eternally grateful to anyone who can do anything to help.

    Some of the Perks

    No matter the size of the donation, everyone will get a reward/perk. Look on the right side of the window to view them in detail. Down below are the merchandize you could receive as part of the coolio deal:

    Dinosaur-Themed iPhone 6 Case!

    My channel is named Trianasaurus Rex. It only seems fitting that I give my awesome supporters dinosaur-themed iPhone 6 Cases!

    Everyone who donates at least 50 dollars will receive this case. 100% Guaranteed.


    Keep Calm and Donate T-Shirt!

    Receiving this shirt means that you're not only an awesome individual, but also an individual who will receive access to an exclusive raffle to get free prizes every 2 months FOREVER, access to behind the scenes footage, free editing services, an executive producer credit, and will get to completely design and name an original character for an intricate series/big project of your choice! The top prize winner will also have a speaking role in one of the major projects! Super cool!

    Perk Notes

    • Expectancy dates for perks which include merchandise are stated as such because of the merchandise. In other words, everything else on each perk list with merchandise will be delivered much sooner.
story_txt:
Summary
Hello! My name is Triana Andrea Melendez, and I'm a film director who runs a Youtube channel called Trianasaurus Rex. For the last two years, I've been building an audience by creating music videos, dark animations, an original sci-fi series, vlogs, skits, and more! In the long term, I would love to be a big-budget, fantasy/sci-fi director who transports audiences into new worlds in a much deeper way than ever before.
In fact, I believe I have done that with my original sci-fi series called "I GOT STUCK INSIDE MY BRAIN!" You can visit all three episodes (so far) here: https://youtu.be/FxE8ofIySJk
I'm also amazingly proud of my animations. Here is a dark retelling of Rapunzel, with over 100 original images I have produced myself, and told in German (with English subtitles): https://youtu.be/wp1DyDXo5yY
I absolutely love what I do. I never plan on doing anything else or stopping. Unfortunately, my equipment says otherwise. That is to say, everything I'm using to do the very thing I know I'm meant to do with my life is breaking down. I'll need everyone's help to replace the essentials to get back on my feet.

Personal Background 

My name is Triana Melendez, and my dream in life is to direct fantasy/science-fiction films one day. I grew up loving the Harry Potter series, the Lord of the Rings trilogy, the Matrix trilogy, and so many more films that brought me so much passion and excitement. They've also brought me happiness during my early school years when I felt that my peers never really understood me. It was my love for these films and many like them that made me write my first book, which never got published. But then I made a connection: somewhere between watching my dad teach and direct, and finding myself in leadership positions, I discovered that I wanted something much more.

From then on, my path in life was to direct films, and I realized that I'd never want to do anything else. I realized that my dream was to make films with not only dragons, but witches, mermaids, and trolls. And then I also realized that if I wanted any of these dreams to come true, I'll need to get to it.

So I went to film school, directed nine short films, and learned a great deal. I also loved watching films - old and new - at home. After everything, I felt really accomplished. I was proud of myself, but knew I was still only at the beginning. Everything I was doing also felt too underground to me: again, I wanted more. I wanted more pressure. I wanted an audience. But I had one major problem: I didn't have any equipment of my own.

Through the time it took me to acquire what I needed to begin, I watched a good amount of Youtube videos and found out that it was something I really wanted to do. But I was afraid of recording myself. Despite my accomplishments, I was still very insecure about my appearance (in high school, I was quite overweight, which didn't make me happy, but I had managed to lose most of it by this time). And then I knew that because I was afraid of it, I had to do it. And so, I uploaded my first Trianasaurus Rex video. This was two years ago.
Since then, I've produced about 100 videos, and gained an audience of over a thousand people. I'm so proud of what I've done. I've made a variety of different things, ranging from an original sci-fi series, to music videos and vlogs. However, something is happening that is threatening my ability to do the very thing I love.   
Why I Need Your Help

For the last two years, I've been able to put out videos every Friday, and these videos are ones I'm very ecstatic about. However, I've been working on very old equipment, which is breaking down. For example, on the almost ten-year old computer I work on, it takes over twelve hours to produce a vlog - a type of video that takes me the least time to do. 
 In reality, this sort of work should only take four hours, maximum. The work requires this much time these days because my computer takes that much longer to process my work. For longer, more complicated works, it takes my computer much, much longer. And it is getting progressively worse. I am also working with no lighting. I had lights before, but they are no longer safe to use (they burn more than help nowadays). 
Because I have many other daily duties including my day job (which all goes towards meeting my life's demands), I require help to get the equipment I need to make my videos again, before mine completely break down for good (or in this case, for bad. Very, very bad.)

These are the things I need:   a computer with all the specs and programs I need for film making (Final Cut Pro, Motion, Photoshop, Garageband, etc.) 


 an array of microphones to help me have professional audio without having to re-dub each line, which is a difficult task.


lights: portable clip lights, soft box lights, a light ring, etc. These lights will especially help in shooting outside and in my green screen work.

a green screen: right now, I am using a homemade fabric of the wrong color and tone, which has worked until now, but it is not efficient at all (time-wise).

camera accessories: these things include a camera remote control (so I can stay at the same distance to stop a take, which will save time, power, and energy), a monitor (so that I can see what my camera is shooting without having to walk back to it every time, which makes production difficult for a number of reasons), reflectors, and more.

   
The Impact By being able to have the essentials I need, I'll be able to  
continue with my life's dream. With everything else I have going on in my life, it's difficult finding ways to replace the things I need. Getting this equipment will mean everything. 

not only be able to make higher quality content, but more content that leads to more videos a week! I would save so much time with all of these items, which would, in
 turn, make me more efficient. Not having these things means that I'll have to stop the very 
thing I know I am meant to do.


Magic will happen! Wingardium Leviosa!
    
The Challenge  Without the essentials, I will not be able to continue to live out my life's passion. I believe the work I'll accomplish in my life will completely change the world. But I need your help.

I urge everyone to donate. Even 1 dollar will make a HUGE difference.

If everyone donated what they would spend at lunch (with friends, during their lunch break at work, etc.), I would be funded instantly.

Sharing this campaign with everyone you know will mean the absolute world to me! Thank you so much!

    
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't donate, do not worry! The # 1 truth is: I need everyone to know about this campaign. Tell the President!  Tell Weird All Yankovic! Tell your mom! Tell anybody and everyone. Seriously, everyone needs to know.Thank you so much! I am eternally grateful to anyone who can do anything to help. Some of the Perks
No matter the size of the donation, everyone will get a reward/perk. Look on the right side of the window to view them in detail. Down below are the merchandize you could receive as part of the coolio deal:
Dinosaur-Themed iPhone 6 Case!
My channel is named Trianasaurus Rex. It only seems fitting that I give my awesome supporters dinosaur-themed iPhone 6 Cases!

Everyone who donates at least 50 dollars will receive this case. 100% Guaranteed.
Keep Calm and Donate T-Shirt!


Receiving this shirt means that you're not only an awesome individual, but also an individual who will receive access to an exclusive raffle to get free prizes every 2 months FOREVER, access to behind the scenes footage, free editing services, an executive producer credit, and will get to completely design and name an original character for an intricate series/big project of your choice! The top prize winner will also have a speaking role in one of the major projects! Super cool!Perk Notes

Expectancy dates for perks which include merchandise are stated as such because of the merchandise. In other words, everything else on each perk list with merchandise will be delivered much sooner.

story:
(Chelsea Linder)

ALLEGIANCE OF POWERS

The fight for the city begins

We are the creators of ALLEGIANCE OF POWERS, MGI PRODUCTIONS LLC.  

MGI came from a rocky background as we built up from being homeless and living on a park bench. The only thing that pulled us out of our situation was the ALLEGIANCE OF POWERS web series that we created and it became popular and that was our saving grace. That brought us out of some dark moment in our lives. 

THIS CAMPAIGN is much more then just a film that we shot. It's something that has been more then a passion project the web series... before this feature film we just shot... saved us. So we cant put a price tag on something like that. It has become something much more then a film. 


We shot this film a year ago, principle photography. Since then we have been doing the fx. Well we came into some financial trouble and had to start doing outside projects and after so long we still haven't been able to finish because we keep having to do everything else besides our passion project. Our CGI artist even dislocated his spine while working on the FX because he decided to put in very long hours sitting at the computer and finish a giant action sequence in less then a month. He achieved his goal but at a price... We've been running into so many snags to finish this... and we need help. 

(EVERY PICTURE ON THE SITE IS THE SOLE PROPERTY OF MGI PRODUCTIONS FOR THE AOP FEATURE FILM!)


What We Need & What You Get

We need at minimum 9,000 dollars. 

OUR STRETCH GOAL is 35,000 - IF THAT HAPPENS we will begin production on ALLEGIANCE OF POWERS 2 ! 


I know it seems like a lot. And trust me... it is a lot. But in order to finish the film we need to do so much. 

  • 300 more CGI FX SHOTS
  • FINISH THE FULL MUSICAL SCORE OF THE FILM
  • FOLEY for entire film
  • Actors ADR
  • B-roll
  • Pick up shots
  • EDIT 
  • composite 
  • miniature modeling
  • wire removal 
  • matte painting 
  • rigging 
  • SOFTWARE RENTALS

ALSO we will be absolutely transparent here. The film was filmed without paying the actors. So of course it being a free unpaid gig some of the actors didn't bother showing up some days and so we had to rewrite the story as we went and some actors didn't bother even reading the script and so their characters were not really what we wanted. Things were a mess because of this. So we have been editing around it and fixing it to be actually a better more engaging story! So what problems arose is becoming a happy accident. But we are going through a lot of problems that needs to be fixed that is why we need to roll some B roll and get some pick up shots of certain other scenes. 

WHAT PERKS ARE THERE? 
We have some of the coolest perks ever! 
What we have come up with is tons and tons of MERCH! YES, we have character wallets, guitar picks, buttons, playing cards, poker chips, etc! 
Plus we would like to allow people to receive actual ITEMS from the film, such as costumes, and props! 
We are also going to have skype meet and greets with the cast! You can learn their troubles they had on set, anything you want to know! 
SIGNED SCRIPTS! AND POSTERS! 
PINUP CALENDAR! AND MUCH MUCH MORE!



 THE Impact

The contribution you give means more to us then you can possibly imagine. Again this is much more then a passion project of ours. This is something that the world has constantly been pushing down into the mud and we keep grabbing our shovels and uncovering it as it keeps sinking. 

It's such a fun engaging film that keeps you smiling and in awe the entire time. 


DO WE KNOW WHAT WE ARE DOING? IF WE GOT THE FUNDS? 

Yes, I say so. Our last film LAKE FEAR (BELOW) was the first first film from DALLAS to have been SCREENED! (not just go and be in the film market) AT CANNES FILM FESTIVAL IN OVER 40 YEARS.  IT HAS WORLD WIDE DISTRIBUTION. 



THE REASON I SHOW LAKE FEAR IS BECAUSE THIS WAS ANOTHER FILM THAT WAS SOLELY OUR FILM. 
We have done many projects for other clients and those films have gone off to do great things but LAKE FEAR (for example) was a film we did our own, just us no outside help. Just like AOP (Allegiance of Powers) 

BANDS ATTACHED TO THE PROJECT!
BURNING SLOW 

THE KUL


SCARY CHERRY and the BANG BANGS


JENNY ROBINSON and 8EARCLUB

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are immense. We have had so many things standing in our way, it is unreal. We just earlier this year had one of our CGI computers mother boards burn up due to all the intense graphical processes being rendered for this project. (luckily the motherboard was under warranty) But this project takes a toll. It is doing fx that you only see in huge 100 million dollar films. And that is what we set up to do. 


WE SAW FILMS LIKE THE AVENGERS and said... I have a dollar in my pocket... BUT I WANT TO DO THAT! I want to make that kind of film. AND WE DID. And we are still trying. And its been so incredibly difficult. But we are still pulling through to bring YOU an amazing blockbuster FILM, from an extremely extremely micro budget film. This film looks like 100's of thousands of dollars were spent on it. But that is not true at all. It's just been us and our passion and us using any credit card, any dime we get and pumping it into hard ware or anyone or anything that can help make this thing amazing! 




Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant donate what really helps so much is SHARING, and asking those people to at least visit the indiegogo page. If we generate a lot of views to the site it can make it to the front page and that can immensely help us! 

THANK YOU!

Below the picture we will show you where it all began! 




WELCOME TO THIS SECTION OF THE INDIEGOGO PAGE! This is the origin of THE ALLEGIANCE OF POWERS. 



ORIGIN OF EGOTAN AND CYBERSTING -  


Allegiance of powers did not first start out as a series or anything of that sort. It started out with Creators Gerald, Michael and Zach. They wanted to make a youtube video that will be about real two life people dressing up like super heroes and asking others to join them. This is the first origin video that arose from this. REMEMBER it is suppose to be cheap and bad. But this is how it all began- Not as a series or anything else but as a joke. 


WAS THAT NOT BAD! And if you  notice EGOTAN and CYBERSTING dont look the same. In fact Egotan is green. This was not suppose to seem like complete jokes but have other people make fun of them. No one did. The entire idea didn't work. 

We in total made a bunch of videos including watching them cook... None of it took off. 

HERE IS A STUNT THEY PERFORMED IN FRONT OF A SECURITY CAMERA , trying to make people believe every aspect that EGOTAN and CYBERSTING were real people. 


So then Michael and Gerald decided that the joke lasted enough and they should all make a quick little movie with these characters and get rid of them. So with no money and such they set out and made something quick and easy to say goodbye to these characters. 

That was this. 

But then they sat together and said. What if we made a web series of other heroes and made this world large and actually tried spending money and expanding this. 

SO THIS WAS BORN. 

(WEB SERIES TRAILER) 


BELOW YOU WILL SEE THE FEATURE FILM PITCH TRAILER. We made this to generate some kind of buzz about the feature film we wanted to make. Of course you can see none of this looks as good as the feature film trailer you have seen in already. 


HERE IS AN INTERVIEW FROM THE WEB SERIES RUN


AND OF COURSE HERE ARE A FEW TRAILERS FROM THE WEB SERIES. 

EPISODE 2 - 


DESTRUCTION OF THE CITY TEASER (showing what was to come in the series) 


EPISODE 9 - 


The trailers started getting a bit lazy by our editor and became more of a teaser for the episode. You can see where the fx and everything was getting better but notice we have bad audio and everything. It was a learning process. 

Episode 2 Bloopers. 


A DORITOS COMMERCIAL THAT WE MADE STARRING EGOTAN AND CYBERSTING! 


AND OF COURSE ALL OF THE WEB SERIES AND EVERYTHING FELL TO A STAND STILL mainly because this was a free web series that we put out an episode once a month and we filmed everything every month fx and all and boom its out. Well we couldn't always get every actor out on shooting days, and had to rewrite the scripts and such so we just did not like how the whole series was going it seemed jumbled up and confusing when all the stories did in fact link up prior to shooting and having to change things up on the spot. So all of this became this.  (THE FEATURE FILM TRAILER BELOW) 

FEATURE FILM TRAILER 


WE had tremendous ups and downs with the series and we learned a lot. We wouldn't trade it for the world because it got us to where we are now. 

MERCH!

JUST A FEW PICTURES OF WHAT THE MERCH IS GOING TO LOOK LIKE



JUST FOR FUN I HAVE ATTACHED MGI PRODUCTIONS' AWARD WINNING SHORT FILM MALICE - This was suppose to be in the ABC'S of DEATH 2 but got taken out due to the fact that there was no on screen death. 

ENJOY -

story:
Help Raise Hell.



Nightmare Film Crew is asking for a helping hand...


A little over a year ago pre-production began on The Passage, a short horror film written and directed by Anthony Altamura. He has assembled a team of extraordinary talent, featuring a seasoned cast and accomplished visual artists. He and his team are determined to bring a truly horrifying story to life and help usher in a new golden age of horror films. 


A Film for Horror fans by Horror fans...
The Passage is a story unlike any other. Somewhere in all of us lies the fear of staring Evil in its face. But what happens when you cannot turn and run away from it? The Passage brings the terrifying answer to that question directly to the viewer in an experience that will linger after the credits have rolled. 

What We Need From You...
We are asking you to be a part of our journey into the dark. 


Nightmare Film Crew needs a few more things to make this possible:

  • Accomodations for our talent
  • Camera, lighting, and sound equipment
  • Travel Fees
  • Festival entree and promotional fees

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share and spread the word!

www.thepassagehorrorfilm.com

Tag us on Instagram - @thepassagehorrorfilm 

#thepassagefilm

story:
RealTalk- • By your side. •


RealTalk is an app by Swostik Pandey that you can download on your iOS device and be able to post personal feelings and opinions. A massive platform where no one is judged for what they believe in. 


Swostik's say
I am a 16 year old guy from Hong Kong, the largest trade port in the world. I aspire to be an entrepreneur. I doing my a-levels now and I take economics and business as my subjects. Through what I learn, I wish to make use into real business ideas. Leadership is one of my favorite concepts, and am currently the president of my school. I believe that the uptake of responsibility makes me grow to become a mature person. I believe in a world where everyone is connected. I wish to create solutions to problems that exist. 
 You see, nowadays, everyone is judged for what they do. With such a fastly growing world, I feel that there is the need for a platform for people to speak up on the go. My vision is to see RealTalk grow into a platform where thousands of people will be using their own understandings and feelings to make the lives of other people better. 
I really don't want people to pay to download my app. Amazing shouldn't be paid for. Now, that's why I've created this crowdfunding campaign. I would really appreciate it if you could financially contribute to my campaign. If not, then even a simple share on Facebook, Twitter or talking about it to a friend, will also help.
If you are a person that sees potential in someone or something, I can assure that RealTalk will not let you down. Or if you are a person that believes that its about that time that someone comes up with something big, then RealTalk is definitely your thing. Together, we can make RealTalk big.

Thank you,
Swostik. 


REALTALK? WHAT'S THAT?
 RealTalk, addresses to millions of people throughout the world who simply can't speak up to people around them for being judged. We envision this to be a app where people can get positive feedback by creating their own groups or discussion to get people with similar people with the same ideas to give their point of view. 

Users get to keep their identity and can chose security features while logging in, This will successfully allow people to voice out their problems without going under pressure on how people will react or act towards you after knowing your issues. 

Categories make the app more flexible, allowing people from all ages to talk about whatever you want to. You have the choice to make your own fourm too. Sports, food, TV shows, singers, bands, and much much more. You can be on this app disregarding your emotion meaning you can have real talk, some banter, confess about something or talk about something that makes you happy.


Contribution

Building a app is hard and expensive. Building a app with a large database is much harder and expensive. Apart from all your contributions we have no other investors or source of finance. That being said, I promise you every single dollar of contribution will be put into making this app better eventually into something beautiful.

 I am determined to make this app happen. However, I do have to think about what if the campaign cannot be fully funded. If that does happen, I will still try my best to make the app. I will take in investors and "angels" who will help me fund the app, assuring you that your money will still be put into use.



Funding goal: USD $15,000 

Breakdown of what the money will be spent on

  1. App development: $8,000
  2.  Captial: $5,000
  3. Marketing costs :$1,000
  4. Crowdfunding costs: $1,000

  • Risks & Challenges
There are few other apps similar to RealTalk, the popular ones being Whisper. However, Whisper is a app that is slowly fading and the need of a new updated app is much needed in the market. We also understand that the problem of me being teenagers and starting app will be a issue as I understand that you would ask yourself " can they really do it?". I can assure you that we will give our total effort to make things happen. Sometimes in life you have to trust your instinct and fund something that could possibly be the next million dollar app ;)

I am determined to make this app happen. This is where the support of all of you comes in place. I personally believe this app will make the lives of people in many different situations in their lives. With your contribution, this app will truly be successful. We understand that many of you will not be able to contribute financially, but you can simply share this project to your friends on facebook, twitter or anyway you want. Let's make things happen!
*****If you're from Hong Kong and would like to contribute, you are able to help this project out by cash up front or bank transfer. For more Hong Kong based questions, please feel free to contract any members of our team via Facebook messenger or simply email us on realtalk.byyourside@gmail.com and we'll provide you with all the information needed. *****

RealTalk- • By your side. •
story_txt:
RealTalk- • By your side. •


RealTalk is an app by Swostik Pandey that you can download on your iOS device and be able to post personal feelings and opinions. A massive platform where no one is judged for what they believe in. 




Swostik's say
I am a 16 year old guy from Hong Kong, the largest trade port in the world. I aspire to be an entrepreneur. I doing my a-levels now and I take economics and business as my subjects. Through what I learn, I wish to make use into real business ideas. Leadership is one of my favorite concepts, and am currently the president of my school. I believe that the uptake of responsibility makes me grow to become a mature person. I believe in a world where everyone is connected. I wish to create solutions to problems that exist. 
 You see, nowadays, everyone is judged for what they do. With such a fastly growing world, I feel that there is the need for a platform for people to speak up on the go. My vision is to see RealTalk grow into a platform where thousands of people will be using their own understandings and feelings to make the lives of other people better. 
I really don't want people to pay to download my app. Amazing shouldn't be paid for. Now, that's why I've created this crowdfunding campaign. I would really appreciate it if you could financially contribute to my campaign. If not, then even a simple share on Facebook, Twitter or talking about it to a friend, will also help.
If you are a person that sees potential in someone or something, I can assure that RealTalk will not let you down. Or if you are a person that believes that its about that time that someone comes up with something big, then RealTalk is definitely your thing. Together, we can make RealTalk big.

Thank you,

Swostik.

story:
Short Summary

We would like to tell our contributors why they should contribute and inspire their passion. 

  • Hello everyone my name is Michael Kirby Simpson. I have a bachelors in television / film with a telecommunications option. I am currently a law student at Western New England School of Law. I have a passion for films, music, games, and communicating.
  • NADOTI.com is campaigning for the funds it needs to have the second phase of the website built. The second phase will allow people to upload videos, music, and games. This is the stage where we will solicit subscribers and entice them to continue to support us.
  • We are a few hardworking people. We are in the process of starting something great. Helping us with NADOTI.com it is tantamount to helping NASA send a rocket ship into space. THE WORLD NEEDS NADOTI.com!

What We Need & What You Get

The money will be used for NADOTI.com :

  • We need $25,000 to pay a web development company to rebuild NADOTI.com so that it allows people to chat, upload videos, music, and games. The remainder will be used as follows $14,000 for sales inventory, and $6,000 to get us in a new location.
  • You might want to sit down for this we are giving you a cool decal of the company logo. But wait there's more. If the campaign runs well we may give away subscriptions. 
  • Should we not meet our goal we will invest the monies in the development of NADOTI.com and have another campaign.

The Impact

NADOTI.com is the greatest website in the world because it allows everything people love to do on the Internet:

  • The idea of Night And Day On The Internet is to provide a platform for people around the world to appreciate media, share their appreciation of media, and communicate about media with the world.
  • NADOTI.com is currently a "WordPress" website that allows people to listen to music and watch movies. We would like to add some automation that allows uploading, chatting, and streaming from NADOTI.com. NADOTI.com averages approximately 500 users a month. We believe that will increase exponentially with phase II. Our users are currently hampered by our inability to add content fast enough, inability to chat, and stream from NADOTI.com. Phase II will eliminate those issues.
  • Everyone loves a movie, a song, or a game. We all love telling others about what we like and dislike. NADOTI.com is the ideal platform to do just that.

Risks & Challenges

Our challenges include reaching enough people who like games, music, and videos. We are also concerned about the deal we need on the rights to stream videos. 

  • Our group know people who love movies, music, and games. That is what we gained in college a network of like minded media lovers. We negotiate everyday whether it is on the best angle for a film shoot or an edit in a film.
  • We will stand firm in our request for a profitable streaming deal explaining the long-term advantage of the rate we require. Our group plans on having a marketing campaign that promotes the advantages and fun of the site.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can not contribute please tell a friend and share their contact information with us. Indiegogo has share tools please use them.
  • You may also help by volunteering for NADOTI.com. We could really use your help during the marketing campaign.

story:
Short Summary

We are an ambitious student production group looking to raise funds for our upcoming short film drama 'Beachcomber'. Our film is metaphorical, poetic and emotional exploring the themes of love, loss and addiction. Our short synopsis is:

A man takes a metaphorical journey on a beach with his metal detector, looking for old, happy memories he has shared with his family. However, the emergence of his gambling addiction has driven his family away, and now he has no way back. 

In our 2nd year at the University of Portsmouth, this film will go towards our degree. However we would also like to submit 'Beachcomber' to various film festivals nationally, and globally. We plan to film at the end of January on Eastney beach and have already got keen, professional actors applying for roles. 

What We Need

Here's a short summary of where the money will go:

  • Props - metal detector, sugar glass, costume etc.
  • Transport - for actors and equipment
  • Actor's other expenses
  • Film festival submissions (the amount we raise will determine how many/which festivals we are able to submit to)

The Impact

We are aspiring film-makers and so this funding will give us the opportunity to produce a film which is professional. We see this film as a potential stepping stone in our careers, but without funding the production of our film won't be possible - at least not to a high-standard. So any help that can be offered would be much appreciated. 

Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!
Thank you for stopping by and hopefully helping us to go travel around making awesome videos of some of the most beautiful places in the world.
We are Victor Icazbalceta and Erika Kosegarten, we are 23 years old and we are film makers/travellers/drone enthusiasts. We recently bought a DJI Phantom 3 Pro Drone, and we're having a blast shooting all kinds of stuff with it, we love how beautiful everything looks from above, we've had the opportunity to travel around our country and make beautiful videos of the places we go and we want to go further and do the same everywhere in the world.
The two things we love the most are travelling and making videos, with your contribution you will help us achieve both things, and together we'll make 10 awesome films to share with the world, you can make us the happiest ever and get some perks along the way.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help us stay 5 days on each of the cities we want to capture and share with you.
We are currently living in Monterrey Mexico, the plan is to fly to Madrid and start the trip there:
1. Madrid
2. Barcelona
3. Paris
4. London
5. Amsterdam
6. Prague
7. Wien
8. Munich
9. Florence
10. Rome
When we reach the goal, you'll help us cover all the expenses for accommodation, food, and transport. Most of the cities are kind of expensive, we want to try and keep it as cheap as possible: travelling with the cheapest airlines, buses, or whatever is cheaper; staying with friends if possible, in hostels if not; staying away from fancy expensive restaurants.
With your contribution, you will also get awesome perks! Anything you can donate will help, but if you can help with 5 USD or more, you will get things from: Special thanks credit in one of the videos, up to actually being on one of the films (if you live in or near one of the cities above).

The Impact

I'm positive we can make this happen, and hopefully we'll be able to replicate this and visit the most beautiful places from every continent and why not, maybe even every country.
Being able to see the world from a different perspective, in our opinion, the most beautiful perspective.
Helping us share this perspective with everyone, show them how awesome everything looks from above.
Getting you and other people exited about travelling, about finding new ways to see the world, about sharing, about meeting new people, cultures, languages, ways of living.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit of help is for ever appreciated, if you can't make a donation, don't worry there are other ways to help a lot.
You can help us by sharing and making noise about this campaign, whether it is by posting it on your social networks or even mentioning it to your friends and family, one share can make a huge difference.

Thanks a lot for your help, we can't wait to meet you guys and share with you and everyone, what we're passionate about.

story:
Hello, everyone!

My name is Beverly Tan and I am the writer/producer/director of the short film “The Last Line” which has been presented in seven film festivals so far.

Needless to say, I want to make another one where I challenge a few conventions and express my view of the world a little more. I want to explore a kind of relationship that I feel has been mostly unrepresented in the media so far in a positive and hopeful light. I have produced several projects in the past such as films and music videos but this gives me a chance to make something for myself and share it with the world.

With your help, we can present a professional quality short film that will display a healthy same-sex relationship. It's no secret that this has been underrepresented in the past and I want to change that. I think you want to change that. I think you know someone who isn't necessarily heterosexual who often feels neglected if not somewhat abused by how “their kind” are portrayed in traditional media. Maybe you are that person. Well, this is your chance to take a step away from this negative tradition.

We're looking to raise $3,500 for “With Love”, a short film about Calvin and Jamie, a young gay couple who can only communicate through letters when the latter is deployed abroad for several months. The money will go to the use of several locations as well as gas for transporting equipment and one day of shooting at the local beach. We also need a hard drive to store and edit the footage. We're hoping to keep our hardworking crew well fed as well since they are surrendering their hard-earned free time because they believe in this project and want to help. I can also tell you from experience that film festivals don't let you in for free so entry fees are going into the budget too.

Of course, I don't expect you to just hand over money for nothing. We have plenty of perks such as copies of the script signed by the cast and crew, t-shirts, the chance to be on camera yourself and more! We'll even give you a mention in the credits!

But if you want to contribute but don't have the money, that's OK, too. We need volunteers, extras, sponsors and we're still looking for locations. Or you can help get the word around. Tell people on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr or even face-to-face about this awesome short film being put together in North Carolina.

This film can really make a difference. We can show people that homosexual relationships are normal relationships between people who genuinely care about each other. That it's not just about sex but a connection that won't be undone by something as trivial as distance. It'll also show people that we have a thriving LGBT community here in the South and we want to represent them.

Naturally, this means we'll have to deal with people who aren't comfortable with this group. Though we're not trying to be political, we're not oblivious to the negative element in today's social climate. And that's on top of all the usual hassles that come with filming like limited resources, time constraints, acquiring and transferring equipment and all the other horror stories you hear about on DVD commentaries and making-of features.

But I am confident that we can overcome these challenges! Even now I am researching locations and talking to local businesses for sponsorship and permission to film. We already have a location in Apex that is just beautiful. Most of the crew has already been assembled with a few slots to fill in if anyone's looking to do more than just donate.

Filming will be at the end of March. Then we'll have post production and the festival circuit. I'm excited for this project. I really believe this will make a difference in the lives of those involved and maybe bring hope to those who'll watch it.

Thank you!


UPDATE!!!


We have two confirmed filming locations!  We'll be at Common Grounds Coffee in Apex and Common 414 in Raleigh, NC on the final weekend of March!


UPDATE!!!

We've heard about some problems with the sound on the video and fixed that!  Sorry for any inconvenience.  Also, we're in the process of looking for locations at beaches and golf courses for the desert scenes.

story:
We are a group of italian filmakers  who always support independent productions  (http://www.fufilm.eu/about-us?lang=en).

We think this is the best way to tell the reality.

In 2014 we went to Nepal using our money to make a documentary about this lovefull  and  extraordinary country.

A french friend, Elsa, told us about a tiny village located in Anapurna range, called Nangi, where a very unique women community live in.

So we left Kathmandu and after a 24 hours very long trip, we reached finally Nangi and met the Magar Women.

The thing that immediately most enjoyed and surprised us was to notice that within the village any type of choice was only taken to safeguard the general interest of the community. There was not any special privileges.

Moreover, almost all the women played leading roles within the community.

 Always used to lead their lives on their own because their husbands are recruited for centuries by the British and Indian Army due to their tenacity and fatigue resistance, these women live for the sake of the community by performing decision-making roles that are unimaginable in other parts of Nepal.

 In fact our women, also while moving in a remote and hostile environment such as the Annapurna mountain range, have developed various skills and talents to produce the income that gave them also their autonomy and the social and political independence which has automatically placed them on the same footing as men.

 Tribal and emancipated at the same time, they  showed us a wonderfull example of traditional democratic and self conteined community, very rare in our hyper globalized society. 

Immediately we fell in love their beauty and simplicity  and we decided to start this movie.

Help us to finish this film and spread wherever this fantastic all female community model.

Support the status of women around the world!

 

                     

                         THE MOVIE

                     MAGAR WOMEN

The life of group of women living in Nangi, a tiny village on the rugged mountain ranges of Nepal.


They are Magar Women. They produce income, decide for themselves, love nature. They have a pronounced sense of community and have done of their village a model of women emancipation.

In a country where the women conditions are one of the world's worst, the Nangi women fight with the strength of their smile.


A choral film on these women seen in their everyday activities: the “group work” and the herbarium, the community meetings and the religious rituals in the so called “Magic Forest”. Around them the amazing landscape of one of the world most high and unknown mountain ranges. 

 

Directed by: Rosario Simanella
Production: FuFilm
Format, Sound: Full HD – Stereo
Language: Nepali
Subtitles: English/Italian
Authors: Cristina Donno, Gianluca Marcon, Elsa Sallenave
Cinematographer: Marco Landini
Sound: Jan Maio
Music: Jan Maio, Massimiliano Amatruda

 

 

 

WHY DO WE NEED 6000 EURO?

 

We believe in this project and we think these women created in their village a great model of woman emancipation.

Especially in Nepal, where there are very difficult women living conditions.

We want to spread everywhere this amazing community model, because we think everyone has the right to watch the results of this changing.

We went to Nepal using our money, and we shot this movie using our 
technical equipment.

Now we are editing the movie but we need more money to complete this project.

We need :

  • 2000 euro to pay the sound designer and mix.
  • 1500 euro to pay original soundtrack.
  • 1000 euro to make color grading.
  • 1500 euro to finish nepalese english translations.

 

 

We have been several times to Nepal and we know the conditions of poverty of the country (especially after the last earthquake in 2015).

We got in touch with an association very active in that area of ​​the country, the Himanchal Educational Foundation (www.himanchal.org), which surprised us very positively for its activities.

Therefore also aware of our privileged position of Western filmmakers that allows us to tell stories even in a country that needs much more than just movies, we decided to donate 25 percent of all money we will derive from this campaign, directly to  Himanchal Educational Foundation.

We will bring them the money directly next November 2016 when we will come back to Nangi to finish the movie!

We have already spent all our financial resources, now we need your help.

Please help us to finish this movie and to show it everywhere in the world to improve women conditions in all the world.

Help us spread the Magar women model!

 

 

SPREAD EVERYWHERE THE MAGAR WOMEN SMILE!

 

                                

                                VERSIONE ITALIANA

 

 

Siamo un gruppo di filmakers indipendenti che sostengono da sempre le produzioni indipendenti dal basso. (http://www.fufilm.eu/chi-siamo)

Pensiamo che questo sia il modo migliore per raccontare la realtà.

Nel 2014 siamo andati in Nepal a nostre spese per fare un documentario su questo straordinario Paese.

Un amica francese, Elsa, ci parlò di un piccolo villaggio situato sulla catena dell'Annapurna, chiamato Nangi, dove vi vive una comunità di donne del tutto particolare e unica.

Così siamo partiti da Kathmandu e, dopo un viaggio veramente molto lungo di 24 ore, abbiamo finalmente raggiunto Nangi e  incontrato le donne Magar.

La cosa che subito ci ha maggiormente stupito è stato notare come all'interno del villaggio qualunque tipo di scelta venisse presa solo per salvaguardare l'interesse generale della comunità, senza che esistano privilegi particolari. E come le donne svolgano un ruolo primario all'interno della comunità.

Da sempre costrette infatti a vivere senza i loro mariti (la maggior parte di essi infatti passa gran parte della  vita all'estero lavorando nell'esercito inglese o indiano o nei Paesi arabi) le donne a Nangi hanno sviluppato una forte autonomia decisionale e politica, la maggior parte delle volte sono a capo dei gruppi che regolano la vita politica e le attività del villaggio, e hanno trovato anche diverse maniere di crearsi un reddito.

Tribali ed emancipate allo stesso tempo, ci mostrarono un meraviglioso modello di comunità autonoma e sostenibile, molto raro nella nostra società iperglobalizzata.

Immediatamente siamo stati rapiti dalla loro bellezza e semplicità e abbiamo deciso di iniziare questo film.

Aiutateci a finire questo film e diffondere ovunque questo fantastico modello comunitario tutto al femminile.

Sostieni la condizione delle donne ovunque nel mondo!

 

                         IL FILM

               LE DONNE MAGAR

La vita di un gruppo di donne che vivono a Nangi, un piccolo villaggio sulle catene montuose del Nepal.

Sono donne Magar, producono reddito, prendono decisioni e amano la natura.

Hanno uno spiccato  senso della comunità e hanno fatto del loro villaggio un modello di emancipazione femminile.

In un Paese, il Nepal, dove le condizioni delle donne sono tra le peggiori al mondo, le donne Magar combattono con la forza del sorriso.

Un film corale sulla vita di  queste donne viste nelle loro attività quotidiane: le attività dei "gruppi di lavoro" e la vita nell'erbolario, le riunioni della comunità e i riti religiosi nella cosiddetta "Magic Forest".

E tutto Intorno a loro l'incredibile paesaggio di una delle catene montuose più alte e affascinanti al mondo.

 

Directed by: Rosario Simanella
Production: FuFilm
Format, Sound: Full HD – Stereo
Language: Nepali
Subtitles: English/Italian
Authors: Cristina Donno, Gianluca Marcon, Elsa Sallenave.
Cinematographer: Marco Landini
Sound: Jan Maio
Music: Jan Maio, Massimiliano Amatruda

 

 

PERCHE' ABBIAMO BISOGNO DI 6000 EURO?

 

Crediamo molto in questo progetto e pensiamo che queste donne abbiano creato nel loro villaggio un grande modello di emancipazione femminile.

Soprattutto in Nepal, un paese dove la condizione femminile è veramente molto difficile.

Vogliamo diffondere ovunque questo straordinario modello di comunità, perché  ognuno ha il diritto di vedere i risultati di questo cambiamento.

Siamo stati in Nepal a nostre spese e abbiamo girato questo film utilizzando il nostro
equipaggiamento tecnico.

Ora stiamo montando il film, ma abbiamo bisogno di più soldi per completare questo progetto.

In particolare ci occorrono:

  • 2000 € per pagare  sound designer e mix.
  • 1500 € per pagare musiche originali.
  • 1000 € per il color grading.
  • 1500 € per finire le traduzioni dal dialetto Magar all'inglese.

 

 

Siamo stati varie volte in Nepal e conosciamo le condizioni di povertà in cui vive il Paese (soprattutto dopo l'ultimo terremoto del 2015). Siamo entrati in contatto con una Associazione molto attiva in quella zona del Paese, l'Himanchal Educational Foundation (www.himanchal.org), che ci ha stupito molto positivamente per le sue attività.

Consapevoli quindi anche della nostra condizione privilegiata di filmaker occidentali che ci permette di raccontare storie anche  in un Paese che ha bisogno di tante cose oltre i film, abbiamo deciso di donare il 25 per cento di tutto quello che ricaveremo da questa raccolta direttamente all' Himanchal Educational Foundation.

E porteremo direttamente noi i soldi il prossimo Novembre 2016 quando torneremo in Nepal a Nangi per finire il film!

Abbiamo già speso tutte le nostre risorse finanziarie, ora abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto.

Aiutatecii a finire questo film e mostrare in tutto il mondo il volto sorridente di queste rivoluzionarie donne nepalesi!

Aiutaci a diffondere il modello delle donne Magar!

DIFFONDI OVUNQUE IL SORRISO DELLE DONNE MAGAR!

story:
THE STORY

DYING TO DIVORCE is a brand new observational documentary about the women fighting against domestic abuse and the murder of women in Turkey. Last year alone nearly three hundred women were killed- the majority were seeking a divorce or separation. And the men are literally getting away with murder by using legal loopholes to argue they were ‘provoked’ by their wives. 

Our film follows a group of female lawyers, activists, MP's and survivors as they tackle this violence head-on; fighting to change the law and to bring violent husbands to justice.  It will explore both sides of these stories and hear the perpetrators own reflections on their actions. 

FILM HAKKINDA

Dying to Divorce" sayfasına hoşgeldiniz! "Dying to Divorce" Türkiye'de kadına karşı şiddet ve kadın cinayetlerine karşı mücadele veren kadınlar hakkında yeni bir gözlemci belgeseldir. Geçen yıl Türkiye'de, çoğu eşlerinden boşanmak isteyen 300'ün üzerinde kadın öldürüldü. Ve katiller eşlerinin onları "tahrik ettiğini" öne sürüp yasadaki boşluklardan yararlanmayı başardılar. Belgeselimiz bir grup kadın avukat, aktivist, milletvekeli ve eşlerinin şiddetine uğramalarına rağmen hayatta kalmayı başaran kadınları şiddete son vermeye, yasaları değiştirmeye ve adaleti sağlamaya çalışırken takip ediyor. Aynı zamanda, hikayenin diğer tarafına da bakarak faillere de yaptıkları üzerine konuşma imkanı veriyor. Bu,Türkiye'deki kadınlar için tarihi bir zaman - sizin de bu yolculukta bize katılacağınızı umuyoruz. Şimdi bağışta bulunun

AN INTERNATIONAL COLLABORATION

The film is a collaboration between emerging director Chloe Fairweather, producer Sinead Kirwan, Tigerlily Productions and The Fuller Project For International Reporting in Istanbul. By supporting this story you are not only supporting women in Turkey but a strong group of female film-makers and journalists with an international reputation and the experience to create a fantastic film. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP?

We have already shot some footage for the film but we still have a lot to do. Over the summer, Chloe Fairweather, the director has been filming in Turkey with survivors of violence and following some extraordinary stories but to follow these stories to completion, we need your help.

DONATE/SHARE/WRITE

DONATE: Your donation will help us pay for:

- A Turkish field producer to work with on the ground in Turkey full-time. Their role will be to follow the complex legal elements of the story and make sure we are granted access to the important  legal and political institutions in Turkey that are crucial to understanding the struggle women face.

- The costs of flights and insurance for Chloe to go back and finish capturing the story. At this moment in time Turkey is quite unstable and we need finances to ensure our team can carry on filming safely and respond quickly to changing events. 

- Translations and research. Your donation will allow us to get all the material we have already shot translated and ready for editing.

- Wages for the team in general. We believe that people should be paid for their work and passion is not enough to live on. Your donation will support the team to give this project the time it deserves, while simultaneously being able to live and support themselves.  This is really important if we want to nurture new talent from a broad range of social backgrounds. 

SHARE: 

- Sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter helps to create a much bigger audience for our campaign then we can reach on our own. Every Like or Share, opens up hundreds of new possibilities for support. Follow us @dyingtodivorce or www.facebook.com/dyingtodivorce

- The more Likes and Retweets we get, the more attention the film gets from other funding bodies and organisations and more likely we are to hit our target.  What can seem like a small action, can make a huge difference.

WRITE: 

-Think about who might be interested in our campaign and write them a personal email with the link encouraging them to donate. Personal recommendations and endorsements are the number one way to build support for this project and help us raise the funds needed to continue. 

- If you are journalist, why not see if you can pitch a piece about the campaign or profile this fantastic all-female team?

OUR CONTRIBUTORS

At the film’s heart will be two very different survivors: Arzu, a rural mother of six living on a remote farm, who was shot by her husband and Kubra, a glamorous Bloomberg newsreader, who has been left with a brain injury after alledgedly being attacked by her husband, a claim he is denying. We will follow their journey of recovery and as they struggle to bring violent husbands to justice in a court system that feels stacked against them. The film will also question whether real change can be achieved by changing the law alone.

WHY MAKE THIS FILM?

On average two women a week are killed by their partners or ex-partners in the UK. A third of all women in the US are murdered by their partners or ex-partners. Over 150 women have been killed in Turkey this year. This is an emergency situation, an epidemic that needs to end now. Violence against women is a pervasive, global problem and  we want to make this film to show that women can fight back and create positive change.

By using contrasting stories that cut across Turkish society we hope to  break some of the stereotypes about women affected by domestic violence and show the great strength it takes to break free.  We want to make a film that brings the viewer right to the heart of these cases and spark a global conversation about what we can all do to stop violence against women.  Most importantly, we want to give a platform to women to tell their own story.

WHY NOW?

Turkey is a country in flux. In June, 97 female MP’s were elected to parliament. However, another election has been called for November that could undo that victory. We believe this is a key moment in history for women in Turkey and the stakes are very high.  Following this story now will allow us to give a voice to people on the ground, capture a dramatic piece of social history and will allow us to create a tool that can be used by campaigners and activists going forward. This story is unfolding as we speak and if we fail to capture it now, the opportunity will be lost, along with the individual lessons and experiences of the survivors on the frontline of this fight.

THE TEAM 


 

DIRECTOR: CHLOE FAIRWEATHER

Chloe Fairweather is a BBC trained documentary filmmaker and video journalist specialising in social documentaries about sensitive and important stories. She produced and directed the critically acclaimed BAFTA and Grierson Shortlisted MR ALZHEIMERS AND ME for CBBC, filming from the point of children whose grandparents have dementia. She spent a year in Birmingham as a DV Director with NHS and Social Services making the Grierson and Royal Television Society nominated BBC 2 series PROTECTING OUR PARENTS. She  co-produced BBC 2’s MY CHILD THE RIOTER with BAFTA and Emmy award winning Director Olly Lambert. 

PRODUCER: SINEAD KIRWAN

Sinead Kirwan, the film’s producer, previously worked on STILL THE ENEMY WITHIN, a critically acclaimed crowdfunded documentary examining the impact of the 1984-85 UK miners’ strike on ordinary people.  The film won the 2014 Sheffield Documentary Audience Award, a nomination for a Focal Award, was selected for Hotdocs in Toronto & shortlisted for a Grierson award. It was screened in independent cinemas across the UK becoming one of the top-grossing documentaries of 2014. 

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER: CHRISTINA ASQUITH

Christina Asquith is an independent journalist based out of Istanbul, Turkey, with a focus on investigative reporting of women's lives, with articles published in New York Times, ELLE Magazine, The Guardian, Washington Post and others.Christina is co-director of The Fuller Project For International Reporting, a multi-media team of journalists dedicated to in-depth reporting on the traditionally overlooked and underrepresented role of women in foreign policy.  Recently, she executively produced two short documentaries on Syrian and Turkish women, shown in the NYTimes and ELLE.com. Prior to Istanbul, Christina covered the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan as a freelancer for 10 years, writing, "Sisters in War", published by Random House in 2009. Christina started her career at The New York Times Boston Bureau, and was a staffer at The Philadelphia Inquirer.

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER: NATASHA DACK OJUMU

Natasha Dack-Ojumu is co-managing director of Tigerlily Productions, a UK based company producing consistently innovative work in documentary, drama and feature films. Natasha has produced several successful films includin SHE, A CHINESE, the BAFTA and RTS award winning feature length drama, PLEASURELAND (C4), the critically acclaimed documentaries BLACK POWER SALUTE (BBC), AFTER THE APOCALYPSE (C4), PLUS TUBULAR BELLS (BBC4)and Caligari Film Prize (Berlin), Best International Documentary (HotDocs) and Best British Feature Documentary (BritDoc) winner 37 USES FOR A DEAD SHEEP. Natasha also executive produced the BAFTA nominated MCCULLIN and TRANSGENDER AND OVER 60 (Newsnight).  

WHAT NEXT?

We already have two major broadcasters that are interested in screening this film. We aim to have several others lined-up by the time the film is finished. At the same time, we are developing a large community screening plan, to make sure the film has maximum impact in the areas it is needed most.   We are already in discussions with universities and colleges across Turkey about screening this film, as part of their curriculum's.  We are also developing a program to get the film seen in places with high-levels of domestic violence.  We would like to replicate this in the UK.

We want this film to be a real tool for change and education on the issue of domestic violence and women’s rights both in and outside Turkey. Both director Chloe Fairweather and producer Sinead Kirwan have an extensive backgrounds in creating films that have strong educational and social benefit. Alongside this, the Fuller Project For International Reporting gives this film a connection to audiences of influential and important people across the world, who can increase pressure on the the Turkish government to try and tackle this issue. 

With your support, we can support women in Turkey, share their stories globally, and create a positive change.  Please donate to this project.
