story:
Who I am.


My name is Tyler Wright, Ive been playing paintball and around paintball basically my entire life. Even as a kid we had a paintball field in the yard at home my dad owned a few dozen Tippmann SL 68 II's that would be passed out to friends and family to go out and play. My oldest brother Lane would go on to play pro and is now the COO of the PSP (paintball sports promotion) and the owner of the field Paintball Atlanta. I currently run and operate a non profit paintball buy sale trade called Honest PB where we focus on providing a safe buying selling and trading environment for paintballers while exposing the scammers.

This campaign was brought about by a buzz of interest within the paintball community surrounding this small town for sale in South Dakota. Sparked by the idea of creating an environment of paintball. the concept of crowd funding such a project stirred through the community.

The grand scale of what were doing here may not be readily apparent but for a moment really let the idea of a town being used for paintball would really be like. The magnitude of the experience and the reality of what this can be

The break down.

Lets be black and white the roughly two hundred and fifty thousand will go to a real estate agency in Rapid City SD. That covers the acquisition any and all moneys over that will go into the transformation. Netting,bunkers, fill stations, insurance. Converting this will be no small task making it playable will be no small task. So every dollar over the 250k benchmark will be just as valuable as every dollar before it.

Every person who donates to this fund be it as little as 1 dollar will receive free entry to this place, for life as-well as we plan to create a glorious monument with the names of every donator.

Have a building named after you or your team. (perks)

The town listing notes a tavern, a post office, a grocery store, a residence which locals believe to be haunted and a large garage. each of these places need to be renamed and that is the perk. name these buildings after yourself or after your team.

Post office- $1000

Large Garage- $2000

Grocery Store- $3000

Hunted Residence- $4000

The Tavern- $5000

-What if?

What if something unexpected happens? Say we reach our funding goal but the town is sold before we are able to purchase it. Or for whatever other reason we are not able to purchase the town.  Fortunately in the land of the free there are alot of large abandoned properties, old factories, abandoned schools and colleges, abandoned race tracks and yes other "ghost towns" the project will turn to these as secondary options. All aforementioned perks will carry over to these places as well and no decision will be made without a public discussion.

What if this campaign is a flop? and we do not raise enough to reasonably open any interesting field? the funds raised here will be donated to the wounded warrior project. An organization that has helped wounded veterans and the disabled stay in the game of paintball by providing the motorized paintball wheel chairs you have likely seen at big events.

The Impact

This opportunity is up to the players this cant happen with out you the paintball players. If you want a town dedicated to paintball then you can effectively cast your vote to making this happen by donating. If the paintball community wants it then it will happen. We have to potential here to make one of the most interesting paintball fields in the world and the potential is also here for you to be a driving part in this. and for you to really have an impact in the paintball world by being a part of this.



    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone can contribute money and we understand that but you can help this by sharing this talking to people at your local field as well as your team mates. Share this on your social media platform and help spread the word. This is for the paintball community as a whole lets get people excited about what this will become. Share the campaign and show your support for the sport. Us the indigogo share tools use your own methods and help get the word out.

    If you have any questions at all please dont hesitate to contact me at Tyler_Wright@live.com please only emails relative to the campaign.

story:
Hello. My name is Michael Field and I’d like to talk with you about Up on the Roof’s newest web series, Life Ends at 30. The story revolves around an ensemble of people, led by David who turns 30 at the start of the first season and his best friend Kyle, who has just turned 30 a few months back. Both are faced with the idea of growing up and both promptly flush it down the toilet.

This is comedy in the vein of It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia, South Park, Trailer Parks Boys and The League, just to name a few. It’s raw. It’s at the edge of the spectrum where pushing buttons is what we’re going for. 

The first season is 6 episodes, and we’re looking to raise money for the pilot. We plan to shoot the pilot in late January, and the full season around April, but we need to show what we can do first. This is where this campaign, and hopefully you, come in.

If you’d like to donate to our project, please choose from any one of the packages listed on this page. Any bit helps. The 5K is going towards the production costs of the shoot, which willl be over a weekend in late January. Insurance, Food, Equipment Rental, Location fees, Cast, etc.

If money is tight, no worries. Please like our page on Facebook, follow us on twitter and Instagram. As much as money is what we need right now, we also need fans. We need supporters. Everyone counts.

Thanks again. And on behalf of myself, our Producer Trish Clark, Director of Photography David Brown and Associate Producer Pat Whalen thank you for watching this video and supporting our project.

story:
Still Letters (Letras Fijas) is a short story about perceiving the value of a person’s presence. It is a story about those who go missing and cease to exist. 

The idea to the story comes from observing a bulletin board with posters of missing persons, and wondering who they were before their disappearance..



We are a group of film students, artists and indie filmmakers working under the name of Oculophilia Films. This short film will be the starting point to our future production of various works; some to be hosted freely on the internet, and hopefully others sent to festivals before starting to work on a feature film.  

As a production company, our goal is to take the unknown talents of people in the area and make them worthwhile on the screen. This rule applies for all of our members and future members, including departments such as writing, photography, art, make-up, music and so on.

We believe many of today's talents are hidden from the obvious sight, and finding them would mean making progress in the Mexican cinematographic industry.

After finishing this project, we will start the immediate production of new things (short films, videos for the web) and the planning of a feature film.

---

This is the complete list of people involved (as of now) in this project:

1.  Gabriel Gutiérrez (director, writer, producer)

Born in Tijuana, I've never thought that the places I knew were interesting or had much to tell, so I've always written fictitious stories. After moving to a bigger city, my sight grew wide to many things I had ignored for years. I find a calming sensation in telling stories, but I also love to pretend that things are different; there's something about picking up a camera and pressing the record button that always made me walk in this direction. I found my way into a small film school, but was unable to continue my studies. However, that was the starting point of this independent film company.
I spend most of my time writing, drawing or helping at home. You can find me on social media and check out some my work:
Facebook Artist Page
Youtube Channel
Some of the class projects I worked on:

2.  Sofía Amábile (director of photography)

After turning a class activity into a hobby and then into a passion, Sofía has participated in and won a couple of prizes for her portrait photography at local contests in Tijuana. 
Examples of her work:


 3. Guadalupe Morales (assistant director)

Academic and researcger concentrated in public health, she is also a human rights activist. Movies are a medium capable of solving social problems. Studied in the Centro de Estudios Cinematográficos de Baja California A. C./UIA

4.  Brenda Flores (production assistant)

Film student in the process of completing her first short film.

5.  Angel Peralta (sound designer, composer)

Member and founder of a progressive jazz/post-bop music trio "Angel Peralta Project", he has performed for various crowds in Tijuana. 

 Listen to his work and watch him perform:

Angel Peralta Project Facebook Page

Listen on SoundCloud




6. And You! (executive producer title in the film for the highest rewarding amount)


·  Equipment

Around 75%  of the money will go into buying the equipment to be used in this and future productions. The rest is to be used solely for the making of this short film, and sending the rewards.

 Our budget includes the following items:

1.  Two DSLR cameras.

2.  Two spare lenses.

3.  Sound kit (Shotgun mic, boom pole, cables, recorder).

4.  Storage and batteries for the cameras.

5.  Lighting equipment.

6.  An efficient computer for video editing.

7.  Other items such as a slate, tripods, cables.

8.  Rewards for the campaign.

9. And the money to be spent on food, transportation, wardrobe, props, and everything else that comes up during the shoot.


Aside from giving your direct support, you can help us by sharing this page with family and friends! The more people know about this project, the more succesful it will be.
Follow us on twitter
Give us a like
-------------------
ESPAÑOL

De lo que trata:

Letras Fijas es una historia corta sobre percibir el valor de la presencia de una persona.

La idea de la historia viene de observar un boletín con carteles de personas desaparecidas, y preguntarse quiénes fueron antes de su desaparición.

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un grupo de estudiantes de cine, artistas y cineastas independientes trabajando bajo el nombre de Oculophilia Films. Este cortometraje será el punto de partisa de nuestra futura producción de varias obras; algunas para publicarse gratuitamente en la red, y quizá algunas otras para enviarse a festivales antes de empezar a trabajar en un largometraje.

Como casa productora, nuestra meta es tomar los talentos desconocidos de personas en el área y hacerlos valer en la pantalla. Esta regla aplica para todos nuestros miembros y futuros miembros, incluyendo departamentos como guión, fotografía, arte, maquillaje, música y demás.

Creemos que muchos de los talentos de hoy están ocultos de la imagen clara, y encontrarlos significaría dar un paso adelante en la industria cinematográfica mexicana.

Después de terminar este proyecto, comenzaremos la producción inmediata de cosas nuevas (cortometrajes, videos en la red) y la planeación de un largometraje.

--

Nuestro equipo (hasta ahora) se conforma de los siguientes (subir al texto en inglés para ver las fotos):

1.  Gabriel Gutiérrez (director, guionista, productor)

Nacido en Tijuana, nunca he pensado que los lugares que conocí eran interesantes o tenían mucho que contar, de modo que siempre he escrito historias plenamente ficticias. Tras moverme a una ciudad más grande, mi vista se amplió a muchas cosas que había ignorado por años. Encuentro una sensación tranquilizante en el contar historias, pero también me gusta fingir que las cosas son diferentes; hay algo en el levantar una cámara y presionar el botón para grabar que siempre me hizo caminar en esta dirección. Encontré mi camino hacia una pequeña escuela de cine, pero ese camino trajo dificultades que me obligaron a darme de baja. Sin embargo, ése fue el punto de inicio de esta productora de cine independiente.

Paso la mayor parte de mi tiempo escribiendo, dibujando o ayudando en casa. Pueden encontrarme en las redes sociales y ver algunas de mis obras.

***ir arriba para los enlaces***

2.  Sofía Amábile (directora de fotografía)

Después de convertir una actividad paraescolar en un hobby, después en una pasión, Sofía ha participado y ganado un par de premios por sus fotografías de retratos en concursos en Tijuana.

***ir arriba para ver algunas de sus obras***

3.  Guadalupe Morales (asistente del director)

Académica e investigadora orientada a la salud pública; activista social, particularmente en pro de los derechos humanos y la ecología. El cine es un medio para promover y divulgar la lucha contra las problemáticas sociales. Diplomado en cinematografía en el Centro de Estudios Cinematográficos de Baja California A. C./UIA

4.  Brenda Flores (asistente de producción)

Estudiante de cine en el proceso de terminar su primer cortometraje.

5. Angel Peralta (diseño de sonido, compositor)

Miembro y fundador del trío musical de jazz progresivo/post-bop "Angel Peralta Project", ha tocado para varios públicos en Tijuana.

***ir arriba para escuchar***

5.  ¡Y tú! (título como productor ejecutivo al aportar la mayor cantidad disponible)

Lo que necesitamos:

-Equipo

Cerca del 75% del dinero se irá a comprar el equipo que será usado en esta y futuras producciones. El resto será usado únicamente para la producción de este cortometraje, y entregar las recompensas.

Nuestro presupuesto incluye los artículos siguientes:

1.  Dos cámaras DSLR.

2.  Dos lentes.

3.  Equipo de sonido (micrófono, boom, cables, grabadora).

4.  Memorias y baterías para las cámaras.

5.  Equipo de iluminación.

6.  Una computadora eficiente para edición.

7.  Otros artículos como tripiés, claqueta, cables.

8.  Recompensas.

9.  El dinero usado para comida, transporte, vestuario, utilería y todo lo demás que surgirá en la filmación.

Cómo puedes ayudar:

Más allá de dar apoyo directo, ¡puedes apoyarnos compartiendo esta página con familia y amigos! Cuanta más gente se entere, más exitoso será el proyecto.

Nuestras redes sociales:

Nuestra página de facebook
Síguenos en twitter
story_txt:
Still Letters (Letras Fijas) is a short story
about perceiving the value of a person’s presence. It is a story about those
who go missing and cease to exist.  
The idea to the story comes from observing a
bulletin board with posters of missing persons, and wondering who they were
before their disappearance.. 




We are a group of film students, artists and indie filmmakers working under the name
of Oculophilia Films. This short film will be the starting point to our future
production of various works; some to be hosted freely on the internet, and
hopefully others sent to festivals before starting to work on a feature film.  
As a
production company, our goal is to take the unknown talents of people in the
area and make them worthwhile on the screen. This rule applies for all of our
members and future members, including departments such as writing, photography, art, make-up, music and so
on.We believe many of today's talents are hidden from the obvious sight, and finding them would mean making progress in the Mexican cinematographic industry.After finishing this project, we will start the immediate production of new things (short films, videos for the web) and the planning of a feature film.---
This is the complete list of people involved (as of now) in this
project:
1. 
Gabriel Gutiérrez (director, writer, producer)Born in Tijuana, I've never thought that the places I knew were interesting or had much to tell, so I've always written fictitious stories. After moving to a bigger city, my sight grew wide to many things I had ignored for years. I find a calming sensation in telling stories, but I also love to pretend that things are different; there's something about picking up a camera and pressing the record button that always made me walk in this direction. I found my way into a small film school, but was unable to continue my studies. However, that was the starting point of this independent film company.
I spend most of my time writing, drawing or helping at home. You can find me on social media and check out some my work:Facebook Artist PageYoutube ChannelSome of the class projects I worked on:





2.  Sofía Amábile (director of
photography)


After turning a class activity into a hobby and then into a passion, Sofía has participated in and won a couple of prizes for her portrait photography at local contests in Tijuana. Examples of her work:



 3. Guadalupe Morales (assistant director)
Academic and researcger concentrated in public health, she is also a human rights activist. Movies are a medium capable of solving social problems. Studied in the Centro de Estudios Cinematográficos de Baja California A. C./UIA
4.  Brenda Flores (production assistant)


Film student in the process of completing her first short film.

5.  Angel Peralta (sound designer, composer)


Member and founder of a progressive jazz/post-bop music trio "Angel Peralta Project", he has performed for various crowds in Tijuana. 
 Listen to his work and watch him perform:
Angel Peralta Project Facebook Page
Listen on SoundCloud



6. And You! (executive producer title in the film for the highest rewarding amount)



· 
Equipment
Around 75%  of the money
will go into buying the equipment to be used in this and future
productions. The rest is to be used solely for the making of this short
film, and sending the rewards.


 Our budget includes the following items:
1.  Two DSLR cameras.
2.  Two spare lenses.
3.  Sound kit (Shotgun mic, boom pole,
cables, recorder).
4.  Storage and batteries for the
cameras.
5.  Lighting equipment.
6.  An efficient computer for video
editing.
7.  Other items such as a slate,
tripods, cables.
8.  Rewards for the campaign.
9. And the money
to be spent on food, transportation, wardrobe, props, and everything else that
comes up during the shoot.




Aside from giving your direct support, you can help us by sharing this page with family and friends! The more people know about this project, the more succesful it will be.Follow us on twitter
Give us a like-------------------ESPAÑOL
De lo que
trata:
Letras
Fijas es una historia corta sobre percibir el valor de la presencia de una
persona.
La idea de
la historia viene de observar un boletín con carteles de personas
desaparecidas, y preguntarse quiénes fueron antes de su desaparición.
¿Quiénes
somos?
Somos un
grupo de estudiantes de cine, artistas y cineastas independientes trabajando
bajo el nombre de Oculophilia Films. Este cortometraje será el punto de partisa de nuestra futura producción de varias obras; algunas para publicarse
gratuitamente en la red, y quizá algunas otras para enviarse a festivales antes
de empezar a trabajar en un largometraje.
Como casa productora, nuestra meta es tomar los talentos desconocidos de personas en el
área y hacerlos valer en la pantalla. Esta regla aplica para todos nuestros
miembros y futuros miembros, incluyendo departamentos como guión, fotografía,
arte, maquillaje, música y demás.
Creemos que
muchos de los talentos de hoy están ocultos de la imagen clara, y encontrarlos
significaría dar un paso adelante en la industria cinematográfica mexicana.
Después de
terminar este proyecto, comenzaremos la producción inmediata de cosas nuevas
(cortometrajes, videos en la red) y la planeación de un largometraje.
--

equipo (hasta ahora) se conforma de los siguientes (subir al texto en inglés

story:
Our Story:

We're Chris and Emilee Danielson. This independent film is a total step of faith to give people a tool to defend their beliefs and has been an absolute miracle unfolding before our eyes. We want YOU to join us!

 Even though we have been in ministry together for a long time, hosting syndicated radio shows, performing stand up/improv comedy and guest speaking in over 200 churches over the last decade, this project is what our heart is about. Over the last few years we’ve seen a sharp increase in the rejection of God’s Word, the Bible.  At the same time an increase in violence, crime, and the breakdown of family and community. Chris had a vision to blend stand up comedy (entertainment) with bible apologetics (education). 

So, against mighty odds and little funding, during our last comedy tour we went to God and asked Him to see this through. We obtained high end cameras and equipment, hired a small professional crew, and hit the road.  We talked to people across the country, from the educated elite to the man on the street, we wanted to find out: What do people honestly think about the Bible, and more importantly WHY?  What are the reasons people accept or reject God’s Word?  Do we have to throw reason and logic out the window in order to believe the Bible?  Is the Bible Provable?  We had to ask:  Are we IDIOTS for believing the Bible, or would we be IDIOTS not to?  

What we found was nothing less than miraculous.  Once we captured the footage, we knew we had something extraordinary that people needed to see.  By the hand of God, we have gotten enough funding to bring us this far.  We’ve done the comedy tour, captured the footage, and edited all down into an incredible, professional, full length reality documentary.  Unlike any other movie of it’s kind, we merged stand-up comedy with Bible apologetics for a uniquely humorous and engaging project.  

But as we have discovered, that was the easy part.  Now we enter the toughest challenge of the “Bible Idiots” project.  Getting it out and into the hands of people who truly want to hold onto and share their faith with a world that is increasingly hostile to the true Gospel of Jesus.  

We need your help to get the “Bible Idiots” documentary marketed and distributed.  We need your help to raise the awareness for Bible believers everywhere that there is a tool that will give them answers to common questions and objections to Christianity.  

What We Need:

Let’s be honest: 60k is less than the average catering budget for the average family film. We really need your help and you will make a huge difference.  Our next step is to promote and market this movie to get it into the hands of people who need it.  Your contributions will make that happen in a two different ways. 

Screening Events: Get face to face with churches, christian schools, and colleges. Some have asked for us to bring Bible Idiots to their people.  We will screen the movie and talk with people to help answer questions and encourage them in their faith.  We plan to hold events/screenings in 40+ states throughout 2016. Like any other tour, it costs money and needs to be funded.  

2.  Developing an overall advertising strategy, including online, social and traditional.  

3.  There are ministries around the globe, that will use “Bible Idiots” as a TOOL to encourage their people here at home and the missionaries as well in the communities in which they work.  

Your resource of any amount has the potential to strengthen and grow the kingdom on a world wide level.  

The IMPACT:

 Throughout the pre-screening process and initial release, people have responded with comments such as: 

“I am so excited to get into the Word again and read it.  I mean truly study what it really says”.  

“I have a brother who is having a really hard time right now.  He is at a crisis in his faith, and I need to get this to him”. 

“My daughter is going off to college this fall, I want her to have a copy of this”.  

Yes, “Bible Idiots” is already making a difference in the way people approach the Bible, and in their desire to know God more fully.  Your contribution will help raise awareness of this valuable tool.  People are desperate for more answers and more affirmation of their faith and your dollars help make it available to as many people as possible. 

This campaign not only helps the “Bible Idiots” documentary become a household name, it also helps countless numbers of people get access to this life changing message.  

Other Ways to Help:  

While we realize not everyone has resources that they could put toward this project, there are other ways you can help.

 Watch the movie!  Go to www.bibleidiots.com and download it or order the DVD. 

Tell your friends, family, and church about “Bible Idiots”.  There is no more persuasive advertisement than YOU.  

SHARE SHARE SHARE!  Use the Indiegogo share tools.  In fact, if you’ve seen the movie, and you want to be a “Bible Idiot”, just take a selfie declaring your status and post it.  We invite you to post it on Bible Idiots Facebook page or any of your other social media. 

Use your most POWERFUL TOOL - prayer.  Pray for this project and the people it might be used to impact.

story:
Disabilities come in all forms, appear at different times and effect people differently.  Disabilities also affect families; they have effects on Moms, Dads, brothers and sisters, friends and everyone who is lucky enough to meet them. But what is unfair is the pain they suffer from the unknown.  This is especially common with autism; we do not know what gives people with autism relief because the spectrum is so wide.  We want to help them but there are no clear answers sometimes.  So when we see something that works, we cannot help but do everything we can to get into every single autistic family household possible.

You may be wondering… What is this person talking about? There is no cure for autism.  You are right.  But there is a solution for the communication needs, we discovered it last year and now we want to expand our reach with whom we can help.

Our Story

For the last two years our team of co-workers decided to pool money to buy iPads for kids with disabilities. We purchased around 20 iPads and we were amazed at the success these kids experienced; they now have a voice. They can answer a question or ask one. They can comment on a story. They can tell if they are hungry or tired or sad and it helps with their motor skills.

We were beyond excited to see these results that we never imagined possible.  We knew the Ipads would be helpful but we never knew just how much freedom we were giving Autistic families and the change we were seeing unfold before our very eyes.

This motivated us to create a non-profit to help more children to have the same experience, we take more care on the low income families, creating a non-profit would be easies way to ask for donations and rich a wider population of children with ASD.

The CFO for Autism Needs You, Juan Marin has first-hand experience with autism spectrum disorders. The inspiration for our organization came to John after he spent years watching his sister’s autistic son struggle every day with the condition. His nephew faced insurmountable behavioral issues, major sensory issues, an inability to cope with the environment. Setting out to help in any way possible, John took it upon himself to read everything he could about helping autistic children. Through education, patience, and military precision, John’s sister and family are now leading a happier life, despite the challenges that autism presents them with. After this experience, John decided to reach out to other families with the same situation, first by spreading awareness and then by donating iPads with apps and designs that help autistic children improve their motor skills.

Who:

The people at “Autism Needs You” brings this campaign to you but we hope with continued growth we can branch off into our own Non-Profit.

COMING SOON TO THE TEAM: YOU!

When:

As soon as we begin to raise funding we will speak with Apple about getting a purchase order started.

How:

Our sights are big and we know it will take a team effort but we are confident in the people reading this campaign.

We truly appreciate each and every donation, no matter what it may be. As a thank you we are offering various perks including:

  • Having your name featured on our website 
  • Getting a personal thank you video from our team
  • Having your name listed as a team member
  • Exclusive updates on events and gatherings
  • Gear to support the cause
  • We can even make a public donation announcement at our next event
  • And much more!

Why:

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) released new data on the prevalence of autism in the United States. This surveillance study identified 1 in 68 children (1 in 42 boys and 1 in 189 girls) as having autism spectrum disorder (ASD).

This number is surpassing 2% of boys in the US.  This number is huge.  Too many families are struggling.  A symptom of autism is verbal and nonverbal communication problems. And the iPad has tons of applications to help make communication much easier.

“The iPad revolutionized and unlocked the communication barrier for children on the spectrum. The iPad gives a voice to the voiceless. The iPad apps for autism are easy-to-use, and allow for children to put words and symbols together and eventually create sentences using images.”

We cannot raise this money without you; we need your support!

Your generous funding will allow us to buy the much-needed iPads. And a portion of the funds will be donated to people in need of Ipads urgently, for a family in desperate need we can expedite their iPad. Assisting in education and lending a voice are our main priority. It will assist us with the cost of further development of our organization. More importantly you get the chance to join us at “iPads4Autism”. 

 The “iPads4Autism” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

Other Ways to Help

For me to bring my vision to life, I need your support!

If you aren't able to make a monetary donation, but would like to contribute to the campaign mission, there are plenty of other ways to help!

Volunteer 

We will be looking for people to help at our events but you can also volunteer at any event that compels you to fight for the cause and break barriers.

Teach someone else about the cause and need for change

At its core, this campaign is about helping people. If you're in a position to teach someone else how to better view the issue at hand - do it! You are contributing to this campaign by passing on the awareness.

Spread the word

You can contribute your popularity by telling your friends and family about this campaign. The success of this campaign is directly correlated with the number of people who view this page. If you can increase that number, you are making a tangible contribution to the mission.

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “iPads 4 Autism” family.

Old school?  No Problem!

For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact me via Indiegogo.com and I will provide you with a mailing address to send check or money order to.  I will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and I will deliver whatever perk you would like. 

Our Social Media Connections:

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/autismneedsyou.org/
  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/autismneedsyou/
  • Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcv_CnAGTQ8f7M5o4BMdi2A

His nephew faced insurmountable behavioral issues, major sensory issues, an inability to cope with the environment. Setting out to help in any way possible, John took it upon himself to read everything he could about helping autistic children. Through education, patience, and military precision, John’s sister and family are now leading a happier life, despite the challenges that autism presents them with. After this experience, John decided to reach out to other families with the same situation, first by spreading awareness and then by donating iPads with apps and designs that help autistic children improve their motor skills.



Who:
The people at “Autism Needs You” brings this campaign to you but we hope with continued growth we can branch off into our own Non-Profit.


COMING SOON TO THE TEAM: YOU!


When:
As soon as we begin to raise funding we will speak with Apple about getting a purchase order started.


How:
Our sights are big and we know it will take a team effort but we are confident in the people reading this campaign.


We truly appreciate each and every donation, no matter what it may be. As a thank you we are offering various perks including:

Having your name featured on our website 
Getting a personal thank you video from our team
Having your name listed as a team member
Exclusive updates on events and gatherings
Gear to support the cause
We can even make a public donation announcement at our next event
And much more!

Why:


The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) released new data on the prevalence of autism in the United States. This surveillance study identified 1 in 68 children (1 in 42 boys and 1 in 189 girls) as having autism spectrum disorder (ASD).


This number is surpassing 2% of boys in the US.  This number is huge.  Too many families are struggling.  A symptom of autism is verbal and nonverbal communication problems. And the iPad has tons of applications to help make communication much easier.


“The iPad revolutionized and unlocked the communication barrier for children on the spectrum. The iPad gives a voice to the voiceless. The iPad apps for autism are easy-to-use, and allow for children to put words and symbols together and eventually create sentences using images.”


We cannot raise this money without you; we need your support!
Your generous funding will allow us to buy the much-needed iPads. And a portion of the funds will be donated to people in need of Ipads urgently, for a family in desperate need we can expedite their iPad. Assisting in education and lending a voice are our main priority. It will assist us with the cost of further development of our organization. More importantly you get the chance to join us at “iPads4Autism”. 


 The “iPads4Autism” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!
Other Ways to Help
For me to bring my vision to life, I need your support!
If you aren't able to make a monetary donation, but would like to contribute to the campaign mission, there are plenty of other ways to help!
Volunteer 
We will be looking for people to help at our events but you can also volunteer at any event that compels you to fight for the cause and break barriers.
Teach someone else about the cause and need for change
At its core, this campaign is about helping people. If you're in a position to teach someone else how to better view the issue at hand - do it! You are contributing to this campaign by passing on the awareness.
Spread the word
You can contribute your popularity by telling your friends and family about this campaign. The success of this campaign is directly correlated with the number of people who view this page. If you can increase that number, you are making a tangible contribution to the mission.


We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “iPads 4 Autism” family.


Old school?  No Problem!


For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact me via Indiegogo.com and I will provide you with a mailing address to send check or money order to.  I will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and I will deliver whatever perk you would like. 



Our Social Media Connections:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/autismneedsyou.org/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/autismneedsyou/
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcv_CnAGTQ8f7M5o4BMdi2A

story:
Short Summary

Thanks for taking the time to view our campaign.. We are new flip flop company based on the island of IBIZA in the Mediterranean Sea. 

To be clear from the outset.. WE have funded everything to date involved in the birth & development of IBIZA SOUL entirely on our own (so far 130,000 euros) WE need your help to keep the wheels turning, to fund design, production, sales and to develop our artist registry program (more on this below). WE aren’t using your hard earned cash to fund dodgy trips around the world or to party in Ibiza!  – WE are going straight for what makes us tingle - designing and producing beautiful flip flops, helping local artists and making their art wearable..

Ibiza Soul was born out of necessity in early June 2014 - our founder was walking in a pair of 3 week old Havaianas when the front plug pulled through the sole plate. Persevering with them for another week he began to think there must be a better way. IBIZA SOUL was born. He wanted to make a flip flop that had better build quality and durability and in addition to create a brand that induced an emotional connection between our products and the magical island of IBIZA.


By mid-June he was in China, in a city called Quanzhou, an hour north of Xiamen. He Googled flip flop manufacturers, emailed them all, picked the best 5 (based on how professional their websites looked and how well they responded to English emails) and instructed them to prepare samples.

         

Once out in China he met them and saw their outfits but ultimately the choice of supplier for Ibiza Soul's first production run came down to the quality of their samples. Staying in China on this visit for nearly 3 weeks, he had them remake the samples several times until he was happy to pull the trigger on a run our very first production run of 11,000 pairs.

                

     

BLOWOUTS

One of the problems we wanted to address in flip flops available at the time was the front plug 'blowout'. 

We came up with a very simple yet effective solution.. All of our flip flops feature our front plug stabiliser that spreads the surface area of the plug and helps prevent the common blowout. 

            

We have had customers come back wearing the flip flops they bought the previous year with no blowouts.. We are onto something!

The Team

Below is the current range, all of which contain images of Ibiza & our neighbour Formentera. They are great quality and extremely comfortable making them a desirable option for tourists, locals and international customers all over the globe.

        

    BARRACUDAS       JETTY BLUE        SUNSET ORANGE     MIGHTY WAKES

        

    CALA BASSA Y       JETTY GREEN         CALA BASSA W       SUNSET PINK

In total this year we are in 38 outlets on Ibiza and so far 4 off the island in Mallorca, Holland, the UK and Australia. 

Oscars

      

    


If you don’t ask you don’t get! On a tip from a friend I emailed a contact at the company in LA that is responsible for the Swag bags at the Oscars. 

Long story short - they came back saying they would love to include our flip flops in the 2015 Swag bags. I was sent a list of all the nominees foot sizes and made individual packs and shipped them off from Ibiza to LA. We received a great deal of press for the brand in LA, locally in Spain and in the UK.

http://www.ibizasoul.es/oscars-2015-blog/


                

        

In order to grow and explore the Brand potential we need your help.

Firstly, we have a collaborated over the winter with an amazing artist on the island named Chapter - he is a well known dj and artist and has come up with 4 incredible designs for our flip flops which you can see below.. 

www.chapter-art.com

           

             

                                                                 

                        SKULLS                                                  EYEBALLS

              

                      CARNIVAL                                              BUTTERFLY                          


Secondly, as a result of our collaboration with Chapter we have come up with a plan to create an interactive website whereby artists like Chapter can register and submit their work for review. We would then (if their design is selected for a production run) pay them a set fee and in addition a % of all sales of flip flops that feature their design.

1. SUBMISSION

Artists of all types can register to become a IBIZA SOUL artist. After completing your profile, you can submit an unlimited number of artwork.

2. REVIEW

We review your submission, taking into account quality, originality, story, and trends. Designs that pass our initial review are sampled and tested to determine which styles make it.

3. PRODUCTION

Your design made the cut? Our product designers will finalise materials, silhouettes, and packaging for your design, which we manufacture into a shoe to be sold all over the world.

4. LAUNCH

We promote your flip flop on IBIZASOUL.ES, across all of our social media channels, and to retailers around the world. You earn royalties on every sale and there is no limit to the amount you can earn.

In the near future we are looking to move into other related items for Ibiza beach life.. like towels, bags, hats, t shirts and sunglasses.. all of which we will eligible for our registered artists to contribute to and design... 



                                 


In brief that is why we need you! We really want to involve this amazing island and its people in the brand and make it possible for people living here to contribute and help us to grow while giving back to our community - that way we can all grow together and IBIZA SOUL can really be the SOUL of Ibiza.




What We Need & What You Get

The target number I have specified of 35,000 euros will be spent predominantly on manufacturing, marketing and building the designer registry into our website. We also need to take on some staff to help with admin and sourcing distribution agents in our target markets all over the globe. 

     


PERKS PERKS PERKS!!! We have some exciting ideas for rewarding you for your help. You can have our Chapter range before anyone else, BIG discounts on current ranges, custom design your own amazing pair of Ibiza Souls, wholesale packages and for the very generous and special investor we have something in mind that will really give you an idea of how amazing our island is.. read on to find out more..


If we don't reach our ultimate goal we will simply reduce the order for this season and manufacture as many pairs as we can with the funds available.

This works on the flip side also - should we exceed our targets we have a long list of designs that would love to see the light of day - or the soles of your feet.. The more funding this campaign generates the more freedom we have to express ourselves and the incredible artistic talent that resides here on our island..

                                                        Walk the dream!


The Impact

The impact of this campaign will be huge! So far we have funded the birth of IBIZA SOUL and first years manufacturing, transport, logistics, storage, sales etc etc etc & unfortunately we can't afford to continue in this manner. Going forward we are in talks with some amazing off island distribution agents in Holland, Belgium, the UK and Serbia which again will increase order volumes and hence manufacturing and all associated costs.. We are at a turning point in the business and your help will steer us down the road to expansion and eventual globalisation.


Risks & Challenges

There is really no risk with this reward, the only "risk" would be the delivery dates although they should be close to correct. 

The only true risk you are taking is whether or not you like the product. 

If you're reading this message that means you made it to the bottom of the campaign page and I want to say thank you for taking the time to see what I have been working on..


Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial contribution is not for you please take the time to help spread the word about IBIZA SOUL. We really appreciate your time and hope to see you walking the dream in a pair of our flip flops one day soon!!

story:
"The seond campaign is here! The new content, better rewards, and giveaways will blow you away! Support the next generation of horror filmmakers. As always you rock and thanks for supporting our film!" - Nathaniel Barber

2nd Campaign link: https://www.gofundme.com/2hvud3w

STORY: A terminally ill man spends his last days coping with death and struggles to undo his past sins. While headed to a remote location he stumbles upon a woman. The two become stranded hundreds of miles from civilization. Secrets and lies quickly force them to be suspicious of each other's intentions. They soon discover that they are not alone. Something dark lives in the woods. Something not human and when it arrives there will be no survivors in its wake.

The movie will be a throwback to classic horror films like The Evil Dead (1981) and the Universal Monster movies of the 1930s-50s. It contains elements of a Hitchcock thriller and at the same time delves into the mystery of a Michael Crichton novel. At the core of the film, it explores the darkest corners of fear and horror as it follows a manʼs journey through the last moments of his life. What would you do if your time was up? 

A message from the Screenwriter:

"Writing is a process of self-discovery. Over a year ago I came up with a small concept that would become my film, The Last. At that time, however, it was envisioned as an artistic short film. That would soon change due to some advice from Bruce Campbell’s book If Chins Could Kill: Confessions of a B Movie Actor.  The book planted a seed that led the short to evolve into a feature film.  After that moment the story also began to evolve into something completely different. As each day passed, I had no clue what was going to transpire in the script. This is not how I usually write scripts. Most of the time I come up with the climax and work my way backwards. This story revolves around a terminally ill man and his final days on Earth. Then he encounters a monster. Lies, mysteries, and the mortality that we will all face are explored in the darkness of the woods from which there seems to be no escape. We could really use your help to make this picture. If you are able to participate with us in making The Last, I know you will be very proud of the final product."  

- Nathaniel Barber


Matthew Barber (Director)

Matthew Barber is a writer and director, known for Windigo Origins (2014), Windigo Revolution (2015) and The Lawmen (2011). His film Windigo Origins (2014) was an Official Selection at the 2014 South Dakota Film Festival and an Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival. Windigo Revolution (2015) was also an Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival. Matthew received an Associate degree in Screenwriting and Directing at the Colorado Film School and is currently wrapping up his Bachelorʼs degree in film at the University of North Texas. 

Matthew has been making movies with his brother since he was in grade school.  His moviemaking evolved from stop motion short films; two Bigfoot comedies in junior high inspired by Abbott & Costello to a feature length Western filmed while in high school.  Directors that have inspired his filmmaking include Sam Raimi, Stephen Sommers, John Carpenter, James Cameron, Merian C. Cooper, Robert Rodriguez, Tim Burton, John McTiernan, J. J. Abrams and Steven Spielberg. 

Nathaniel Barber (Writer/Producer)

Nathaniel Barber is a writer/producer, known for Windigo Origins (2014), Windigo Revolution (2015) and The Lawmen (2011). His film Windigo Origins (2014) was an Official Selection at the 2014 South Dakota Film Festival and an Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival. Windigo Revolution (2015) was also an Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival. Likewise, Nathaniel received an Associate degree in Screenwriting and Directing at the Colorado Film School and will soon receive his Bachelorʼs degree in film at the University of North Texas. 

Nathaniel has a lifelong passion for movies that began when he first saw Jurassic Park (1993) as a child and soon began making movies thereafter. He has a love for all movie genres that run the gamut from westerns to horror and that encompasses all eras from Bela Lugosi’s classic Dracula (1931); The Wolf Man (1941); The Thing (1982); to I Am Legend (2007).   

CAST

Kayla Holland (Actress)

Kayla Holland is a dancer who is best known for her performances with TCC-SE's Dance Works and being a member of Rhapsody Movement Company. With the company she has performed at Six Flags Over Texas' Holiday in the Park. She is also an actress known for her role as Sarah Sutherland in The Lawmen (2011).

MUSICIAN

Juan Carlos Enriquez (Film Composer)

Juan Carlos Enriquez is an award-winning composer from Guadalajara, Mexico and a distinguished graduate from the world-renowned Berklee College of Music in Boston, MA. His work, contributions and collaborations with some of Hollywood's top composers such as Brian Tyler, Pedro Bromfman, Juan Carlos Rodriguez, H. Scott Salinas and Reinhold Heil, can be heard in numerous film and TV projects including Furious 7 (Universal Pictures, produced by Neal H. Moritz and Vin Diesel), Narcos (Netflix, produced by Eric Newman and Chris Brancato), Robocop (Sony Pictures, directed by Jose Padilha), Matador (produced by Robert Rodriguez and Roberto Orci), Deep Web (EPIX, produced by Seth Gordon and Glen Zipper), and Helix (Sony Pictures Television, produced by Lynda Obst), to name some. 


By funding this film you can get all sorts of AWESOME perks including your name at the END CREDITS and even a position as the ASSOCIATE PRODUCER for the film! Other perks include exclusive content, magnets, hats, and even props used in the film! Please help us reach our budgetary goal of $16,000. Any amount received above and beyond our goal will be put directly into the film in order to ensure the best film possible! 

Your contributions can make the biggest difference and be a stepping stone to lead us on a pathway to success.

Budget Breakdown

All of the money raised goes directly towards the production of this film. It will be distributed in the most efficient way to produce the best product possible. The filmmakers will not receive a dime, therefore no money goes to waste. The budget covers equipment fees, food, lodging, transportation and compensation for the cast, crew and music production.

Here is a percentage breakdown of the budget: 

Equipment:                 57%

Cast/Crew/Music:  30%

Food/Lodging:          10%

Transportation:          3% 

Challenges

A huge challenge that all films face is funding. Without funding, the movie cannot be made. We are set to begin filming in January of 2017. Due to our small budget, our shooting schedule will be 30 days which is a very tight schedule and is being meticulously planned. Additionally, the entire shoot will be outdoors so we will be fighting against the elements. Like anything worth fighting for it won't be easy.

Production

Production begins in January of 2017 in Tishomingo, Oklahoma.

Other Films Made by the Directors

Windigo Revolution (2015) - Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival. SYNOPSIS: In the midst of the American Revolution an eccentric man unknowingly provokes a Sasquatch while on a direct mission to deliver an important military document.


Windigo Origins (2014) - Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival and the 2014 South Dakota Film Festival! SYNOPSIS: A pair of weary bounty hunters awaken a bloodthirsty Sasquatch. 


We need YOUR help to make this film. Please FOLLOW, RETWEET, and SHARE The Last.

Nathaniel Barber (Writer/Producer)


Nathaniel Barber is a writer/producer, known for Windigo Origins (2014), Windigo Revolution (2015) and The Lawmen (2011). His film Windigo Origins (2014) was an Official Selection at
the 2014 South Dakota Film Festival and an Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts
Festival. Windigo Revolution (2015) was also an Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts
Festival. Likewise, Nathaniel received an Associate degree in Screenwriting and Directing at the
Colorado Film School and will soon receive his Bachelorʼs degree in film at the University of
North Texas. 

Nathaniel has a lifelong passion for movies that began when he first saw Jurassic Park (1993) as a child and soon began making movies thereafter. He has a love for all movie genres that run the gamut from westerns to horror and that encompasses all eras from Bela Lugosi’s classic Dracula (1931); The Wolf Man (1941); The Thing (1982); to I Am Legend (2007).   
CAST
Kayla Holland (Actress)


Kayla Holland is a dancer who is best known for her performances with TCC-SE's Dance Works and being a member of Rhapsody Movement Company. With the company she has performed at Six Flags Over Texas' Holiday in the Park. She is also an actress known for her role as Sarah Sutherland in The Lawmen (2011).









MUSICIAN

Juan Carlos Enriquez (Film Composer)


Juan Carlos Enriquez is an award-winning composer from Guadalajara, Mexico and a
distinguished graduate from the world-renowned Berklee College of Music in Boston, MA. His
work, contributions and collaborations with some of Hollywood's top composers such as Brian
Tyler, Pedro Bromfman, Juan Carlos Rodriguez, H. Scott Salinas and Reinhold Heil, can be
heard in numerous film and TV projects including Furious 7 (Universal Pictures, produced by
Neal H. Moritz and Vin Diesel), Narcos (Netflix, produced by Eric Newman and Chris Brancato),
Robocop (Sony Pictures, directed by Jose Padilha), Matador (produced by Robert Rodriguez
and Roberto Orci), Deep Web (EPIX, produced by Seth Gordon and Glen Zipper), and Helix (Sony Pictures Television, produced by Lynda Obst), to name some. 















By funding this film you can get all sorts of AWESOME perks including your name at the END CREDITS and even a position as the ASSOCIATE PRODUCER for the film! Other perks include exclusive content,
magnets, hats, and even props used in the film! Please help us reach our budgetary goal of $16,000. Any
amount received above and beyond our goal will be put directly into the film in order to ensure
the best film possible! 


Your contributions can make the biggest difference and be a stepping stone to lead us on a pathway to success.











Budget Breakdown
All of the money raised goes directly towards the production of this film. It will be
distributed in the most efficient way to produce the best product possible. The
filmmakers will not receive a dime, therefore no money goes to waste. The budget
covers equipment fees, food, lodging, transportation and compensation for the cast,
crew and music production.



Here is a percentage breakdown of the budget: 





Equipment:                 57%

Cast/Crew/Music:  30%

Food/Lodging:          10%

Transportation:          3% 





Challenges

A huge challenge that all films face is funding. Without funding, the movie cannot be made. We are set to begin filming in January of 2017. Due to our small budget, our shooting schedule will be 30 days which is a very tight schedule and is being meticulously planned. Additionally, the entire shoot will be outdoors so we will be fighting against the elements. Like anything worth fighting for it won't be easy.

Production
Production begins in January of 2017 in Tishomingo, Oklahoma.
Other Films Made by the Directors
Windigo Revolution (2015) - Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival. SYNOPSIS: In the midst of the American Revolution an eccentric man unknowingly provokes a Sasquatch while on a direct mission to deliver an important military document.



Windigo Origins (2014) - Official Selection at the 2016 UNT Media Arts Festival and the 2014
South Dakota Film Festival! SYNOPSIS: A pair of weary bounty hunters awaken a bloodthirsty Sasquatch. 










We need YOUR help to make this film. Please FOLLOW, RETWEET, and SHARE The Last.

story:
Short Summary

Deserted: let the sin begin (Season 1)

What is sin? Is sin man's true nature? A drama thriller that follows the lives of a business owner and his stay at home wife as their lives become twisted and torn by several individuals who represent the seven deadly sin: Pride, Envy, Greed, Sloth, Wrath, Gluttony, and Lust 

 

Deserted: Collision (Season 2)

What happens when the sin's Collide?  The story continues, A drama thriller that shows the connection between the seven sin's Pride, Greed, Sloth, Envy, Gluttony, Wrath, and Lust.

The Impact

The purpose behind Deserted is to bring awareness to the seven sins. The show is not a biblically based show, but  is to demonstrate the seven deadly sins that we encounter in our day to day lives. While researching for the script, Director Quentin Washington, had a conversation with an individual who expressed a situation that happened to him. Quentin was taken away and shared a few lines from the script with the individual, about the same incident that happened to the Character in the script.  So if this individual  was able to identify and relate to the story. The viewers at home can also relate.

Helping Hand 

Season one was a labor of love that was funded entirely by QJW Productions.  I want to make season two even better and to do that, I need your help.  A donation from you, no matter how large or small, would help continue to produce this show. Here is a breakdown of how the money will be spent:

After the successful completion of season 1, moving forward to season 2 we need help continuing this process. Season 2 we are doing things bigger and better. We need help with better equipment to ensure the best visual quality of the project. Wardrobe and props and location. This season we have the opportunity to film in a local studio in the central Florida area.  Also want to give back to the cast and crew for their hard work. We need to feed the cast and crew daily. Also need help with marketing and promotion of the film.

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are ways you can help out the project: 

Follow us on social media: Everyone has a Facebook page, Instagram, and  YouTube channel. Go like our social media to get daily news on the creating process of the Web Series.( GO LIKE THE PAGE !!)

Facebook (Deserted the web series) , Instagram (qjwproduction), Youtube (Deserted the web series) 

Spread the word on your social media network. Give us a Shout out, Tell your friends, your family, your co-workers, even strangers about our campaign and the project itself. Its all about Networking and spreading the word

Watch season 1 and support everyone the cast and crew 

 

Who are the Seven deadly sins? 

Milton aka Sloth
Sloth is habitual disinclination to exertion ( without care)
Milton is the intern at Tower of Seven, he has a lazy persona that gives off , as if he does not care about his performance at work, his physical appearance, or any professional situation.
 
Lance aka Gluttony
Gluttony is habitual greed or excess in eating.
Lance is the best friend of Houston.  Some classify Lance as a leach that consumes everything he touches. Lance has a interesting past that connects him to another sin.
 
Jae and Jaz aka Lust 
Lust is a very strong sexual desire.
Jae and Jaz are best friends and friends  of Celine. They are very dominate individuals   who seeks out what they want and get it . They love the thrill of the chase when it comes something that entices their sexual desire. Until Jaz comes a cross a new form of Lust  that shows her a lifestyle she once knew is mediocre to a "King" .
 
Ruth Lovington aka Wrath
Wrath is extreme anger.
Ruth is the mother of Houston and Rebecca. she has a dark past with her anger that consumes her and her family. she is quick temper and not afraid to speak her mind, but as the old saying goes the apple doesn't fall to far from the tree. One of her children follows down the same  path as their mother. 
 
Bishop DeAnna Hall aka Pride
 
Pride is a feeling or deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements.
Pastor DeAnna Hall is the realist member of cloth anyone has ever met.  She gets satisfaction out of doing things that beneficial to herself. DeAnna Hall has marked her territory in proclaiming that "The queen wants her throne back".  She is  one of the very few sins who are connected to each individual within the web series,  which comes to the conclusion that Pride changes Angles into Demons.
 
Shanise aka Envy

Envy is desire to have a quality, possession, or other desirable attribute belonging to (someone else).

Shanise is the main Antagonist of Deserted Season 1. Shanise is introduced as the new business partner for Houston but she seeks out something more. Her jealously grows throughout season 1 for what Celine has. Which brings them to a showdown between the two Alpha Female's, to see who is worthy to be with Houston. 

Gregory (Greg) aka Greed 

Intense and selfish desire for something, especially wealth and power.

Greg is the Main Antagonist for Season 2. Greg is the devious, cunning, manipulating individual, that will stop at nothing to get what he desires. Greg has interesting past that connects him to another sin. During his solitary confinement he gets a unexpected visit that changed his perception on everyone that crosses his path. 

 

 

A brief introduction about our team. In 2013, Quentin James Washington founded QJW Productions with the start of his first project, Reflection. Reflection was a short film shedding light on the reality of split personalities. In 2014, QJW Productions began launching season 1 of Deserted: The Webseries. QJW Productions received assistance with the webseries from his biggest support, his sister Nicole, Assistant Director Dee, Director of Photography Corliss, and co-writer Luis, among other various supporters.In 2016, with the help of a local studio, Studio One, QJW Productions began filming the second season of Deserted: The Webseries. With your help, QJW Productions will be able to successfully finish season 2 and get a jump start on season 3 of Deserted: The Webseries.

story:
Across the country families are falling victim to Child Protection Services. CPS has became a privatized industry which has caused these children to be viewed as ways to make a profit. People do not know where to turn. Attorneys normally are not much help with these cases and mainstream media avoids this subject like the plague. That is how CPS has been able to operate for this long, despite the major problems we see in this system. They have hidden in the shadows. This documentary is intended to go to some of America's most problematic states and shine a light into the shadows. This will only continue as long as we allow it!


We have decided to go to some of the states that have the highest problems with their CPS agencies. So far our list includes Texas, Kansas, Michigan, Florida, Oklahoma, California and Missouri. We are more than willing to go to any other states that we need to go to if we have the funds to do so. We have a few other states we would like to add to the list, such as Hawaii, Tennessee, Georgia, and others.

We have set a goal of $7,500 to get us where we need to go. We have all the gear we need and are ready to hit the road. However, this is a Daily Haze production. We are a new and growing independent media and simply do not have the cash to drive around the country for the months it will take to film this documentary. We are getting requests from people around the country, but we need your help to get to these families. All donations will be going towards the cost of traveling from state to state. The more money we raise, the more places we will be able to go to and the more families we will be able to get in contact with. We cannot do this without your help!
The more we put a spotlight on these CPS agencies and their wrong doings, the better chance we have for reform in the system. The longer we allow them to operate in the shadows, the worse things are going to get. These families need a voice, and we are willing to be that voice.

Obviously driving across the country doing these interviews has many problems we may face. To save on costs we have already been finding places to stay other than hotels. Families have already been willing to open their doors to us, which we are extremely grateful for.

If you are not able to help financially, worry not. There is still other ways to help. By simply sharing this campaign with your friends you will be helping. Perhaps you live in one of the areas we will be traveling to and can offer us a place to sleep for a night. Do not feel bad if you cannot afford to help. You can just help us in a different way.

story:
Hello there! 

My name is Nicole Palucci and I am the writer and director of T.I.M. I am a Senior at the Savannah College of Art and Design and this is my Senior Thesis film. 

T.I.M. is a Science Fiction, Mockumentary that takes place in a dystopian future. The film centers around a scientist named Dr. Clark; his girlfriend, Stacy; and their android, T.I.M. The film is about a struggle to survive and to improve and preserve humanity in a post apocalyptic world. Dr. Clark is convinced that T.I.M. is the key to saving humanity; however, once Dr. Clark brings T.I.M. to life, hilarity ensues as T.I.M. is not what Dr. Clark originally envisioned.  

I have been wanting to make a mockumentary for years and now there is finally a chance to do so. We have an awesome team who is extremely passionate about this film. With your help we can make it a reality. 


We are asking for $4,000. Because this is a post apocalyptic, Science Fiction film, we need to make this film look as believable as possible.The funding that we receive will go towards costumes, prosthetic makeup for T.I.M., handmade props, set dressing, special effects, renting out a location, feeding the crew and much more. Each donation will come with a special reward as a thank you for all your support!

The more funding we raise, the further we can take this film. We have big dreams for film, which include taking it to noteworthy film festivals. With your help, we can take this film very far. 




We are a passionate group of filmmakers and realize obstacles will arise. At the moment, we are doing everything we can to stay one step ahead so we can avoid any problems that come our way. 

One of our biggest concerns is keeping on schedule and meeting our deadlines for the film's release. Due to filming with three cameras, plus special effects, we might have some setbacks; however, we will keep all supporters updated on our progress and send out the majority of the rewards on schedule. 

With any project, there are always unforeseen obstacles. To avoid any major issues, we have devised several plans and strict schedules in order to make this process as smooth as possible. 


We understand that everyone cannot contribute but don’t worry. There are other ways you can help us reach our goal. 

It’s simple. Just get the word out about our campaign by sharing it on social media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out too. The more noise we make about the campaign, the better! 


We are so excited to make this film a reality and share it with all of you. Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Short Summary

Do you remember the fearsome 'Richard Parker' - the Royal Bengal tiger in the famous movie 'Life of Pi' (own 76 film awards)? Richard Parker lived on the lifeboat with the boy named Pi, after surviving a disaster. 

  • The Tiger was kept alive in the boat with the food and water that Pi delivered; 
  • thus developed a relationship allowing them to coexist in their struggle to survive for 227 days, while adrift on the Pacific Ocean.
  • Our this story is about those real Royal Bengal tigers in their native habitat. 

The Sunderban jungle have long been characterized by the Royal Bengal tigers that inhabit the land. Although these big cats are known predators, dangerous to be around, their majesty lends a certain serene character to the area. To be there is to be in the den of a creature that for thousands of years thrived at the apex of the food chain.

If you can get past the constant necessary foreboding, there a sense of calm that comes from walking the land and mangrove covered riversides that these animals call home. Strong, proud, impressive: the descriptor Royal is indeed well-suited, the presence of these tigers seeping into every blade of grass and even the skies above the Sunderban. 

It is truly a land of the tigers. Now, however, these animals that once thrived are struggling even to get by. In 2004, there were an estimated 256 Royal Bengal tigers in the Sunderban. By 2013, that number had dropped by more than 50%, to 103. It would seem logical to point the finger directly at ourselves and our poachers, among other environmental impacts, but the reality of the situation is not so clear-cut.

While poachers have played a major role, it is now the lack of genetic diversity among Royal Bengal tigers that is contributing to their heavy losses. With so few genetic mutations available, the tigers’ hunting skills have suffered. In a way, this is an even more disappointing conclusion, because while we can arrest and jail the poachers, a lack of genetic diversity is a much more complicated problem to solve.

We're dedicated to raise awareness on these Tigers and help research projects with shooting an authentic documentary film. We will be using a drone camera in the Sunderban in order to capture never-before-seen perspectives of this stunning landscape along with its chief residents, the man-eating Royal Bengal tigers.

In light of this situation, our team has taken on the task of visiting and photographing the Royal Bengal tigers that call the Sunderban (meaning the “beautiful jungle”) home. Because the Sunderban, situated between India and Bangladesh along the Indian Ocean, is a UNESCO heritage site, getting permission has presented its own set of challenges. We have already gotten past this stage, however, and we are all set to begin filming in January 2016, weather permitting.


For the first ever, we will be using a very sophisticated advanced drone camera in the Sunderban in order to capture never-before-seen perspectives of this stunning landscape along with its chief residents, the man-eating Royal Bengal tigers. The drone camera is not limited in the way that a grounded camera is, and with the latest technology, the provide ultra-high-quality footage. Below is an example demo video shot by the drone camera.



Throughout the trip, day and night, we will remain on a boat deep inside the jungle, remaining in the middle of nature so that we can film all of the most powerful aspects of this visit - from early morning till late evening or dawn to dusk. It would be like Man-eater on the land and dangerous Crocodiles in the water; and our team will be living and breathing for many days and nights in that dangerous life-threatening environment.

Right now, we are turning to you, for help raising the amount. This operating capital will cover many of the costs associated with our project, making it much more feasible to do what we are doing.  

We need to preserve a record of this Royal Bengal Tiger and associated Flora and Fauna in as much detail as we can right now, both for current research projects, history and for the continued expansion of protection efforts in the future. 

With your contributions, we are going to make an authentic documentary that everyone can enjoy and appreciate. Thank you.


Our Team is comprised of accomplished many World Record Holders:








PROJECT BUDGET & EXPENSES:

We are committed members and ready to take loans if we need extra funding.

Target $1000 : Will be a home production, with top up via personal loans

Target $5000: Can hire a boat to travel day & night in the jungle

Target $10,000: Can hire a nice studio to produce our documentary

Target $15,000 : Can hire professional Editor to finish Editing

Target $20,000 : Can hire a professional Script Writer to write script

Target $30,000: Can hire a professional Director to direct the project

Target: $40,000: Can hire a Sound Engineer to dub sound track (folly)

Target: $50,000: Can hire top crew with professional equipment

It would seem logical to point the finger directly at ourselves and our poachers, among other environmental impacts, but the reality of the situation is not so clear-cut.   
While poachers have played a major role, it is now the lack of genetic diversity among Royal Bengal tigers that is contributing to their heavy losses. With so few genetic mutations available, the tigers’ hunting skills have suffered. In a way, this is an even more disappointing conclusion, because while we can arrest and jail the poachers, a lack of genetic diversity is a much more complicated problem to solve.We're dedicated to raise awareness on these Tigers and help research projects with shooting an authentic documentary film. We will be using a drone camera in the Sunderban in order to capture never-before-seen perspectives of this stunning landscape along with its chief residents, the man-eating Royal Bengal tigers.In light of this situation, our team has taken on the task of visiting and photographing the Royal Bengal tigers that call the Sunderban (meaning the “beautiful jungle”) home. Because the Sunderban, situated between India and Bangladesh along the Indian Ocean, is a UNESCO heritage site, getting permission has presented its own set of challenges. We have already gotten past this stage, however, and we are all set to begin filming in January 2016, weather permitting.For the first ever, we will be using a very sophisticated advanced drone camera in the Sunderban in order to capture never-before-seen perspectives of this stunning landscape along with its chief residents, the man-eating Royal Bengal tigers. The drone camera is not limited in the way that a grounded camera is, and with the latest technology, the provide ultra-high-quality footage. Below is an example demo video shot by the drone camera.


Throughout the trip, day and night, we will remain on a boat deep inside the jungle, remaining in the middle of nature so that we can film all of the most powerful aspects of this visit - from early morning till late evening or dawn to dusk. It would be like Man-eater on the land and dangerous Crocodiles in the water; and our team will be living and breathing for many days and nights in that dangerous life-threatening environment.


Right now, we are turning to you, for help raising the amount. This operating capital will cover many of the costs associated with our project, making it much more feasible to do what we are doing.  
We need to preserve a record of this Royal Bengal Tiger and associated Flora and Fauna in as much detail as we can right now, both for current research projects, history and for the continued expansion of protection efforts in the future. 

With your contributions, we are going to make an authentic documentary that everyone can enjoy and appreciate. Thank you.

Our Team is comprised of accomplished many World Record Holders:




















PROJECT BUDGET & EXPENSES:
We are committed members and ready to take loans if we need extra funding.
Target $1000 : Will be a home production, with top up via personal loans
Target $5000: Can hire a boat to travel day & night in the jungle
Target $10,000: Can hire a nice studio to produce our documentary
Target $15,000 : Can hire professional Editor to finish Editing
Target $20,000 : Can hire a professional Script Writer to write script
Target $30,000: Can hire a professional Director to direct the project
Target: $40,000: Can hire a Sound Engineer to dub sound track (folly)
Target: $50,000: Can hire top crew with professional equipment

story:
Summary

We are a group of seniors from Grand Canyon University. REM is our final project through the film program here at GCU and we are really excited about the potential this film has. We want to go out with a memorable film that showcases what we have learned through GCU's film program, while also giving us a product that we can send to film festivals around the country. We have a fantastic script and crew and know that with your help we can make this project something special. Every dollar helps push us toward our goals and dreams. We can't wait to partner with you. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $2,000 for this film. This money will go to a variety of different production needs including locations, costumes, and on-set meals for the cast and crew. 
The Perks:
$10-link

$25-Digital Copy

$50-Signed Poster, Digital Score

$100-Physical Copy, Behind The scenes video

$250- Associate Producer

$500-Associate Producer, Dinner with the Director

$1000- Associate Producer, Vinyl of the score

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides donating, please help spread the word of our film and campaign. The more people that hear about our project, the better. Thank you!
