story:
A Current Past est un film sur les Balkans, les Balkans autrement. Et plutôt que de miser sur son sensationnel géo-politique ou sur ses musiques festives, fanfares ou balkans-beat, il est ici question d'une acceptation de la sensibilité de chacun et des ivresses émotionnelles qui en découlent. Repartir du traditionnel, s'enrichir de pratiques perdues, ou en mutations, dont il nous faudra comprendre et ressentir leurs bienfaits.


                                                     Un documentaire de 90min                                                       
                                                      A Current Past - Facebook

Quelque part, sur la route (MK)


     

Dina Koleva, Crieuse et Leader de l'ensemble Bistrichki Babi (BG)


     A Current Past est un long métrage documentaire. Un film qui se dessine sur différents modes d'expression dans le but d'extérioriser différents modes de pensée, différentes pratiques. Coller à l'immense variété musicale présente et aux personnes qui les perdurent pour être aussi représentatif que possible des univers proposés et de la vision du réalisateur. Un film qui est entré dans la dernière année de sa réalisation. Deux ans et demi de repérages, recherches et écritures. Et face à une multitude de choses à dire, le film se dirige vers plusieurs thèmes :


                         Le voyage et la rencontre contre les préjugés
                                 L'importance de l'identité culturelle
                      La sauvegarde et la réadaptation du patrimoine
        La musique traditionnelle comme véhicule de grandes valeurs


        La méthode de réalisation restera simple, humble et contemplative. Le discours sonore est construit par les intervenants et les captations sur place. L'auteur parle avec l'image et le montage. Une mise en perspective des décors, lieux, villes ou montagnes, installe les sociétés dans leurs présents, pose le contexte socio-culturel. Le geste musical, les respirations et temps morts explorent les différentes personnalités présentes. La mise en abîme via la présence du dispositif filmique, le tournage est dévoilé dans son honnêteté comme une simple réplique: "Nous y sommes allé pour vivre une expérience unique." Je quadrille la zone de recherche à trois de ces merveilleux pays :

  • La Bulgarie pour son large patrimoine traditionnel, ses ensembles folkloriques, ses chœurs de voix féminins, ses somptueuses montagnes. 
  • La Bosnie-Herzégovine pour sa sevdalinka typique (genre musical national), d'hier et d'aujourd'hui, son talent artistique pour une sevdah qui part du cœur et qui parle aux cœurs.
  • La République de Macédoine pour tout ce qu'elle offre, ces festivals, son style de vie, son patrimoine de musiques urbaines et pastorales, de ceux qui en recherchent les différentes réadaptations puis ceux qui participent à sa transmission.


Angele Dimovski jouant d'une flûte traditionnelle (MK)


     A Current Past, un actuel passé, est l'idée que rien ne se perd, que rien ne se créé, que tout se transforme. À travers les strates du temps, et dans le présent de ces sociétés balkaniques en pleine mutation, la musique subit une sélection naturelle, reflète les besoins d'un artiste ou d’une société avec diverses pratiques et divers genres qui endurent l’épreuve du temps. Le temps, cette dimension désincarnée, impalpable, immuable, complètement hors de contrôle.


                        Le temps d'une note ou d'un son de voix

                                                 Partir d'hier
                                       Témoigner aujourd'hui
                                              Deviner demain.


     Enfin, A Current Past installe un pont entre les cultures du sud-est de l'Europe et l'ouest, apaise les relations trans-frontalières et sensibilise puis questionne les directions possibles de nos sociétés à travers le prisme de pratiques musicales assez peu médiatisées.

       « La musique est moyen de communication et livre d’histoire, qu’elle véhicule de transmission et d’éducation. Ainsi, dans toute société, la musique joue un rôle essentiel. Elle fait partie intégrante des gestes et faits de la vie quotidienne. La plupart des actes humains sont impensable sans une dimension musicale. Des plus solennels aux plus anodins, des plus communautaires aux plus intimes. Ces musiques sont donc lourdes de sens.» Etienne BOURS, Le sens du son, Fayard, 2007

     Vous savez, il m’est arrivé pendant le processus d’écriture de ce film de me demander où j'allais, de douter sur sa viabilité, jusqu'au jour, à mi-parcours, où le script a prit son indépendance, jusqu'à ce qu'il se découvre une autonomie, un rythme et que je l'emplisse de ma personnalité.     

    

         L’épreuve de la camera est autre chose. 

    

        Damir Imamovic                 Vera Milosevska                     Dina Koleva    

       Marjan Jovanovski                     Miro & Arif                        Angele Dimovski   


Damir Imamovic est un musicien renommé de Bosnie-Herzégovine. Sa musique est basée sur une recherche passionnée de la musique traditionnelle de son pays. Après des études de philosophie, il se lance dans la création d’un style unique de Sevdah contemporaine qui n’hésite pas à remettre en question ce genre.

Vera Milosevska est une chanteuse de musique traditionnelle de Macédoine. D’abord tournée vers des études de danse, elle se retrouve soliste dans l’orchestre Pece Atanasovski puis à la tête du groupe Ljubojna, un élément incontournable de la musique Macédonienne avec plus de 15 ans d’existence.

Dina Koleva est une grande représentante d'un traditionnel bulgare, leader et crieuse (voix principale) de l’ensemble des Bistrichki Babi. Reconnue à l’international, elle sillonne l’Europe pour présenter le folklore original de Bulgarie qu’elle a connu et vécu de son village natal de Bistritsa.

Marjan Jovanovski est joueur de tambura dans le groupe Synthesis. Avec plus de 20 ans d’existence, le groupe a réussi à faire rejaillir la grande tradition musicale de Macédoine de manière contemporaine à l’international. Mais il joue aussi chaque soir de la semaine dans un restaurant de Skopje afin de redonner à la musique son rôle social.

Miro & Arif sont deux représentants de ce qu’on appelle la Sevdah traditionnelle de la Société de café. Après avoir eu plusieurs groupes et joué dans tous les cafés de Sarajevo, leur musique actuelle est un mélange unique teinté de mélancolie yougoslave d’hier répondant aux besoins d’aujourd’hui.

Angele Dimovski est un grand joueur de Kaval de la grande époque Yougoslave. Après avoir gagné les plus grands concours de musique à travers tout le pays, il se consacre à faire de grandes tournées pour perpétuer sa musique familiale. Maintenant retraité, son instrument ne le quitte toujours pas.


     

      Je suis Arnaud Lanouiller, aka Arno Momtché, un jeune français originaire d’un petit village normand de la Baie du Mont-Saint-Michel. Jusqu'ici, j'étais cadreur ou monteur vidéo. Souvent amené à travailler seul sur différents projets, l'étape de la réalisation m'est déterminante pour le désir de créer en équipe, de partager les points de vue pour en extraire ce qui semble être une bonne direction. Le cinéma documentaire, en tant que transmission subjective de savoir, m'est un choix essentiel, refléter le réel en art, en tirer un enseignement, puis le transmettre sous une forme qui aujourd'hui utilise le récit de voyage et d'expérience.

      Il y a deux ans et demi, l'ambition était de réaliser mon premier long métrage. Alors, je suis parti en vadrouille, seul, sinon avec ma voiture, parcourir les routes escarpées des Balkans pour découvrir de nouvelles musiques. Pourquoi les Balkans me direz-vous ? Car de ce que j'en connaissais, il y avait un trop large fossé entre Goran Bregovic de Serbie et le Mystère des Voix Bulgares, puis ses fanfares, ce balkans beat, ces sensations tziganes qui traversaient les frontières pour venir jusqu'à moi, jusqu'à nous. 
     

     Je ne comprenais pas et j'ai voulu savoir.


                                            «  Rien n’est plus chargé d’associations émotionnelles que la                             musique, rien n’est mieux qu’elle susceptible de recréer des situations                          engageant toute la sensibilité de l’être. Elle instaure à la fois un état                                intérieur et rapports avec le monde où l’affectivité prédomine.» Gilbert                           ROUGET, La musique et la transe, Gallimard, 1990


      Alors, je me décrirais plutôt comme quelqu'un qui souhaite vous raconter son histoire entremêlée de celle des autres. Et je ne sais sous quelle langue je devrais vous la raconter, peut-être en français ou en anglais, en macédonien, en bulgare ou en bosniaque. J'utiliserais le langage du cinéma et celui de leurs musiques.


     

      Sur un budget de 18.000€, excluant les frais de repérage, la collecte de crowdfunding représente 27% des revenus finaux. L'argent collecté financera le prochain et dernier tournage qui aura lieu en septembre 2016, frais de déplacement, hébergement, nourriture pour toute l'équipe sur une période de trois semaine. J'aimerais aussi investir dans du matériel, passer à l'utilisation de la BlackMagic Cinema Camera dont la version Pocket m'a démontré un rendu à la hauteur de mes attentes esthétiques. 

Dépenses :


Recettes :



     

                                      Réalisateur            Arnaud Lanouiller

                                      1 er Assistant         Hugo Renard

                                      Adaptation              Camille Binelli

                                      Image                         Arnaud Lanouiller 

                                                                            Hugo Renard

                                                                            Vania Ivanova

                                      Montage                    Arnaud Lanouiller

                                      Son et Musique     Jovana Backovic

                                      Artwork                     Camille Laurent


     


       Jovana Backovic est née à Belgrade en Serbie où elle a été diplômée à la faculté d'art musical en 2006. À côté de ces études elle fonde, organise, guide et compose pour le groupe "Arhai" qui se trouve être un mélange d'électro folk orchestré qui développe une fusion des musiques traditionnelles des Balkans avec des sons d'ambiances influencés de jazz, improvisations, utilisant des flûtes classique, un piano, des guitares électriques, basses et autres percussion, en accompagnant le tout de son chant. 


    

     Ici, la formule de campagne crowdfunding est basée sur un système flexible. Toute donation est comptabilisée même si l'objectif n'est pas atteint. Le choix est qu'il me faut écarter le risque zéro et que la moindre petite somme a son importance. En tant que donateur, vous offrez la possibilité à de jeunes artistes de s'exprimer et dans le cas présent, vous permettez à ce projet de film d'aller jusqu'à son aboutissement dans les meilleures conditions et surtout, vous vous inscrivez dans la liste des personnes m'ayant soutenu au moment où il le fallait.


     Mes remerciements les plus sincères.
Arnaud.L.




           

                                         

                                                        Arnaud Lanouiller
                                                               Réalisateur
                                                         + 33 665 03 72 27
                                                  arnaud.lanouiller@gmail.com

                                                          A Current Past - Facebook

                                                          A Current Past - Site Internet

                                                                              [.....]

Le cinéma documentaire, en tant que transmission subjective de savoir, m'est un choix essentiel, refléter le réel en art, en tirer un enseignement, puis le transmettre sous une forme qui aujourd'hui utilise le récit de voyage et d'expérience.

      Il y a deux ans et demi, l'ambition était de réaliser mon premier long métrage. Alors, je suis parti en vadrouille, seul, sinon avec ma voiture, parcourir les routes escarpées des Balkans pour découvrir de nouvelles musiques. Pourquoi les Balkans me direz-vous ? Car de ce que j'en connaissais, il y avait un trop large fossé entre Goran Bregovic de Serbie et le Mystère des Voix Bulgares, puis ses fanfares, ce balkans beat, ces sensations tziganes qui traversaient les frontières pour venir jusqu'à moi, jusqu'à nous.      
     Je ne comprenais pas et j'ai voulu savoir.



                                            «  Rien n’est plus chargé
d’associations émotionnelles que la                             musique, rien n’est mieux qu’elle
susceptible de recréer des situations                          engageant toute la sensibilité de l’être.
Elle instaure à la fois un état                                intérieur et rapports avec le monde où l’affectivité
prédomine.» Gilbert                           ROUGET, La musique et la transe, Gallimard, 1990

      Alors, je me décrirais plutôt comme quelqu'un qui souhaite vous
raconter son histoire entremêlée de celle des autres. Et je ne sais sous quelle langue je devrais vous la raconter, peut-être en français ou en anglais, en macédonien, en bulgare ou en bosniaque. J'utiliserais le langage du cinéma et celui de leurs musiques.


     
      Sur un budget de 18.000€, excluant les frais de repérage, la collecte de crowdfunding représente 27% des revenus finaux. L'argent collecté financera le prochain et dernier tournage qui aura lieu en septembre 2016, frais de déplacement, hébergement, nourriture pour toute l'équipe sur une période de trois semaine. J'aimerais aussi investir dans du matériel, passer à l'utilisation de la BlackMagic Cinema Camera dont la version Pocket m'a démontré un rendu à la hauteur de mes attentes esthétiques. 

Dépenses :





Recettes :






     
                                      Réalisateur            Arnaud Lanouiller
                                      1 er Assistant         Hugo Renard
                                      Adaptation              Camille Binelli
                                      Image                         Arnaud Lanouiller 
                                                                            Hugo Renard
                                                                            Vania Ivanova
                                      Montage                    Arnaud Lanouiller
                                      Son et Musique     Jovana Backovic
                                      Artwork                     Camille Laurent




     

       Jovana Backovic est née à Belgrade en Serbie où elle a été diplômée à la faculté d'art musical en 2006. À côté de ces études elle fonde, organise, guide et compose pour le groupe "Arhai" qui se trouve être un mélange d'électro folk orchestré qui développe une fusion des musiques traditionnelles des Balkans avec des sons d'ambiances influencés de jazz, improvisations, utilisant des flûtes classique, un piano, des guitares électriques, basses et autres percussion, en accompagnant le tout de son chant. 


    


     Ici, la formule de campagne crowdfunding est basée sur un système flexible. Toute donation est comptabilisée même si l'objectif n'est pas atteint. Le choix est qu'il me faut écarter le risque zéro et que la moindre petite somme a son importance. En tant que donateur, vous offrez la possibilité à de jeunes artistes de s'exprimer et dans le cas présent, vous permettez à ce projet de film d'aller jusqu'à son aboutissement dans les meilleures conditions et surtout, vous vous inscrivez dans la liste des personnes m'ayant soutenu au moment où il le fallait.

     Mes remerciements les plus sincères.Arnaud.L.






           
                                         
                                                        Arnaud Lanouiller                                                               Réalisateur                                                         + 33 665 03 72 27                                                  arnaud.lanouiller@gmail.com
                                                          A Current Past - Facebook
                                                          A Current Past - Site Internet
                                                                              [.....]

story:
I am Graig Brenton the creator of the original new TV series, BigFoot Town. It has taken many months but we have managed to assemble an amazing creative team of writers, actors and filmmakers, and with their combined efforts, have completed the filming of a pilot episode which has been submitted to a number of select broadcasters. The initial responses had me believing that BigFoot Town will be a success.

BigFoot Town is NOT about the hunt for Bigfoot, but rather, a comical series about a mayor who is trying to keep his town afloat after the shut down of the local mill. With businesses closing and residents leaving town, all hope seemed to be lost until the day that a few tourists captured something unusual on their cell phones and once posted to social media, went viral. The town then erupts with tourism and news media, leaving the mayor with a dilemma: should he reveal the truth behind the viral video, or embrace the hype for the sake of the town?

The success of this project involves more than just producing a television show, BigFoot Town has the potential to make the area were filming a thriving production centre bringing employment, investment capitol and notoriety to the area. In order to launch this show with the production of six episodes and we need your support to help make this a reality.

Unlike other productions that have been filmed in the area, BigFoot Town is completely written, produced, directed, acted, and filmed entirely by local talent thus any investments in the show will stay in the area. Even the video production company who is credited with the filming of the pilot (Wild Lupin Media).

story:
I AM A CREATIVE SOUL Feature length documentary

"I Am A Creative Soul" is a transformational feature length documentary from the award-winning filmmaker of "Today I acknowledge".

"It´s about life and when it happens..." Paul Cannon, musician

The last 4 years Jessie travelled back and forth to California, Sedona, Dublin and other places to find out about life. She had many questions in her heart. How is it possible to make a difference in this world, for our community, loved ones and how can we stay true to ourselves? Lead by synchronicity she met inspiring humans and became answers about creativity, forgiveness, gratitude and the difficulties of success. During the filmmaking process, she was confronted with the death of her father, framing the limited time that we have on this earth to create. From here on, the documentary unfolded naturally. The journey became the movie. It had a huge impact on Jessie`s life, the people she met and gives a whole new perspective on living, dying and creating. This film is a big inspiration to all of us to live our life to the fullest . 

The Protagonists in this movie are:

Extraordinary creative souls that encourage us to enjoy and transform all aspects of our lives.

Jessie spent time with each artist individually, hanging out, traveling, being around at sound checks. Allowing each to show him or herself in a natural and intimate way.You will see engaging artistic and deep interviews. The protagonists are extremely authentic and open. Each of the encounters offer intriguing and inspiring personal perspectives to a more fulfilled life. 


Jason Mraz (2 time grammy award winner/ Singer-songwriter) 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jason_Mraz

Terces and Matthew Engelhart (founder of the Café Gratitude) 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caf%C3%A9_Gratitude

Frank Ferrante (known from „May I be Frank“)

http://mayibefrankmovie.com/

Paul Cannon (singer-songwriter)

http://www.paulcannonband.com

Billy Joseph (singer-songwriter)                                                    

http://billyjoseph.com

David Kearney, (O.M.D.for, among others, the Beatles and Bob Dylon) 

http://www.powerhealing.com/kearney.html

James Mathers (painter, writer, Filmmaker)                                                          

http://www.jamesmathersart.com

Baptist de Pape (author and producer of "The Power of the Heart") 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jobk3Usi73k

Steve Poltz (singer-songwriter)                                                                  

http://poltz.com

Richard Martini (award- winning director&author of "the wonderful afterlife") 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Martini

D.on Darox and the Melody Joy Bakers (street musicians) 

https://youtu.be/M0TJT5TOH1Q

Dianne Porchia (MA, DMBM)                                    

http://porchiaswish.com/bio.html

Dean Huntley Chamberlain (The Motels,Code Blue, musician)        

http://www.the-motels.info/bios/D-Chamberlin-bi...

Helmut Hahner (Jessie´s father)

& many more creative souls


What your funding supports!


- Completing production of film

- Post-production including editing, sound and color

- Mastering a Digital Cinema Package (needed for theater screenings) 

- DVD production

- Distribution 

- Advertising and participating at festivals



The Impact

After watching the movie you will think differently about life, death and creativity and how our awareness about death helps us to really live our lives.

It opens our eyes to the field of transformational energy which is hidden in the processes of dying and creativity. Many of us are too frightend to look at these existential topics. Jessie dedicatedly uncovers the taboo topic of death.

The movie "I Am A Creative Soul" lifts you up to the possibility of change and becoming a peaceful warrior in these times.

We can only make a difference in the world when we are open to change perspectives.

With supporting "I am a creative soul" you are becoming not just a part of the movie but also part of a movement: 

A movement of many to a more creative and self determined path.


Risks & Challenges by watching the movie


Risks: To fall in Love with Yourself and Life...
Challenges: To stay true to Yourself no matter what...

Thank you for sharing the campaign and telling your friends!

Every single one of us can make a difference!
Thank you so much for making this film happen and bringing more love, trust and consciousness into the world.
Share this campaign everywhere and with everyone you know. Great ways to achieve this is through Facebook, the Indiegogo share tools provided, Twitter, Instagram or just spread the word! 
YOU ARE A MIRACLE!

story:
Introduction 

Hi, I’m Phil, director of our upcoming short film “At Dawn”. The film is set in World War One, where we aim to be as authentic as possible whilst having a very dramatic storyline. This film will be a tremendous achievement for us. Our crew have worked on high quality short films before, however, this particular project has everyone very excited. Your contributions make this film possible and will further the production value of the film. 

 Equipment 

We already have at our disposal a great range of professional equipment. We have chosen to shoot on the Arri Amira, as it is an industry level camera which is used on many well known productions, such as ‘Game of Thrones’. We’re also using high quality sound recording equipment, such as the Zoom H6  and are in need of hiring extra  lighting.

 Funds needed 

We’re aiming to raise £3,000 to make this film possible. This will enable us to hire professional actors, pay for accommodation, hire transport and any extra camera/ lighting equipment which are essential for our shoot. 

 Schedule 

Our proposed filming dates are Friday 17th – Sunday 19th June 2016. We will have finished casting two weeks before, and have secured our necessary locations. With your help, it will be possible to make this short costume drama as epic as we imagine.

Scene examples

story:
Short Summary

Smoke and Roses, is a Drama/Romance short film about a young man called Raymond who falls in love with terminally ill english teacher, Nikolina. The story follows Raymond who starts to struggle with balancing his past lifestyle with what he believes is his future. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £6000 in order to make sure we can make this film to the best of our ability, with £2,000 already raised we are confident to raise the rest with your help!
Your contributions will tackling expenses such as Equipment Hire, Locations, Cast and Crew expenses whilst shooting this exciting project! A percentage will help with the submission of our film into Film Festivals.
To say thank you for your contributions there are a list of perks we offering! 
This includes a copy of the film, Original artwork and soundtracks created exclusively for the film, as well as shout out on our social media pages and feature on new section called 'DMND in the dirt' found on the production company's website.

The Impact

Your contribution will help bring change more diversity in British film as well raising more awareness of Brain Cancer, a factor that one of our characters suffers from.

Not only does your contribution help fund a film, it provides an opportunity for several young people who are passionate about filmmaking. To make sure we are playing our part, we will also be offering minor roles to potential filmmakers who may be interested in going into a career but have never had an opportunity being on a professional set. This is because we believe that when you can it is always good to give back to the community you have come from. 


The Team

Director

Dijian Eccles is a mixture of music and film, working with many leading professionals in the industry, he has developed his own style of storytelling through Music Promo's has had experience from the smallest all the way through biggest productions. 

Producer

Tony Longe, a freelance Producer has led many projects in the entertainment industry, this includes producing content for Film, TV, Commercial and Music Videos. Working in the industry has given him a large network of highly skilled freelancers and content producers. Currently studying Digital Film Production at Ravensbourne, whilst managing a range of Directors. 
Director of Photography 

Joseph Nkadi an upcoming cinematographer, who spent the last three years Gaffering on a wide range of sets has become fairly known for  deeply understanding the use of light. His ability to create spectacular shots has given him the opportunity to lead the visual side of this film, we look forward to seeing his great hands at work!
1st AD 

Christopher Chuky is a passionate film director and writer. His performing arts background has given him both the understanding as an actor and director. Chuky uses this to his advantage as he is able understand and apply himself to any project and still provide a great service.

Gaffer 

Ola Aworentan, a talented cinematographer  who has recently been awarded with a Warner Brother's Scholarship will be using his expertise to work as a Gaffer on the film. Ola has worked on a range of short films to commercials and music videos in the past is aspiring to shoot a feature film by the end of next year. 

Risks & Challenges

Studying Digital Film Production at Ravensbourne University I have have the privilege to meet some other great filmmakers. These people will support this production and I am very happy we will be able to contribute to a project that will hopefully have an influence on the society we live in. 

We do face a lot of problems seeing as we will be shooting the film over the course of three days, however through our strategic planning we aim to make sure every scene is perfect however aim to make sure we stay on track with schedule.
Although your help would be very much appreciated, if we aren't able to make the remaining budget through this campaign, we will still put our all into creating this film as we still need a film to graduate.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to contribute with money, however you can still help. 
Got Facebook, Twitter or even Instagram? You can share this campaign to help get the word around and let others of this great project!
We deeply appreciate you reading this campaign and hope you enjoy the end product! 
Any further enquires please email us at:
 smokeandrosesshortfilm@gmail.com
www.smokeandrosesshortfilm.com
Twitter: SmokeandRosesSF

story:
The Bagpipe Maker's Baby is a short film to be produced in and around Hull and East Yorkshire during spring and summer, 2016. The film is a live action short fairy tale with a folk tale twist.

The Bagpipe Maker’s Baby is a tale of a man who is asked by a mysterious figure to repair an unrepairable bagpipe. Once he begins the reconstruction of it, he finds the characters he meets on the way and even the pipes themselves are part of something much more, and the reality of his situation begins to unfold before him.

This ambiguous story is open to interpretation and is interpreted differently by everyone.

Writer/Producer - Julian Woodford

Julian is a poet, playwright, writer, editor, journalist and PR executive. His work has been widely published and performed in the UK and abroad. He is chairman of Artlink and lives and works in Hull.

Director/Producer - Chris Hopkin

Chris is currently in his last year at Open University studying Film and Creative Media. His repertoire of productions include Music Videos, Film, Documentary and Adverts. This is Chris’ first Short Film he is directing but his in-depth idea development, creative visual concepts, coupled with, his keen eye for camera techniques, detail and visual aesthetics.

Production Manager/1st Assistant Director - Emily Brown

Emily is a Graduate in Film and Television Design from Hull. Having experience of developing productions at university, The Bagpipe Maker’s Baby is her first step out into the realm of Production Management within the industry. Having a keen eye for detail and a relentless attitude to working has earned her the title of “Bossy”.

Concept Designer/Story Board Artist - Owen Roach

Owen’s talent lies in capturing the essence of an idea and concept and translating it into drawings as you can tell from the concept art. He is a designer, illustrator and animator with extensive experiencing ranging across professional marketing, self published comics and micro budget film making.

Director of Photography - Kristof Bilski

Owner of Astor Productions, Kris has experience in creating adverts, music videos and has Directed his own short film.

Drone Operator - Chris Fenton

Chris from OctoVision Media, will be our Drone Operator and will be capturing the shots from out at sea to in land. 


Set Designer - Mathew Bibby 

Our Set Designer, who everyone calls Bibby, is responsible for designing, creating and dressing the sets. As he develops the concepts we will be adding them here and to our Social Networking pages.

Set Builder - Martin King

Martin is an expert builder and will be assisting Bibby with making the set. He has been recently spending time in Calais, France helping build refugee camps.

Props Creators - Emily Clay

Our favorite Props Creator, Emily, has been developing the strange bagpipes the story is based around. Having worked with Chris Hopkin and Emily Brown before she was the first call made when crew was being recruited for her expertise in creating usual props.

More Crew will be added as more roles are filled....

Our cast are three very talented artists who have a lot of experience working together at the East Riding Theatre in Beverley. They have extensive experience in Theater acting and a bit of film acting. They were chosen for their chemistry together and the way they portrayed their characters.

Gordon Meredith - The Bagpipe Maker

Anne Kirkman - The Woman

Richard Avery - The Old Man

Hornsea, East Yorkshire, United Kingdom

The money you contribute to this film will be allocated to some of the most important parts of the Budget. This is a breakdown of where the money will be going. Additionally there will be a detailed version of the Budget available from the 26th February 2016.

Crew

We have many skilled film makers joining us on this production and some require finances for their time and equipment.

Production Expenses

Arts Department - This is everything from building the set and dressing it to the costumes and make-up departments. 

Production Tools - This includes radios and the cost of the Drone.

Insurance

The Health and Safety of the crew, cast and public is very important to us, so we are investing time and some of the budget into looking after ourselves and others using the sea front.

Cast and Crew Care

Travel - Most of the Cast and Crew are located in Hull and Beverley which is a fair few miles from the Location, this part of the budget is so we can all get there.

Meals - Because we can't have hungry Cast and Crew.

Facilities - The location we are filming at does not have a working toilet so we are hiring a portable toilet for the duration of the filming.

Festivals 

We are very keen to enter this short into some Film Festivals to raise awareness of our company, ourselves and more importantly the industry in Hull and East Yorkshire.

We have developed the perks so you can have a piece of the film and be involved in the promotion. It is very important to us that you enjoy the art work and the concept of the film.

This is our first steps towards creating more films, The Bagpipe Maker's Baby is our baby and our debut as a film making group.

Our aim is to develop our Company, Dead Bod Films and contribute to the small film industry in Hull and East Yorkshire. There is a lot of talent and professionals here that have a passion for the art of film but it’s only a small industry, we want to make it grow and be more recognized within the UK.

Currently we have a company, called Double Click, supporting us by working on our website and branding that we will add in here once it is finished.
story_txt:
The
Bagpipe Maker's Baby is a short film to
be produced in and around Hull and East Yorkshire during spring and summer,
2016. The film is a live action short fairy tale with a folk tale twist.
The Bagpipe Maker’s Baby is
a tale of a man who is asked by a mysterious figure to repair an unrepairable
bagpipe. Once he begins the reconstruction of it, he finds the characters he
meets on the way and even the pipes themselves are part of something much more,
and the reality of his situation begins to unfold before him.
This ambiguous story is
open to interpretation and is interpreted differently by everyone.
Writer/Producer - Julian WoodfordJulian is a poet, playwright, writer, editor, journalist and PR executive. His work has been widely published and performed in the UK and abroad. He is chairman of Artlink and lives and works in Hull.
Director/Producer - Chris Hopkin
Chris is currently in his
last year at Open University studying Film and Creative Media. His repertoire
of productions include Music Videos, Film, Documentary and Adverts. This
is Chris’ first Short Film he is directing but his in-depth idea development,
creative visual concepts, coupled with, his keen eye for camera techniques,
detail and visual aesthetics.
Production
Manager/1st Assistant Director - Emily Brown
Emily is a Graduate in Film and Television Design from Hull. Having
experience of developing productions at university, The Bagpipe Maker’s Baby is
her first step out into the realm of Production Management within the industry.
Having a keen eye for detail and a relentless attitude to working has earned
her the title of “Bossy”.

story:
Short Summary

People need to see this!

CHOREO is a one-of-a-kind film: art, story, and performance. It's dance choreography behind-the-scenes, the creative process, and jaw-dropping dance.

The filmmaker, Nathalie Malette, is creator of the dance app Dancemaker, and a professional producer. She's taking her passion for dance to tv and the big screen with this film set for release this summer in Toronto.

• we need to cover some crucial expenses to reach the finale...

•…wrap it up with the integrity that already runs through the film.

• and make it available to audiences AROUND THE WORLD.

What we need and what you get

•WE ARE SO CLOSE! The final touches by key technical creatives will take this film to the next level, and wrap it up with maximum production value.

•Dance is a unique niche market, your support will help us reach our audience through marketing to broadcasters, festivals, and the global dance world.

•Support this dance film, and you can be the first to receive a digital download of the film, AND receive an on-screen credit.

Other ways you can help:

It's easy to be a hero. SHARE SHARE SHARE. Support this campaign and these budding art giants. The world needs them, will embrace them, and they will inspire others. We need your help.

"Dance is the hidden language of the soul" ---- Martha Graham

"Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind".  ---- Dr. Seuss

story:
All Tom Randolph ever wanted was to be a ventriloquist, but those dreams turn to nightmares when he discovers his new dummy is possessed by the spirit of a deceased foul-mouthed former ventriloquist with a chip on his shoulder and a body-count in the hundreds.   



Hey folks! Thanks for taking the time to check out our page. V.D. is the latest film from Razor Sharp Studios, the creators of the award-winning PORKCHOP saga as well as Zombie Babies, The Crawling Dead, and STEVE: Death Collector. Ventriloquist dummies have always freaked us out a little bit. Okay, not just a little bit. A lot. But for some reason, there have only been a couple of iconic dummies in horror history. We've decided to change that. We're out to create a FUN, RAUNCHY, GORE-FILLED HORROR CLASSIC with an iconic killer that people will talk about for years to come. It's going to be as inventive as it is nasty. It will also be the FIRST RAZOR SHARP MOVIE to be FILMED ENTIRELY IN HOLLYWOOD! 


WHAT WE WANT TO DO AND WHAT YOU GET! 

These dummies aren't cheap, ya'll. The one in our pitch videos is not what we want to use for the final film. We want a fully-controllable puppet with moving eyes and that control-stick thingy. You know....the fancy one. We also want to bring in a FAMOUS CELEBRITY VOICE-ACTOR to do the voice of our title character. We're planning on doing some other great stuff as well like FEEDING OUR ACTORS, CLOTHING THEM, and HAVING THE MOVIE EDITED.  All of our movies to date have been made usually with a $3,000 or less budget and we've managed to get them distributed and spread around the globe. Most people even LIKE 'EM. Even Ain't It Cool News raved about the PORKCHOP Trilogy, calling it "good." We want to turn that "good" into a "great" and make this the most kick-ass Razor Sharp flick yet! 


What do you get? Well, let's see: 

  • Blu-ray and DVD (autographed by cast-and-crew)
  • Producer Credits
  • Props from the film!
  • Wardrobe from the film!
  • The dummies used in the film and the IndieGoGo videos!


THIS IS KIND OF A BIG DEAL FOR US.

Our dream has always been to shoot a movie in Hollywood. With V.D. we feel like it's the perfect opportunity to film something true to who WE ARE, not compromising our vision in any way, but taking advantage of all the resources the town has to offer. We want to expand our creative horizons and create something awesome for horror fans. We are all die-hard obsessed horror fans with a true love for the genre. All we've ever wanted to do was give back and contribute something to fans like us, give them something fun to watch and maybe give them a scare or two.

By making a contribution to our campaign, you show that you believe in non-watered-down independent cinema. With every dollar, you show Hollywood that you don't want PG-13 movies with no blood, breasts, or brains. 


Q&A:

  • WILL THERE BE GORE?
Yes, we are planning to have loads of gore in this one, provided by some of our award-winning special effects artists! We've been praised in the past for our adherence to old-school practical special effects and this film will be no different, except for the fact that there will be a LOT MORE of it! 
  • WHO WILL BE DOING THE VOICE OF THE DUMMY?
We have someone in mind who would be perfect! We'll be making announcements later on! 
  • HOW ARE YOU GOING TO SHOOT THIS?
The film will be shot entirely in 4K Ultra HD! Our first 4K feature film!

We will continue adding your questions to the Q&A! Keep asking!

story:
Introduction 

My name is Taylor Reynolds and I'm a Digital Arts major at Chapman University emphasizing in Animation. I am the director, writer, and story artist for AKI, my 3D animated senior thesis film which will be  ​screened in May 2017. The film will be entirely in Japanese, with English subtitles.

With the help of my producer, Aidan Wood, I have created this campaign to help fund the production of this film and enable the production team to create the story we have set in motion. 

What is the story of AKI? 

AKI is set in Edo-period Japan, around the  mid 1700's.
​Kiyo, a  young servant girl working for a merchant family in the city of Kyoto, is living away from her family in the country while she earns wages to bring home. Her daily life consists of chores given to her by the wife of the merchant, called Master, who orders her around with strictness and high expectations. 

One day, Kiyo comes across an injured stray dog in an alleyway in town. They become fast friends, and are no longer alone in the world. Kiyo names the dog Aki, meaning Autumn, after the season in which they met. She has to be careful to conceal her new friend from her master, and plans to take Aki with her when she's saved enough money to return home. 

Seasons change from fall to winter. A chance encounter in an alleyway with a nasty rogue samurai, the Ronin, changes Kiyo and Aki's  fate . Kiyo is forced to confront her beliefs in good fortune,  or make the biggest sacrifice of her life. 

Where will my funding go? 

Funding for AKI will be primarily used towards supplemental talent and freelance work aiding the production of this film. The most notable roles include:
  • A composer. To give this film the emotional, poignant score it deserves, we will be working with a professional film composer to write the music for AKI. 
  • Voice actors. We are lucky to have the talented voices of professional actors and actresses giving life to the characters of AKI, and this funding will be used to supplement their payment as the cast of a student film. 
  • Freelance animators. As an animation emphasis, I plan on covering the majority of animation myself. However, the ability to bring on 1 or 2 freelance animators to assist with the workload will allow for more passes and refinement of the more technical sequences. 
  • Rigging. I am already in contact with a professional rigger to assist with this technical and intensive aspect of 3D animation. Your funding will help me pay for this service and more quickly expedite the production of functional 3D characters. 
As the director and artistic lead of the film, I will be taking on the majority of the workload, which includes design, modeling, texturing, set dressing, previs, animation, compositing, and rendering. However, this funding will allow me to connect with fellow artists and talent to assist with the production, resulting in a smoother pipeline and the high-caliber polish of a multi-person endeavor. Additionally, this film will be worked on by multiple students in my program, helping to make this a collaborative educational process. 

Our cast and supervising crew 

Crew:

Taylor Reynolds - Director

Aidan Wood - Producer
Franz Xavier de Manuel - Script Editor
Cast: 
Sascha Tominaga - Kiyo
Sohee Park - The Ronin
Kazumi Zatkin - The Master
Dee Bradley Baker - Aki

What progress has been made already? 

  • Concept and beats

  • Story reel

  • Character designs

  • Concept sculptures

  • Shot list

  • Asset list

  • Information website

  • Asana group project coordination

  • Recording sessions for voice acting talent

What is currently in progress?

  • Storyboard staging revisions

  • Previsualization in Maya

  • Color script development

  • Reference collection

  • Character model for Kiyo

  • Indiegogo preparations

  • Prop design

Risks & Challenges 

With every animated production, the biggest challenge is time and time management. With assets like the Asana project coordinator and a production hierarchy managing output and freelance collaboration, the AKI team is prepared to create a dynamic production schedule that prepares us to effectively complete the film while leaving room for flexibility and adjustment. Any amount of contribution will make a difference in our pipeline and will expedite the efforts needed to comfortably complete this film. 

Other Ways You Can Help  

If you are unable to contribute, please feel free to share this project with others who may be interested! We can't wait for the world to experience this story and will appreciate any effort to share our work with others!

story:
About the Project

The Ice Bullet helps you pack a smarter cooler by freezing your beer to replace ice allowing you to pack more of what you love. By encapsulating the weakest part of the can and allowing room for expansion at the concave bottom you can avoid the explosion. The Ice Bullet lasts longer than ice so you can keep your cooler colder longer. 

How it Started

The concept came from Zack's annual rafting trip in Idaho. Trying to keep beer cold until the last day where temperatures can reach 100+ degrees is nearly impossible. To keep the beer cold until the last day the beer would have to be colder from the start or use more ice. Using more ice wasn't an option because of limited cooler space and freezing the cans would cause them to explode in the freezer. After three days in the hot sun, Zack thought that by containing the weakest part of the can and exploiting the concave bottom would allow the cans to freeze without exploding.


How it was Developed

Back home from Idaho, Zack shared his idea with Joe which led to some interesting proof of concept experiments. We started with cardboard boxes and concrete - there were a few can explosions, but thankfully no one was injured. After the general concept was proven, Zack built an epoxy fixture which allowed for repeatable trials. After a summer of data collection Zack finalized drawings for the Ice Bullet tool build.


Progress

Simply place your beer upside down in the base, twist to lock, and freeze.


Meet the Team


Support Us Now!

Our tool is built and our U.S. manufacturer is ready to go. All we need is some help to make our first production run. We have designed our manufacturing process to deliver ready-to-ship product so you can start freezing your cans before the summer heat is here.

Simply place your beer upside down in the base, twist to lock, and freeze.   


Meet the Team




Support Us Now!
Our tool is built and our U.S. manufacturer is ready to go. All we need is some help to make our first production run. We have designed our manufacturing process to deliver ready-to-ship product so you can start freezing your cans before the summer heat is here.

story:
Introduction

Antidepressants make you wait 6 weeks for minimal relief of anxiety and depression. They don't work well for many people, have harsh side effects, and contaminate waterways with fish and other aquatic animals being adversely affected. Anti-anxiety drugs work faster, but they're addictive, harmful, and contaminating the environment. We want to develop the first medicine to combine effectiveness, fast action, and safety (for people and the environment). We've gathered crucial preclinical data, but the Food & Drug Administration (FDA) requires more research before we can use our medicine in people. Moreover, our lead compound is a biodegradable peptide that will not accumulate in the brain or environment. Help us to complete ourmission. 


Publicity about Akhu Therapeutics

Check out articles about us on the websites listed below. 

Huffington Post

The Best Brain Possible


Endorsements from Clinical and Medical Leaders

"As a psychiatrist, I am well acquainted with the limitations of medications for depression and anxiety. As a scientist, I recognize that Akhu Therapeutics has developed a very promising alternative medication. The FDA requires more research before this medical breakthrough can be used in people. Contributions to Akhu’s crowdfunding campaign will help them complete that research."

James G. Gibbs, MD

Psychiatrist, Community Mental Health Clinic, Bennettsville, SC

Professor Emeritus, Psychiatry, Cornell University Medical College, New York, NY


"A donation to Akhu Therapeutics will fuel the exciting possibility of ... faster medicines for depression and anxiety." 

Stanley J. Watson, MD, PhD                                                                                              

Co-Director & Research Professor, Molecular & Behavioral Neuroscience Institute

Professor of Neurosciences in Psychiatry, University of Michigan Medical School, Ann Arbor, MI


“If Akhu Therapeutics can provide safe medications with rapid onset of action … this will revolutionize patient care.”

Lisa Thompson, MD                                                                                                     President & Founder, e-PalliativeCare.com, Telehealth Network Provider at OCN Physicians, P.C.


“It would be great if there were other alternatives to these medications that often have so many side effects. Caurnel Morgan, PhD may have the answer.”

LaTasha Kimbrough, MS                                                                                             Certified Mental Health Therapist, Weems Community Mental Health, Brandon, MS


“As a pharmacist, I have analyzed antidepressant use by patients and I am aware that a huge unmet medical need lies behind depression. Patients are in urgent need of a drug with a short onset of action and I believe Akhu’s drug could really solve this need.”

Lucía Pérez Kempner, BPharm, MBS                                                               Pharmacist


Read more at Endorsements - AkhuTherapeutics.com


Campaign Goal and Use of Donations

We will use 90% of these funds on essential research and development for our medicine (see Table 1). If you donate $500 or more, 10% of that donation will go to the Web of Influence (in your name) to help transition survivors of domestic violence to self-sufficiency. If we exceed our campaign goal, we will scale up and reach our scientific goal faster.

Table 1. Use of Crowdfunding Donations

Preparing our medicine for humans

65%

Drug  Research & Development (90%)

Laboratory facility

25%


Indiegogo fee

5%

Fees (10%)

PayPal or Stripe fee

3%

PR & promotional fees

1.5%

Legal fees

0.5%

The Burden of Emotional Disorders

We're developing medicine to be faster, more effective, and safer than currently available drugs for anxiety and depression. Our goal is to extinguish these mental illnesses whenever they pop up, not just mask their symptoms briefly. 

Anxiety and depression cause a million deaths each year, and are major causes of disability and susceptibility to other illnesses. Antidepressants and anxiolytics help some people, but millions do not respond to antidepressants, and long-term use of anxiolytics is addictive and harmful to the brain.  

What is Akhu Therapeutics Doing Differently?

We're developing  melanocortin blockers, and our they work extremely well. Decades ago 1st- and 2nd-generation melanocortin blockers were shown to be 3X more effective, 8X faster acting, and 10X less likely to cause side effects as antidepressants. 

Our 3rd-generation melanocortin blockers are 3X more effective and 1,000X faster acting than antidepressants without side effects in proven animal models. 

With your help, we will prepare our medicine to test in humans. Because our medicine is biodegradable, it is highly unlikely to harm the environment. In contrast, anxiolytics and antidepressants remain active outside the body. So, they enter waterways and harm fish and other aquatic animals.

You Can Help in Different Ways

Please spread the word that Akhu Therapeutics is working to make a difference for people suffering from anxiety and depression. Let someone else know about our efforts to develop fundamentally different medicine.

How?

1. Tap the Indiegogo share buttons.

2. Visit our website (akhutherapeutics.com).

3. Share, make a comment, and like our YouTube video.

4. Encourage someone else to do the same.

THANK YOU!!!
story_txt:
Introduction
Antidepressants make you wait 6 weeks for minimal relief of anxiety and depression. They don't work well for many people, have harsh side effects, and contaminate waterways with fish and other aquatic animals being adversely affected. Anti-anxiety drugs work faster, but they're addictive, harmful, and contaminating the environment. We want to develop the first medicine to combine effectiveness, fast action, and safety (for people and the environment). We've gathered crucial preclinical data, but the Food & Drug Administration (FDA) requires more research before we can use our medicine in people. Moreover, our lead compound is a biodegradable peptide that will not accumulate in the brain or environment. story:
* Movie which you can see above is the first part of


theTRILOGY - of short fiction movies based on true stories - it's called 

                          "The Fish of My Life" 
It was one very successful project which attended and won many prizes in festivals around the world. It isn't just a funny story about, let's be honest, a dumb man. It tells a story about our everyday life, routine, boredom and endless aspirations. But do we really need that much? 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Now let us introduce you the second part - 


"THE WOLF OF MY LIFE" 

*** 10 Facts you need to know about the upcoming movie : 

 

1. Short Fiction/Drama/Black Comedy (Second part of the trilogy)
2. Based on a true story which took place 6 years ago in Lithuania 
3. Will be shot on 35mm 
4. Approx. 7mins length 
5. No Dialogue 
6. Will be shot in wintertime 
7. There will be a ridiculous crime
8. There will be a wolf  
9. There will be blood 
10. You won't be scared, you'll be surprised  

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*** Short Sinopsis
This is a story based on real events, real crime. It happened 6 years ago in a small village in Lithuania. Till nowadays you can find a lot of articles about it. This story touched thousands and thousands of people. They were shocked, angry or simply couldn't believe it, but... at the same time, it made a lot of people         laugh . That's right. They were laughing. So did we (a bit). We can't tell you more because this is only 7mins movie, if we tell you one thing - this is almost the whole story. The only thing we promise - you'll be surprised. The only question which will be bothering us till the premiere-  are you going to cry? or laugh? 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


*** Team

We won't waste your time telling about how good and professional these people are, but we assure you  - they love this idea and will do their best no matter what. Please meet: 

DIRECTOR/ CINEMATOGRAPHER/ WRITER 
Julius Siciunas
 Julius' IMDB


PRODUCER

Dagne Puodziunaite 

Dagne's IMDB


PRODUCTION DESIGNER 

Ieva Cerniauskaite 

Ieva's IMDB

This is just a small part of the whole crew. We picked up the top 3 prettiest faces for the campaign. Fingers crossed the rest won't read this. 

*** Money 

To make this happen people will work absolutely for free. So mostly, we need funds for technique. We already have  1000m of film (it is already sitting in producer's fridge, but seriously - in fridge); we have funds to rent a camera, camera's equipment, costumes, transportation. But we still missing some. And here we are asking for your support.  
WE ARE MISSING SOME DOLLARS FOR:
Film Developing & Scans ($2000)
Art Department (for props) ($1000)
Lighting Equipment ($500)
Special effects (guns, squibs, fake blizzard) ($300)
Other expenses ($200)
For every donation, we offer some veeeeery good perks! Check them on the right side of the page -----> 

EVERY DOLLAR IS VERY IMPORTANT TO US. 
1 DOLLAR = 5 CUPS OF HOT TEA FOR COLD COLD CREW AND ACTORS (it is around - 10'C here in Lithuania and we are shooting outside)
AND OF COURSE, EVERY SHARE OR EVEN A LITTLE NOISE SPREAD IS PRICELESS. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

THANK YOU!!!
